content: No run.
Another one that just dies on the pitch. Full and outside off, nibbling away, Jadeja pushes at it, but gets beaten on the outside edge. Smith collects it behind as the ball dribbles towards him.
Short of a length, angling on middle. Jadeja swivels and pulls it through square leg.

Slower and fuller, outside off, Ravindra Jadeja leaves and the ball goes on a couple of bounces to the keeper. Smith there fumbles to gather it, but manages to keep it away from the helmet behind him.
Fractionally full and outside off, Jadeja cuts it in front of square to deep cover.
A proper bouncer, on off, Siraj ducks.

Silly mid on ambushing Siraj. Targets the body, on a length, jagging in. Siraj tries to duck under it, but the ball just dies on the bounce and he takes his eyes off as well in evasive action. Manages to fend it to the right of Ollie Pope at silly mid on.
Hard length, outside off, Jadeja punches it through point for a single. 150 is up for India and that brings in some cheers.
Lands full and outside off, Jadeja pushes it to the right of the bowler. Carse stops it.
Attacks the stumps, a slower one at 117 kph. Jadeja makes room at first but adjusts to steer it to the leg side.
Full and around off, at 135 kph, Jadeja gets on front foot and drives it along the turf to long off.
Edged, but Siraj sustains! Back of a length, on off, nipping away. Siraj gets squared up but plays with soft hands and the ball goes off the outside edge in front of gully.
Into the surface but that goes way down leg. Siraj lets it pass through and Jamie Smith dives to his left and gathers it.
Wide on off, on a length, Jadeja liberates his arms and cuts it to deep backward point for a single. Siraj to face the last two deliveries again.
Bowls another slower yorker, on off, Jadeja shovels it out and works it through mid on.
Shortish delivery, outside off, Jadeja drags it with the pull shot to deep mid-wicket.
A slower yorker, at 117 kph, on off, Jadeja drills it to mid on.
Siraj manages to survive! Full again, nipping back into the batter. Siraj again with the forward defence.
Full and on the stumps, Siraj brings the bat in front of the pad and blocks it back to the bowler.

Takes the single on the fourth ball and leaves Siraj to face the last two balls. A searing yorker from Carse, in front of the stumps, Jadeja tries to flick it away but the ball goes off the leading edge and runs wide of gully to deep third for a single.
Short of a good length, outside off, Jadeja stands tall and cuts it square to deep backward point.
Into the stumps, on a length, Jadeja blocks it off the back foot.
Outside off, on a length, at 134 kph. Jadeja hangs back and taps it out to the backward point region. The man from gully gets to it.
On top of middle, on a short length. Siraj rides the bounce and taps it onto the surface with soft hands.
Good length, on middle, Siraj dabs it back to the bowler.
Nagging length, outside off, Siraj leaves.

OUT! STRAIGHT UP IN THE AIR, AND TAKEN! Stokes again with the breakthrough and England are now just one wicket away! Bumrah runs out of patience! Stokes sticks to bowling short into the pitch, on off. Jasprit Bumrah tries to take the short ball on and looks to pull, but badly mistimes. It balloons high in the air, over mid on. Sam Cook, the substitute fielder, who is in for Bashir, locks his eyes on the ball and takes a good reverse cup catch over his head. Jadeja helplessly watches it from the other end as Bumrah goes back to the pavilion. India are 147/9.
Jasprit Bumrah c sub Sam Cook b Ben Stokes 5 (54b 1x4 0x6)
Short delivery, angling on the bodyline. Bumrah gets behind the line and taps it on the bounce to Ollie Pope at forward short leg.
Stokes is really testing Bumrah with the short stuff here. Into the pitch, on top of off. Bumrah just about manages to drop his wrists down and sways away from the line.
A fielder now comes up at a flying slip. Carse hones in the channel on off, on a length. Jadeja bunts it on the surface, off the inner half of the bat.
Skids through the surface, on middle. Jadeja hops off and tucks it to short mid-wicket.

A hasty single and a roar goes up in the crowd! Back of a length, on the leg stump. Jasprit Bumrah goes inside the crease and brings the bat in front to tuck it to the vacant mid on region. Ollie Pope from forward short leg sprints towards the ball but the batters cross for a single.
Spears in full and on leg, with some bounce. Jasprit Bumrah forces it to the leg side. That's played off the splice.
Jags back in from the surface, on middle. Bumrah fends it with soft hands in front of forward short leg.
And again! Short delivery, on off, Jasprit Bumrah misses the pull shot and it carries behind.
WIDE! Goes after that, does Bumrah! Short and well over head height. Bumrah shapes to play the pull shot, but misses. Wide called for height.
Too wide on off, on a fullish length. Ravindra Jadeja lets it pass alone. Looks quizzically at the umpire for a wide, but it's within the tramline.

BEATEN! That's loose from Jadeja! Well bowled by Stokes! Pitched full and just straightens from the off stump line. Ravindra Jadeja pushes away from his body and the ball flirts past the outside edge.
A tempter, wide on off, Ravindra Jadeja prevents himself from poking at it.
Fires it on a length, and on middle, Ravindra Jadeja gets on the back foot and blocks it off.
Short and going down leg. Jadeja shuffles inside the line and makes the leave.
Too full, on middle, Jadeja forces it down to mid on.

FOUR LEG BYES! Important runs these for the Indians as the target trims below 50! Pushed through quicker and fuller, but down the leg stump line. It spins sharply and Bumrah misses the flick. The ball grazes the front pad and bisects the keeper and the leg slip fielder to run away to the fence behind.

Very full, and flighted above the batter's eyeline, Jasprit Bumrah has a hack at it. Ben Stokes at wide mid on does not pick it but the ball is hit well wide of him to his right towards deep mid-wicket. No single taken.
Pitched full, turning in from off, Bumrah with a giant stride forward, keeps it out.
Pushed through, on a length, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja goes back in the crease and steers it behind square leg for a single.
Flat and full, sliding on the pads, at 95 kph, Jadeja nudges it behind to deep fine leg.
Quicker and shorter, outside off, Jadeja punches it away to deep point.
Just survives! Short delivery again, angling on the leg stump line. Jasprit Bumrah first shapes up to leave, but then fends it on the bounce to the forward short leg fielder.
Shoots into the batter, on a length, Bumrah hops across and drops it across to the leg side, beside the pitch.
Stokes tests Bumrah with a rib-tickler on the leg stump line. Bumrah looks to steer into the leg side off the back foot, but gets it off the gloves and the ball bounces behind.
Short and on off, nipping in. Bumrah on the tip-toes, drops it to the off side with soft hands.

Full and on middle, clipped to deep backward square leg for a single. Jadeja is keen for the second and rushes off but Bumrah does not move a muscle after getting to the other end, and sends Jadeja back. The replay shows that Bumrah just jogged off for that single.
Slides down leg, on a length. Jadeja gets inside the line and leaves.
Flatter and on middle, Bumrah manages to block it forward.
Turns in from the rough patch outside off, Bumrah clips the full ball to short leg.
Nice and full, spins in on middle. Bumrah leans forward and eases it back to Bashir.
Short and outside off, punched through covers for a single.

A bit of spin on that one as it turns away from off, on a fullish length. Ravindra Jadeja takes his bottom hand off the handle and opens the bat face and guides to the left of the diving first slip fielder. Bumrah is around halfway for a single, but is sent back by Jadeja as the ball rolls to deep third.
Full and flat, on off, Jadeja defends on the front foot.

Ben Stokes goes into the wicket and this climbs onto the batter, around off, Bumrah tries to take the short ball on and swings but fails to connect. Bumrah looks towards Paul Reiffel at square leg for a wide for height but the umpire thinks otherwise.
On off, on a short of a length, Bumrah steers it to deep backward point.
There comes the short ball, over off, Jasprit Bumrah gets his bat high to hook it away but fails to connect. A shake of the head in disapproval at the shot selection by Jadeja at the other end.

Huge nip-backer, on a length and on off. Jasprit Bumrah is caught in the crease as he looks to work it across. Plays all over the line and is beaten on the inside edge before getting pinged on the right thigh pad. Just not full enough to squeeze out a possible LBW appeal.
A yard behind full, on off, Bumrah with the forward defence on the off side.
An attempted bouncer, on top of off, Jasprit Bumrah gets across the line and nudges it to the leg side with soft hands.
A maiden to start for Bashir. With the field coming up, this is floated through the air, too full and on off, Ravindra Jadeja carves it out but straight to short cover.
Touch full and outside off, spinning away. Jadeja cuts it to backward point.
Half an appeal for LBW, but not given. Stokes signals an inside edge instantly. Drifts into the batter, on a dragged length. Ravindra Jadeja goes back to block but gets an inside edge on the pads.
Slides on middle and leg, full in length, Jadeja lunges forward and defends it.
Flighted fuller, 95 kph, on off, Jadeja pushes it back to the bowler.
Shoaib Bashir is into the attack now. Around the stumps. Tossed up full and outside off, Jadeja leans on and taps it out to the point region.
Survives again, does Bumrah! On a back of a length, 141 kph, outside off, Jasprit Bumrah pats it off the back foot.
Over the stumps. Touch full and around off, Bumrah defends it out to short cover.
And again! A single on the fourth delivery! Full and outside off, 139 kph, Jadeja gets on the front foot and pushes it through covers for a single.
Varies the length now, goes full and on off, Jadeja leans on the ball and blocks it out.
Nagging length, angling on middle. Jadeja hangs back in the crease and steers it to deep square leg.
Short pitched, but outside off, Jadeja lets it through.
Another flighted delivery on off, Bumrah again lunges forward in defence as he gets a nice stride forward towards the line of the ball.
Tossed up, off break on off, Bumrah nicely blocks it off the front foot.
Fuller again, Jadeja opens his bat face as he plays it towards deep backward point. This time they take the single.
Full toss on off, Jadeja drives it to short cover.
Full again on middle, Jadeja blocks it off the front foot.
Overpitched on off, Jadeja drives it to long off and doesn't run.
Length ball, on off, Bumrah guides it along the ground to gully.
Back of a length on middle, Bumrah flicks it towards deep fine leg. They don't run.
Back of a length, on off, Jadeja works it along the ground to deep square leg for one.
Length ball, Jadeja nicely lunges forward and blocks it.
Length ball around off, Jadeja blocks it into the off side. Stokes runs towards the ball. Jadeja probably was asking if they should take a single, but Bumrah denies.
Stokes delivers this one from a wider angle, and lands it on a length, the line is on middle. Jadeja gets right behind the line of that ball and defends it.
Fuller around off, Bumrah flicks it square of the wicket towards deep square leg but doesn't take a run.
Back of a length, seaming in, on off, Bumrah as he has been doing before, moves across a bit and blocks it back to the bowler.
Back of a length, outside off, Jadeja dabs it towards deep point for one. Two balls for Brydon Carse to try and take Bumrah's wicket.
On a length on off, Jadeja blocks it under his eyes, into the off side.
Back of a length outside off. Jadeja leaves it alone.
Fuller and on off, Jadeja plays the push drive into the off side and doesn't run.
Good length on off, Bumrah blocks it into the off side.
Yorker on middle, Bumrah moves across a bit and flicks it to short mid-wicket.
Full ball that tails back into the left-hander, on off, Jadeja plays the push drive towards long off. And again, Jadeja takes a single on the penultimate ball of the over.
On a length, on off, Jadeja skips down the track and drives this one to the left of deep extra cover. Again they don't run.
On a length, outside off, Jadeja looks to dab it and gets an under edge that goes on the bounce to first slip.
Full on middle, Jadeja looks to whip it away and doesn't quite middle it as the ball goes into the vacant mid-wicket region.
Yorker, just outside off, Bumrah defends. A big cheer from the crowd.
Full on middle and off, Jadeja looks to block it off the front foot. The ball takes the outside edge and rolls along the ground to deep point. Single taken. Bumrah has one ball to survive.
Length ball seaming away, wide outside off, Jadeja throws his bat at that one as the ball beats his outside edge.
Again a similar ball. Jadeja again leaves it alone.
Good length, in the channel outside off. Left alone.
Outside off, on a length, left alone by Ravindra Jadeja.
Length on off, Jadeja flicks it towards deep mid-wicket and takes a single to retain the strike.
SIX! Tonked! A touch full on middle, Jadejs skips down the track and lofts it over the deep mid-wicket region for a biggie.

APPEAL FOR LBW AND GIVEN! Woakes bowls it on a length. The ball nips back into the left-hander sharply. Jadeja prods forward in defence and misses it as the ball beats his inside edge and hits him on the front pad. Nothing on UltraEdge as there is a clear gap between bat and ball. Ball Tracking shows the ball to be pitching outside off and impacting outside off as well. Jadeja survives and the crowd goes bonkers at Lord's. The on field call will be reversed. NOT OUT!
Good length on middle, seaming in, Jadeja works it towards deep square leg. Again the batters don't take the single.
Full and shaping away, on off, Jadeja almost gets squared up on that delivery as he looks to flick it and gets a leading edge that rolls along the ground into the off side.
Length, just outside off, Jadeja skips down the track and cuts it towards deep backward point. Jadeja doesn't take a single.

On a length and moving away, outside off, Bumrah nicely lunges forward and guides it towards deep backward point. There was a forward short leg brought in place before the ball and Archer, rather than bowling short, landed it on a length. Probably played the bluff.
Good length on off, Jadeja cuts it towards deep extra cover for one.
Back-of-a-length, in the channel outside off, Jadeja leaves it alone.
Full-length outside off, Jadeja slices it along the ground to deep point and he doesn't take a single.
Now the variation in length from Jofra as he goes full, on off, Jadeja somehow manages to bring his bat down in time as the ball hits his bat and goes onto the pads.
Short ball, outside off, Jadeja drops his hands and lets it go.

Back of a length, seaming away slightly, just outside off, Bumrah looks to lunge forward and defend, but the ball rises sharply and hits him on the glove and pops off his chest and drops on the ground. Bumrah calls for the physio as he cops a blow on the gloves. Looks just fine to continue.

OH BEATEN! THAT WAS SO CLOSE TO THE OUTSIDE EDGE! On a length, seaming away, outside off, Bumrah looks to work it to the off side, but with barely any foot movement, he plays away from the body and gets beaten on the outside edge.

Oh, what was that? Perhaps Woakes looks to bowl the slower delivery, and it slips off his hands as he almost ends up bowling a waist-height full toss, well outside off. Jadeja taps it into the vacant off side region and picks up one.
Now a length ball around off, Jadeja gets a big stride forward and solidly defends it into the off side.
Slower delivery, almost a full toss. Jadeja walks at it and blocks it back to the bowler.
Length ball, angling in a bit, on off. Jadeja defends.
A touch full around off, Bumrah solidly blocks it into the off side. He survives the entire Archer over which brings a huge cheer from the crowd.
On a length around off, Bumrah blocks it into the off side towards the point region. The gully fielder gets across and stops it.
Now a full length ball, almost a perfect yorker, just outside off, Bumrah nicely blocks it under his eyes.
Back of a length, seaming away slightly, Bumrah goes for a wild slog and misses.
OH, JUST SHORT! Length ball seaming in, Bumrah shuffles across and flicks it on the bounce to leg slip.
On a length, just outside off, Bumrah gets right behind the line of that ball and blocks it back towards Archer.

Full and outside off, Jadeja looks to push at it with hard hands. He gets an inside edge that hits his pads and goes along the ground, back to the bowler. Jadeja doesn't get the single and Bumrah will be on strike in the next over.
Back of a length on off, seaming in, Jadeja hops a bit and taps it towards the gully fielder.
Fuller in length and outside off. Jadeja leaves it alone.
Full on middle, Jadeja flicks it into the vacant mid-wicket region and doesn't take a single.

Length ball on middle, Jadeja takes a step towards the bowler and looks to heave it into the leg side. He doesn't quite middle it as the ball goes to the left of the mid on fielder. Batters don't run.
On a length, around off, Jadeja nicely lunges forward and solidly blocks it.
Full this time. Bumrah nicely defends it off the front foot, back to the bowler.
FOUR! Bumrah on the act! Archer goes short, on off. Bumrah is ready for it as he goes through with the pull shot and connects it fairly well as the ball reaches the deep mid-wicket fence.
Good-length ball, on off Jadeja steers it towards deep third for one.
Now a back-of-a-length ball that rises sharply, Jadeja looks to cut and is again beaten by the extra bounce off the surface.
Good-length delivery that zips off the surface, seaming away a bit. Jadeja looks to push it into the off side and gets beaten by the extra bounce on offer.
Length ball outside off, Jadeja leaves it alone.
Length again, just outside off, Bumrah defends it into the off side, with a good front foot stride.
Good-length delivery, outside off, Bumrah lunges forward and defends it back to the bowler.
Slightly fuller this time, moving away, outside off, Bumrah looks to block it off the front foot and gets an outside edge that goes rolling along the ground to gully.
On a length on middle, Bumrah shuffles across a bit and defends it.
Half volley on off, Jadeja drives it to the left of mid off, who runs across and stops the ball with his left foot. Archer the fielder there. Single taken.
From round the wicket, full-length ball, on middle leg, Jadeja looks to flick it and gets an inside edge that hits his front pad and goes into the leg side.
Now a full-length delivery on off, Bumrah drives it back to the bowler, presenting the full face of his bat.
Oh! A full toss on off, Bumrah blocks it to mid on.
On a length on off, Jadeja blocks it into the off side and calls for one. Archer runs towards the ball, but the batters were quick to complete the single.

FOUR! POOR FROM ARCHER! A touch full and sliding down leg, Jadeja manages to tickle it fine. Jamie Smith, the wicket-keeper, dives to his right but can't get to the ball as the ball runs away to the fine leg fence.
Full on middle, Jadeja defends it off the front foot to mid on.
Archer starts from round the wicket and lands this one on a length. The line is just outside off. The ball rises sharply. Jadeja taps it to deep backward point but does not run.
BEATEN! A touch fuller, in the channel outside off, moving away a little. Bumrah goes poking at that one and gets beaten on the outside edge.
On a length, hint of shape away, around off, Bumrah again defends it off the front foot, with the bat in front of his body.
Woakes starts with a full length ball with the line being just outside off, Bumrah nicely prods forward and solidly defends it.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Chris Woakes strikes right on the stroke of Lunch! The script repeats itself for India, as they once again lose a wicket just before the break. Just outside the off stump, on a short of a length, Reddy hangs his bat out to defend. The ball nips away enough to graze the outside edge and the keeper, Jamie Smith does the rest. Woakes is off on a celebratory run and England are now just 2 wickets away. That will be LUNCH on Day 5!
Nitish Kumar Reddy c J Smith b C Woakes 13 (53b 1x4 0x6)
Outside off, on a back of a length, this keeps a bit low, Nittish pats it to backward point.
Slightly wide on the crease, on a good length, around the off stump, Reddy covers the line and defends.

From around the wicket to the left-hander, on a short of a length, on the off stump, Jadeja gets on top of the bounce and pushes it to cover. Carse falls over on his follow-through but is quick to get back up.
NO BALL! Angled in at the hips, on a short of a length, Reddy makes use of the angle and tucks it in front of square on the leg side for a single. Carse has overstepped.
Full and straight, on middle, Nitish brings his bat out in front of the front pad and times the drive to mid on.

Almost dragged it back onto the stumps! Full in length, outside off, Reddy plants his front foot forward for the drive. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the leg stump and rolls behind to the right of deep fine leg for a couple of runs.
Gets the yorker in, right at the base of the stumps, Reddy digs it out.
Bashes the hard length, on off, Reddy rises with the bounce and guides it to backward point.
On a length, over off, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets forward and has a jab at the ball with hard hands. Gets it off the outer half towards backward point where Ollie Pope dives to his right to cut it off.
Keeps it full, on the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja lunges and taps it down on the off side.
This nips back in late, at the stumps, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja adjusts well to the late inward movement and brings his bat out in front of the front pad for the block.
On off, on a short of a length, jabbed down on the leg side by RJ.
A tempter, wider on off, on the fuller side, Jadeja is happy to let it go.
On middle, on a nagging length, Ravindra Jadeja plays it back to Woakes.
From around the wicket, Woakes serves it on a length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja gets right forward and blocks it out with his bat close to the front pad.
Bowled from a bit wide on the crease, on a nagging length, outside off, Nitish defends a bit away from his body. The ball nips in a touch to catch the inner half and it drops down near his feet.
On a nagging length, on middle, Nitish Kumar Reddy clips it to mid-wicket.

A mix-up but no harm done! On a back of a length, on middle and leg, Ravindra Jadeja gets on his toes and turns it to the left of deep backward square leg. The batters think about two and Reddy does set off before Jadeja sends him back. Nitish gets in at the batting end just before the throw arrives.
Another full ball, outside off, Jadeja presses forward and plays it to cover.
Very full but down leg, Jadeja misses the tickle.

Oh, so close! Brydon Carse lands it on a length, angling into the left-hander. There is a puff of dust where the ball lands around the off stump and it nips back in to beat Jadeja on the inside edge as he shaped up for the drive.
On a good length, in the channel on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy presses forward and holds his bat high for the leave. Stokes directs a few words at Reddy and Nitish responds with a thumbs up.
Full again, on off, Reddy knocks it to mid off.

FOUR! Uppish but in the gap! Stokes goes full, around off, Nitish Kumar Reddy leans into it but does not manage to play it along the ground. Drives it uppishly towards cover-point where Ollie Pope flings himself to his left but the ball beats him.
On top of off, on a back of a length, Nitish taps it down on the off side.
On off, on a good length, Nitish Kumar Reddy is solid in defence.
Short of a length, on off, Reddy keeps it out.

On a hard length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja gets on his toes and slashes it to the right of deep backward point. Zak Crawley in the deep is quick to his right and dives to his right to keep it to a couple. Wow, what happened there? Brydon Carse is fussed about something and has a go at Ravindra Jadeja. The replays show that Jadeja ran into the bowler but at that time, he was looking at the ball and that irked Carse. Jadeja explained his case and Ben Stokes got in to sort it out.
Close leave! This keeps a bit low and nips back, around the off stump, Jadeja does not cover the off stump completely and sees the ball whistle past the off pole.
Outside off, on a good length, an easy leave for RJ.
Carse goes into the surface, outside off, Ravindra Jadeja sways away.
On a short of a length, on off, Jadeja opens the bat face and plays it down to gully. Ben Duckett collects cleanly and threatens to throw it at the batting end but Jadeja never left the crease.
Full and on the off stump, Jadeja pats it down the deck.

Attacking the stumps, on the fuller side, Nitish Kumar Reddy is solid in defence. An exchange of words between Stokes and Reddy, with the latter shaking his head to whatever was directed to him by Ben.

Sharp and quick from the English skipper! Stokes bowls a well-directed bumper, at the badge of the helmet, Nitish Kumar Reddy seemed to shape up for the pull initially before deciding to duck. Got into a tangle but managed to duck under it.
Lands it on a good length, outside the off stump, NKR is a bit indecisive whether to play or leave. Ends up dabbing it towards the slip cordon.
A bit of tail back into the right-hander, on the fuller side, attacking the front pad, Reddy brings his bat out in front and taps it to mid on.
Angled in, on the off stump, on a nagging length, Nitish is right behind it.
Nice and full from Stokes, on off, Reddy eases the drive with a high elbow to mid off.
Nipping back in, around the off stump, on a good length, Ravindra Jadeja leaves the ball alone.
Carse bangs it in short but the line is well outside off, Ravindra Jadeja lets it go.

Good stop! Carse serves it full, on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy leans forward and drives it towards backward point. Jofra Archer is quick to move to his right and put a dive in. Parries it away to his right and the batters cross over.
Drags the length back, on top of the off stump, Reddy rocks back to stab it down the deck.
Carse goes fuller and on off, Reddy leans into it for the drive. The ball curves a bit away to catch the outer half and it dribbles towards backward point.
Just outside the off stump, on a back of a length, Nitish Kumar Reddy waits back and steers it to gully.

Sharp nip-backer from Stokes, at the stumps, on a length, Nitish Kumar Reddy ekes out a thickish inside edge and the ball rolls behind to deep backward square leg for a single. A loud cheer in the crowd as the 100 comes up for India!
Stokes goes into the surface, over off, Nitish Kumar Reddy hops back and gets on top of it to defend.
In the corridor of off, on a good length, Reddy shoulders arms.
The ball keeps coming into the right-hander, on a good length, on off, Reddy brings his bat out in front and keeps the front pad away. The ball catches the inner half of the bat and drops down.
Pitched up, on off, stylishly driven to mid off.
Slanting in on the off stump, on a nagging length, Reddy pushes it to mid on.
Well outside off, on a back of a length, an easy leave for Ravindra.
Lands it on a length, on the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja expects another short ball and is late to get on the front foot. Knocks it to cover.

Just short! A good effort ball from Brydon Carse. Bends his back and gets the ball high enough to trouble the batter. The ball cuts away a bit as Jadeja hangs his bat out to fend it down. The ball clips the top hand and drops on the bounce to Joe Root at first slip.
Angled in at the hips, on a short of a length, Reddy flicks it through square leg for a single.
Keeps it on the shorter side, on off, Jadeja presses on the back foot and guides it to deep backward point for one.
Carse charges in from around the wicket and bashes the hard length, over off, Ravindra Jadeja gets on his toes, rides the bounce and glides it down to gully.
Beaten! Jofra Archer drops back at square leg for the short ball but Stokes keeps it on a good length, outside of, Nitish Kumar Reddy is drawn onto the front foot and is beaten on the outside edge.
Honing in on the off stump, on a length, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets behind the line and pats it down to the right of the bowler.
On middle, on a length, knocked with a straight bat to mid on. Archer is in Reddy's ears again.

On the fuller side, outside off, Nitish gets forward and plays a bit in front of his body. Miscues it off the inner half to mid on. Jofra Archer walks over from mid-wicket to send down a few words at Reddy.
Hurls it on a hard length, on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy stands tall and steers it to backward point. NO BALL called for overstepping.
A hint of nip back in, on off, on a short of a length, on the off stump, Reddy gets right behind it.
On a good length from around the wicket, on off, Ravindra Jadeja gets on his toes and dabs it to the right of cover. Shouts loud and clear before crossing over.

A very tight single! Uses the wider angle, does Archer. Hits the back of a length, nips into the middle stump. Ravindra Jadeja gets inside the line of the ball and nudges it to the left of mid-wicket. Woakes gets to the ball quickly, but fumbles to pick up as the batters charge for a quick single.
Hammered on the fuller length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja takes a giant stride out and defends it to cover.
Good-length delivery, on top of off, Ravindra Jadeja jabs it off the back foot to short cover.
Short and angling in and around off. Straightens up the pitch and Jadeja leaves.
BEATEN! Jags in from outside off as it lands on the footmark. Ravindra Jadeja is beaten on the outside edge as the ball stays low as well. Archer is on the haunches with a wry smile on his face.

A miscommunication, but the damage is averted! Back of a length, climbing off the deck, around off. Ravindra Jadeja rises with the bounce and taps it to the point region. Jadeja is keen to steal a single and runs a few steps but is sent back by Nitish. He retreats back in time before Stokes gets to the ball.
Attacks the middle stump, does Stokes, full in length, Nitish Kumar Reddy watches the ball closely and is solid in forward defence.
In-between length, outside off, NKR hangs back and taps it on the bounce to gully.
Brings the stumps into play, full and on off, at 142 kph, Nitish Kumar Reddy presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler.
Shoots it fuller and outside off, at 143 kph, Nitish Kumar Reddy shapes to crack the cover drive, but hits it off the bottom of the bat and it rolls into the off side.
Back of a length, on top of off, Ravindra Jadeja hops on the crease and steers it to deep square leg for a single.
Outside off, on a length, nips in a shy bit and Jadeja opts to leave.
Nice and full, outside off, Nitish Kumar Reddy is solid in defence.
Fired onto the pads, on a length. Jadeja misses to flick and is hit on the front pad. The ball deflects and rolls to the square leg region for a leg bye. India need exactly 100 runs to win now.

FIVE WIDES! That's flown above everyone! Archer digs in a short delivery, and it just takes off the pitch as Jadeja ducks under it to pass. Smith leaps in the air full stretch but it goes over him and races to the fence behind.
Short-pitched delivery, around off, Jadeja hops on the toes and taps it to the left of the gully fielder who stops with the dive.

A huge confident appeal for LBW, but the finger stays down! Jamie Smith gestures to Stokes that it's going down leg. And hence, England do not opt for a review. Fuller delivery, nipping into the leg stump line. Ravindra Jadeja plays all over it and gets rapped on the front pad.

Another hasty single! Hard length, nipping away from middle. Nitish Kumar Reddy plays it close to the body and hits it off the splice of the bat to the backward point region. Rushes to the other end for a single and Ravindra Jadeja is quick to respond as well.
Short of a good length, this doesn't rise up that much, around off. Nitish climbs on it and drops it down to the pitch.
1 run.

How has that missed the off stump? Pitched around off, on a hard length. Shoots into the batter as Nitish Kumar Reddy shoulders arms. It passes close to the off stump by a kitten-whisker. A lot of oooohs and aaahs from the cordon.
Digs in a short delivery, on middle. Ravindra Jadeja rises with the bounce and dabs it with soft hands to the cover-point region for a single.
Good-length delivery, outside off, Nitish Kumar Reddy opens the bat face and steers it to the right of backward point. Calls Jadeja through for a quick single and they get it.
An inswinger from Stokes, full and on middle and leg. Nitish Kumar Reddy blocks it back to the bowler.
Short of a good length, jagging into the batter, Ravindra Jadeja hangs back in the crease and steers it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Fuller delivery, just around off, Nitish Kumar Reddy prods forward and keeps it out to the off side.
That's some serious pace! Attacks the bodyline with a bouncer, Nitish Kumar Reddy leans back and sways away from the line. Archer walks up to the batter and hurls a few words. He is all charged up!

OUT! CAUGHT AND BOWLED! What a screamer of a catch from Archer and it's all England this morning as another one departs! Archer bowls a fuller delivery, around off and deviating into the batter. Washington Sundar plays from the crease and looks to flick it across to the leg side, but ends up chipping it off the leading edge. The ball goes flat and low to the right of the bowler. Jofra Archer shows great game awareness as he throws himself towards the ball, sticking out his right hand and plucks the ball one-handed as he tumbles. India are 82/7 now, with England needing just 3 wickets to win.
Washington Sundar c&b J Archer 0 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Nagging length, nipping away from off, Sundar plays with soft hands and dabs it to the gully fielder.
Short and sliding down the leg stump line. Washington Sundar gets inside the line and misses to glance it away. The ball flirts past the gloves and carries to the keeper. Good gas from Archer.
Good length, nipping in from off, Jadeja steers it to deep square leg for a single.
Jags back in from off, on a length. Washington Sundar punches it on the surface off the back foot.

OUT! LBW! What a smart review from the English skipper. Bashes the hard length, on a good length. It lands and jags in a long way into the batter. KL Rahul is caught in the crease as he looks to work it across but plays over the wrong line and misses. A huge appeal for LBW, but not given. Stokes is on his knees and is pleading to the umpire as he believes he has got his man and opts for the review. Now the question is whether the ball struck the bat first or the front pad, but it looks like KL Rahul's bat is a bit behind the pad. This is very close! UltraEdge shows that it is pad first and Ball Tracking shows the ball hitting the stumps. Three reds and Stokes is pumped up to the core as he gets a huge wicket. KL Rahul departs for 39 (58) and India in real trouble now - 81/6.
KL Rahul lbw B Stokes 39 (58b 6x4 0x6)
Skidding through the hard length, outside off. KL Rahul hangs in the crease and knocks it to the off side.
Quick tap and run! Back of a length, just targetting the off stump. Ravindra Jadeja meets the ball under the eyes and taps it between cover and point for a single.
Lands it just a yard behind those footmarks on the good length, outside off. Goes straight on and Jadeja offers no shot at it.
Bowls from a wider angle from around the stumps. Good length, angling on the leg stump line. Jadeja tucks it into the leg side.
A bit too full and on middle, Jadeja flicks it in the vacant mid-wicket space for a single.
Around off, on a hard length, keeping a bit low, Jadeja tilts forward and manages to keep it out to the off side.
Good-length delivery, on middle. Ravindra jumps on the crease and solidly blocks it off.

FOUR! Off the edge! A yard behind fuller length, angling in on off, Ravindra Jadeja plays it from the crease and with a loose bottom hand. The outside edge goes down and to the left of the diving Harry Brook at second slip for a boundary.

Well bowled! In the corridor of uncertainty, planting the seeds of doubt there. Good length, just outside off and straightening off the deck. Jadeja plays for the ball to cut into him and gets beaten past the outside edge.
Hits the deck very hard, on a length, around off. Ravindra Jadeja hops off on the crease and bunts it on the surface.
Just cuts through the tramline on off, on a fuller length. KL Rahul leaves.

Short of a good length, outside off, KL Rahul rises with the bounce and opens the bat face late to glide it along the ground. The man from deep backward point sprints to his left and cuts it off at deep third. Two taken.

Sliding on the leg stump line, on a fullish length, Jadeja gets across to flick but misses and the ball clips the front pad to roll behind to the short fine leg region. There's a half an appeal for LBW, but the umpire is unmoved. Probably curving away a bit too much from the leg stump line. The batters cross for a leg bye.
Bangs it short and going across the batter, down leg. Jadeja ducks under it.
Hard length, on off, Jadeja watchfully blocks it off.
Lands it full and around off and middle, Jadeja flicks it to mid on.

Jadeja gets off the mark. Archer bangs the ball hard on the length, on the stumps. Ravindra Jadeja tucks it off the pads toward deep square leg and gets a single. A successful over for England and Archer.

OUT! KNOCKED HIM OVER! What a venomous delivery from Archer and it has come just at the right time for England! Around the stumps and on a good length, angling in from outside off. Rishabh Pant shapes to block from the crease but plays inside the line of the ball as the ball straightens and it beats the bat. Pant hears the ball smashing into the stumps as the off pole is uprooted and cartwheels behind. Jofra sends Rishabh back on his way with a few words. Pant goes for 9 (12) and India are 71/5, needing another 122 runs to win. What a spectacular sight for any fast bowler this! Archer has pumped up the adrenaline in the English camp now!
Rishabh Pant (wk) b J Archer 9 (12b 2x4 0x6)
Spears it full and on middle. Pant gets behind the line to defend.

FOUR! What a shot! Fired fuller by Archer, on the stumps, angling in. Rishabh Pant shimmies down the track and smashes the ball to the left of the bowler as he takes one hand off the handle. But controls the shot and finds the fence at long on.
An away shaping yorker, on off, KL Rahul bends a bit and opens the bat face to squeeze it behind backward point for a quick single.
Back of a length, outside off, KL Rahul covers the stumps and lets it be.
Bounces on top of off on a length, Rishabh Pant plays it from the crease and stabs it across to the leg side as his bat twists at the point of contact.
Pitched around off, on a length, nipping in and staying low. Rishabh Pant closes the bat face to nudge the ball to the leg side and again the bottom hand comes off the handle.

On top of middle and leg, cutting into the batter. KL Rahul lets the ball come at him and tucks it from the crease wide of mid-wicket for a single. Quite an active crowd as every single run is being cheered now.
Pulls the length back by a yard or two, does Stokes, angling outside off. KL Rahul does not poke at his harmless delivery.
Full and straight on off, KL Rahul firmly drives it on the front foot, but straight to mid off.

Pitched full and outside off, KL Rahul leans completely on it and drives it to the left of cover. The fielder there dives over the ball as it runs towards the fence. The man from deep point mops it up to his right and the batters cross each other twice.
Full and nipping into the batter, on middle and leg. Rishabh Pant gets forward and defends. Once again, the bottom hand is taken off the handle.
An attempted yorker in front of the sticks. Pant shovels it out on the pitch.
Hard length, sliding on top of middle and leg with some extra bounce. Pant gets across to tap it to the leg side, but the ball takes the splice of the bat and rolls to the leg side, beside the pitch.
Responds well, does Archer as he hits the good length, on middle. It keeps low on the bounce and is negotiated well by Pant as he brings the bat in front to block.

FOUR! Helped away! Too full again, and cannoned right on the pads. Rishabh Pant uses the pace of the ball, uses his wrists to guide the ball towards deep fine leg fence for a boundary. And that brings out a loud cheer from the Indian supporters in the crowd.
Spears in very full, angling on middle and leg. Pant jams his bat down and flicks it to square leg.

BEATEN! Past the outside edge! Goes fuller from over the stumps, keeps the line of attack just outside off and it skids low. KL Rahul pushes at it on the front foot to access the off side, but plays inside the line and is beaten.
Pant is off the mark right away! Stokes hits the good length, angling on off, Rishabh Pant gets behind the line of the ball and taps it across to the leg side with soft hands. A single taken.

OUT! BOWLED'EM! OUTFOXED! Ben Stokes has produced an absolute jaffa, too good for any tailender! He is pumped up and the crowd goes bonkers at Lord's! Runs full tilt, does Stokes and spears it on a fuller length, aiming at the off stump. Akash Deep plays for the initial line, but the ball lands and then straightens off the deck. Akash hears the death rattle behind him as the off stump is uprooted and cartwheels behind. Akash Deep departs for 1 (11) and India are 58/4. What a sensational end to the day's play as that will be STUMPS ON DAY 4.
Akash Deep b B Stokes 1 (11b 0x4 0x6)
Full and straight, fired at 140 kph, Akash Deep gets on the front foot and firmly forces it to mid off.
This one just doesn't rise from the short length, and nips back in from outside off. Akash Deep ducks under it to leave. KL Rahul walks up to Akash and gives him some words of advice.
Hard length, on top of middle, KL Rahul hangs back and tucks it wide of mid-wicket for a single.

BEATEN! A huge appeal for caught behind, but not given. Fires it full and gets the ball to shape away from off. Akash Deep tries to push it straight but plays inside the line and is beaten past the outside edge by a thin margin. What a rhythmic spell this has been from Carse!

Jags back into the batter, on a hard length, at off. Akash Deep blocks it off the front foot to the bowler. Carse collects the ball and throws some heated words at the batter. Akash Deep responds equally.
Cannoned fuller at 142 kph, on the stumps, Akash Deep jams his bat down in time and flicks it to short mid-wicket.

Another big appeal from Carse for LBW, but again, the umpire shakes his head in denial. But this time, Stokes has reviewed it. Hits the length hard, around off and it then nips in a long, long way, across and into the batter. Akash Deep is stuck inside the crease as he brings the bat in front to block, but plays the wrong line and is hit on the inner thigh pad. There's a clear gap between the bat and the pad and Ball Tracking shows the ball to be clipping the leg stump on the umpire's call. NOT OUT.
Floated up, around off, defended firmly by Akash to keep it out.

A huge appeal for LBW, but the finger stays down! Probably doing a bit too much to slide down leg. England do not opt for a review as it would have missed the leg stump by a long way. Fired in fuller and jagging back into the batter. Akash Deep misses to flick from his crease as he plays over the line. He is hit on the front pad.

Takes the single, does Akash on the last ball! Fractional full and outside off, nipping away from the surface. Akash Deep plays it from the crease and guides the ball behind backward point for a single.
Back of a length, with the stumps being attacked. Akash Deep opens the bat face late and keeps it out to the point region.
Full and around off, KL Rahul steers it to deep backward point for a single.
Pitched very full and on off, KL Rahul pushes it down to the left of mid on.
Good length and on the off stump. Rahul fends it down on the off side.

Kicks up from the strip on the good length, on middle. KL Rahul turns it off the splice of the bat as the ball rolls to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs. Ben Stokes is fuming at the fielder and screaming to get quicker to the ball. It's all happening out there!

OUT! LBW! Carse provides a huge wicket for England and he has spring in his step now! India lose another wicket with just 15 minutes or so remaining in the day's play. Back of a length, nipping into the batter sharply from around off, and skidding low. Shubman Gill is caught in the crease and is cramped up for space, tries to work it across to the leg side, but plays all over the wrong line and the ball beats the bat to ping on the front pad. Gill reluctantly takes the review. This, though, looks dead-straight to the naked eye. UltraEdge shows no bat and the Ball Tracking shows the ball hitting the middle stump. Gill takes a review with him.
Shubman Gill (c) lbw B Carse 6 (9b 1x4 0x6)
BEATEN! On a back of a length, on off, nips back in, Shubman Gill gets on his toes to punch it away. Gets beaten on the inside edge.

FOUR! A real freebie from Carse and Gill pounces on it! Slips in a high full toss, shaping away from off, Shubman Gill just liberates his arms and cuts it through backward point for a cracking boundary.
Fired down the leg side, Gill misses the flick and the ball grazes the front pad and is gathered by Jamie Smith on the dive to his left.

Slides it down leg, on a good length, Gill misses the flick and the ball brushes off the front thigh pad and runs behind to deep fine leg for two leg byes. Jamie Smith puts the dive to his left but all in vain.

Caught Behind! Or is it? The onfield umpire raises his finger on the appeal, but it is instantly reviewed by Gill. Pitched very full by Carse, swinging away from off, Shubman Gill plays with a straight bat face, but plays inside the line of the ball and it passes scarily close to the outside edge. Jamie Smith snaffles it behind the stumps. UltraEdge shows a daylight gap between the bat and the ball as it comes up with a flat line.
Good length, on middle, KL Rahul punches it to mid on.
Short and wide on off, Rahul looks to steer it to the off side, but the ball bounces enough to pass over his angled bat.
Rises off the deck, on off and short in length. KL Rahul rides the bounce and dabs it down to the gully region.
Nagging length, at off, KL Rahul bunts it down to the surface.
Length-delivery, curving away from the batter, KL taps it out to point.

FOUR! Poor and gets the treatment! Just drifts down leg on a length, KL Rahul manages to get some bat on it and guides the ball to deep fine leg for a boundary. Ben Stokes kicks the surface out of frustration as he walks back to the bowling mark.
Fuller and outside the off stump, holding its line, Shubman Gill strides forward and creams it past covers for a couple of runs. The Indian skipper is off the mark.
BEATEN! Pitched fuller and swinging away from outside off. Shubman Gill is drawn into the shot as he looks to drive to covers, but gets beaten on the outside edge.

JAFFA! Swinging away from off, on a fuller length. Shubman Gill does not move his feet to the pitch of the ball and plays away from his body. Gets beaten past the outside edge as the ball shapes away late.

OUT! LBW! What a breakthrough for England out of nowhere! This will definitely lift the spirits up in that English camp! Back of a length, angling into the batter on the off stump line. Karun Nair gets forward and opts to shoulder arms at it as he anticipates the ball to nip away off the pitch, but it cuts in the opposite direction very sharply and pings right on the front pad. An appeal goes around in unison from the English players and the umpire instantly raises his finger. Karun Nair starts walking before stopping for a brief chat with Rahul and eventually decides against the review. He departs on 14 (33) and India are 41/2, needing 152 more runs. Carse has his tail up.
Karun Nair lbw B Carse 14 (33b 1x4 0x6)
An outswinger from Carse, outside off, Karun plays the lazy cover drive and is beaten on the outside edge.

Full and outside off, KL Rahul drives off the front foot and finds Ben Stokes at cover, but the English skipper fumbles to field it and parries the ball behind, allowing the batters a single which was never there. Stokes is disappointed with himself and rightly so.
Aims the stumps, full and on middle, Karun is solid in forward defence.
In-between length, outside off, Nair sees the ball go all the way through behind.
Good length, angling on off, Karun Nair prods forward and defends it out to the off side.

A bit of yes and no between the batters, but no harm done! Back of a length, rising up off the deck, outside off. Nair rides the bounce and punches it backward point. Looks for a single but Rahul sends him back on a sharp call as the throw is released wide of the stumps at the batting end.
Straightens up the deck on a good length, around off. Karun Nair opens the bat face to defend.
Slides it on the pads, does Stokes, KL Rahul flicks this full ball to deep backward square leg for a single.
Fuller and on the stumps, tailing in, KL Rahul flicks off the front pad, and hits it wide of Archer at mid on for a single.
A pinpoint yorker, in front of the stumps. KL Rahul jams his bat down in time and the ball bumps off the bottom edge and goes on the bounce to the second slip fielder.
At 140 kph, Carse fires it full and straight on off, KL Rahul pushes it back to the bowler.
Tailing into the leg stump, on a fuller length, Karun Nair tilts forward and flicks it all along the turf to deep square leg. One more single taken.
Into the leg stump line, on a length, KL Rahul uses his wrists and nudges it towards deep mid-wicket for a single.
On a back of a length, on middle and leg. Karun tucks it with soft hands towards the vast vacant pocket at mid-wicket and gets a single.

WOW! That's a real snorter from Stokes! Gets an extra kick from the shorter length, around the off stump and it nips away sharply. KL Rahul is taken completely aback and just about manages to drop his wrists and sway away from the line.
Good-length delivery, on top of middle. KL Rahul punches it on the rise to short cover.
Attacks the off stump, does Stokes, just lifts enough and KL Rahul dabs it down to the point region.
Nips in from the pitch, on middle. KL Rahul's bottom hand comes off the handle as he forces it down to mid off.
Good-length delivery, fairly outside off, KL offers no shot.

FOUR! That's glided through by KL Rahul! On the back of a length, around the fourth stump line. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and opens the bat face pretty late. Plays with soft hands deliberately and places it between gully and third slip for a boundary at deep third.
A false start for Stokes as he has overstepped! Over the stumps, hard length, outside off, KL Rahul leaves it alone. No Ball called.
On the fuller length, around middle and off, Karun drives it straight to the mid on fielder. India need 163 runs to win!
This one just dies on the surface as it lands outside off, on a yard behind fuller length. Karun shoulders arms as the ball nibbles away and dribbles back to the keeper.
Pitched full with a wobbled seam, on middle, Karun drives it straight to mid on.

Overpitched delivery, shaping away from off, Karun Nair mistimes the flick shot. Hits off the inner half of the bat and the ball rolls to the right of Brydon Carse at mid-wicket. He chases the ball to the deep and the batters scamper back for the second.
Around off, on a back of a length, Karun Nair keeps it out to the off side.

Brings the angle into the batter, does Woakes, on a good length and on middle. It nips in and Karun Nair is beaten on the inside edge as he plays completely over the wrong line. Is hit on the front thigh pad.
Very full, on off, KL Rahul plays with a straight bat face and middles it to the bowler.
Full and straight on middle, 144 kph, KL Rahul knocks it back to Archer.
The line of attack is on the off stump, on a good length. KL Rahul gets forward and knocks it to mid on.
Fired onto the pads, on a length. Karun Nair flicks it firmly wide of mid-wicket for a quick single.
Back of a length, just outside off, Nair covers the off stump and lets it pass through to the keeper.
Overpitched, outside off, Nair carves it out and squeezes it straight to cover.
Full and tailing into the off stump, KL Rahul forces it to the left of the bowler.

A bit too full from Woakes, outside off. Karun Nair drives it to the right of the cover fielder, but Pope dives towards the ball and makes a half stop there. Parries the ball in thereabouts of the mid off region. A single taken in the meanwhile.
Attacks the off stump, on a good length, Karun Nair gets behind the line and blocks it forward.
Straighter and fuller, on off, Nair is solid in forward defence to the off side.
Pitched fuller and around off, Karun Nair leans forward and blocks it out to short cover.
A sharp nip-backer from outside off, on a good length. Karun Nair covers the stumps and shoulders arms at it. The ball passes scarily close to the off pole on the way to the keeper.
No run.
Nagging length, outside off, KL offers no shot.

FOUR! Excellent placement! Archer is not happy with the field placement here! Fuller delivery, outside the off pole, KL Rahul gets on top of the ball and caresses it through the covers for a boundary.
Around off, on a good length, punched to mid off by KL.

Good length and nipping back into middle and leg. Nair looks to push it away, but is beaten on the inside edge, and gets hit on the front thigh pad. The ball then rolls in front of Carse at short cover and the batters steal in a leg bye.

FOUR! A great effort from Carse goes in vain! Runs flowing for the Indians! Touch full and nipping away a shy bit from off, Karun Nair plants his front foot out, finds the middle of the bat and hits it through covers. Brydon Carse is after it from cover, and puts in a despairing dive to flick the ball inside the ropes, but fails to do so.
Full and swinging in and around off. Rahul pushes it to mid on.

FOUR! Glorious shot that! Woakes goes full now and outside off. KL Rahul pounces on the width again and takes a giant stride out. Gets to the pitch of the ball and smashes it through cover-point gap for a cracking boundary. Two in two for Rahul.
FOUR! Good response from Rahul! Hard length, outside off, enough width for him to punch it square and find the fence at deep point.

DROPPED! Oh dear me! Chris Woakes shells a huge opportunity here! Bowled fuller and around the off stump line. It lands and just sticks for a bit and arrives late towards the batter. KL Rahul goes through the straight drive early and chips it to the left of Woakes. He tries to stick out both his hands to the ball, but it bursts through and drops on the pitch. Woakes is distraught.
Outside off, on a fullish length, KL Rahul leaves it alone.
At 128 kph, on a hard length, outside off. KL Rahul covers the stumps and leaves.

A bit too full from Archer, on off, Karun Nair mistimes the shot as the bat twists at the point of contact, bu he manages it to force through the vacant mid off region. The man from short cover chases it and the batters settle with a couple of runs.
A vicious bumper that jags in to the leg stump line, but just dies on the bounce. Karun tries to duck under it but the ball smashes the left shoulder and lobs behind to the leg side.
Nagging length at 142 kph, on off, Nair hangs on the back foot and taps it out to the off side.
Very close leave that! In the vicinity of the off pole, on a good length, just holds its line and goes straight on. Karun watches the ball closely and leaves.
Responds with a steep bumper, on the stumps, Nair leans back and lets it be.

A searing inswinger from Archer, full and tailing on the leg stump. Karun Nair plays with a straight bat and forces it through the vacant mid on region. The man from short mid-wicket chases it down and keeps it down to two. Karun is off the mark.
On off, on a length, KL tucks his bat inside the line and hides it behind the front pad to make the leave.

A massive appeal for LBW but turned down! A potential run out chance as well. It's all happening. Full and jagging back in, on off, Rahul plants his front foot forward and has a jab at the ball with hard hands. Ekes out an inside edge onto the pads. It rolls behind towards the slip cordon. The fielder has a shy at the batting end to catch KL off guard amidst the appeal but Rahul is alert and manages to slide his bat inside the crease before the ball hits the stumps.
On a good length, on middle and leg, Rahul gets right behind it in defence.
Full and outside off, Rahul leans into it and blocks it out.

Woah! That came back in sharply. Risky leave from KL Rahul expects this length ball to go away but this nips back in. KL plants his front foot forward for the leave and the ball goes perilously close to the off stump.
Pitched up, at the stumps, Rahul presents a straight bat for the drive. The ball straightens to catch the outer half and it dribbles to wide mid off.
Sliding down leg, on a back of a length, Nair stays inside the line for the tickle but does not connect. End of a succesful over for Jofra Archer and England.
Archer serves the tempter, full and outside off. Not movement in the air or off the deck, Nair leaves the ball alone.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! Jofra Archer gets Yashasvi Jaiswal for the second time in the game! Jaiswal would not want to look back at the replay at all. Banged in short from around the wicket, outside off, Jaiswal presses back and tries to drag the pull. The ball climbs onto him and catches the top edge. It goes straight up behind the wicket. The keeper, Jamie Smith, calls for it straight away and takes a step forward to complete a safe catch. England have the early wicket they were after as Jaiswal departs for a seven-ball duck. India are 5/1, needing 188 runs to win.
Yashasvi Jaiswal c J Smith b J Archer 0 (7b 0x4 0x6)
On the shorter side, on middle and leg, Rahul is a bit cramped for room but swivels and pulls it to the man at a squarish deep fine leg for a single.
FOUR! KL Rahul and India are away! Archer goes full but the ball curves into the pads, KL is a bit late but does manage to help it away. Gets it fine of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
Archer steams in from over the wicket and lands it on a short of a good length, on middle and leg, Rahul hops back and taps it to mid on.
Chris Woakes starts with a maiden! On a hard length, on off, Yashasvi stands tall and pats it down on the off side.
Woakes makes the batter play, on a good length, Yashasvi defends it with a straight bat.
Fractionally wide, on the shorter side, Jaiswal shoulders arms. The ball just about carries to Jamie Smith.
Beaten again! Closer to the off stump, on a short of a length, Jaiswal hangs his bat away from his body and the ball whistles past the bat.

Beaten! This is gathered by Jamie Smith around his face. On a length, going away off the deck, Jaiswal walks down the track and tries to get closer to the line of the ball. Gets beaten on the outside edge.

Woakes begins from around the wicket and hits the good length, in the channel on off, Yashasvi Jaiswal covers the off stump and holds the bat high to make the leave. The ball carries at ankle height to Jamie Smith.

OUT! CASTLED! Washington Sundar completes the clean-up job! Fourth wicket for Sundar and all of them have been bowled. This drifts away on the off stump, on a nagging length, Shoaib Bashir premeditates as he steps down the track. On seeing the length, he tries to adjust and brings his bat out in front. The ball does not turn and sneaks past the outside edge to hit the off pole. From being 154/4, England have been bowled out for 192. India will need 193 to take the lead in the series.
Shoaib Bashir b W Sundar 2 (9b 0x4 0x6)

Missed out! Sprayed on the pads, on a length, Jofra Archer walks inside the line but fails to lay any bat on it. The ball clips the front pad and goes on the bounce to the keeper. Dhruv Jurel does well to dive to his left and prevents the ball from going past him.

Bumrah goes searching for the yorker but it comes out as a low full toss, on middle, Archer looks to whip it away square of the wicket on the leg side. Miscues it to mid on. Archer throws his head back in disappointment.
On a hard length, on off, Jofra Archer rocks back and stabs it down on the off side.
Hurls it from wide of the crease, on a nagging length, on the off stump, Jofra Archer covers the line and pats it down the deck.

Bashir gets off strike and that brings about a cheer from the crowd! At the stumps, on a good length, Shoaib stays leg side of the ball but manages to put the bat to the ball. Dabs it beside the strip on the off side and gets to the other end quickly.
Angling into the right-hander, on a nagging length, Shoaib Bashir stays back to nudge it away. The ball sneaks past the inside edge and lobs towards gully off the thigh pad.
Fired in, flatter and at the stumps, Jofra Archer can only defend.
Pushed through, flat and short, on middle, Archer jabs it off the back foot to mid-wicket.
Slower and on off, Jofra Archer gets right forward to smother the spin.
Keeps it nice and full, on middle, Archer pushes it back to Sundar.
The length is pulled back, on middle and leg, Archer is deep in the crease and turns it to mid-wicket.
Drifting away, on off, on a length, Shoaib Bashir presses forward to defend it with a straight bat. The ball catches the outer half and rolls to deep backward point. They cross.

FOUR! Gets it through! Jasprit Bumrah misses his yorker and ends up serving a low full toss, on off, Archer shows the full face of the bat and drives it down the ground. Beats the diving mid off fielder to his right for a boundary.

Bowled from a bit wide on the crease, attacking the front pad and the length stays full. The ball keeps a bit low, but Jofra stays low with the bounce and manages to keep it out. The ball hits the bat right at the toe end.
On the line of the off stump, full in length, Archer walks across to get behind the line of the ball. Presents a straight bat and taps it back to Bumrah.
At pace and fuller in length, on middle, Jofra Archer brings his bat out in front and knocks it to mid on.
Pace taken off, on a length, around the pads, Jofra Archer looks to help it away with the angle but misses. The ball dribbles off the pads towards backward square leg but Archer refuses the single.
Honing in on the stumps, Jofra Archer gets behind it and pushes this full ball to mid on.
Fuller and looped up, on off, Shoaib taps it out to the left of the bowler.
Full and drifting away, on off, Shoaib Bashir does not quite get behind the line of the ball. Leans ahead for the block. Gets it off the inner half towards square leg.
Shorter and on middle, Archer leans back and nudges it past short leg for a single.
Another one that slides across, fuller and on off, Jofra drops it beside the strip on the off side.
This drifts away, on a length, on middle, Jofra Archer gets forward for the block.
Tossed up, on middle, Archer tucks it to mid-wicket.

Yashasvi Jaiswal comes in at short leg. Bumrah does not go for the short ball and instead goes for the change-up. Slower and on a length, outside off, Bashir stays leg side of the ball and has a feel for the delivery. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
There's that yorker again, on middle, Shoaib Bashir jams it out in front of mid-wicket. Bashir feels the pain on the little finger of his left hand and tries to shake it off.
Jasprit Bumrah bangs it in short, around off, Shoaib Bashir sways away from the line of the ball.

OUT! DRAGGED ON! Jasprit Bumrah has his arms aloft in celebration. Chris Woakes looks back at the stumps in disbelief before starting the long walk back. Pace on with an upright seam, on a back of a length, on top of off, Woakes stays back and leg side of the ball to deal with it. The ball nips back in with the slope and catches the inside edge. The ball deflects off the edge to clip the top of the leg stump. England have now lost 5 wickets for 31.
Chris Woakes b J Bumrah 10 (33b 1x4 0x6)
Gets the yorker in but it is down leg, Woakes misses the tickle. Bumrah limps a bit on his follow-through. Looks to be a right calf issue. Calls for the physio.
Bumrah rolls his fingers over the ball and goes full, on middle, Chris Woakes picks the change of pace and defends.
At the stumps, Jofra Archer defends this full ball with ease.
On middle and leg, on a length, Archer blocks it out off the front foot.
Full and at the stumps, Chris eases it to long on and crosses over.
Slightly fuller, on off, Woakes gets right behind it.
Keeps it short, on off, Woakes taps it back to the bowler.
A bit of away drift, on off, on a nagging length, Woakes pushes it back to Sundar.
On a back of a length, on middle, Jofra Archer waits back and plays all around it. Gets hit high on the front pad.

Is that another? Searing yorker from Bumrah, around the base of the off stump. Jofra Archer tries to get his bat down to keep it out but is late in doing so. The ball sneaks under the blade and it tails in a bit after going past the bat. It is taken by Dhruv Jurel and he goes up in an appeal. No one looks really convinced but Shubman Gill takes the review. The UltraEdge confirms no bat but there was a sound. Did it make any contact with the off stump? Bumrah seemed to suggest so before Gill took the review. Will have to wait for the replay.
Jasprit Bumrah goes into the wicket, over off, Chris Woakes swivels and rolls his wrists over the ball. Helps the pull down to deep backward square leg for a single.

Half a shout for LBW but that looked to be going down leg! Angled in, on middle and leg, on a nagging length, Archer is beaten on the flick. The ball goes off the front pad behind on the leg side for a leg bye.
Beaten! In the channel on off, on a good length, Jofra Archer defends inside the and is beaten on the outside edge.

OUT! BOWLED! Jasprit Bumrah gets in on the act! Not sure Brydon Carse could have done much about that. Bumrah nails the yorker to perfection at the base of the stumps. Carse gets his bat down but the ball does not angle towards him as much as he anticipated it to. Brydon is beaten on the outside edge and the ball goes on to hit the leg pole. From 154/3, England are now 182/8.
Brydon Carse b J Bumrah 1 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Gives the ball air, full and on middle, Carse steps out and pushes it to the right of the bowler for a single.
Short and on middle, Carse rokcs back and dabs it down on the leg side.
Fuller and on off, Brydon Carse blocks it out.

OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! Ben Stokes tries to put Washington Sundar under pressure but perishes in the process. From around the wicket, nicely tossed up, on middle, Stokes gets down on a knee to unleash the slog sweep. The ball is not that full for the shot. It slides on with the arm to go under the bat and crashes into the stumps. Sundar has three to his name and has fished out three big names from this English batting unit - Root, Smith, and now Stokes. The English skipper departs on a gritty 33 (96) and the hosts are 181/7.
Ben Stokes (c) b W Sundar 33 (96b 3x4 0x6)
Short and on off, Stokes hangs back to defend.

FOUR! Swatted away! There has been a clear sign of intent from Stokes against Sundar. Tossed up, full and on middle, Stokes gets down on a knee and sweeps. Not quite from the middle of the bat but well in front of square on the leg side for a boundary.
Sliding down leg, Woakes fails to help this full ball away.
Slanting into the right-hander, on middle, Woakes wrists it to mid-wicket.

Had to hurry! Bumrah lands it full, on off, Stokes taps it in front of mid off and sets off for a quick single. The ball bounces nicely on its way to Shubman Gill. A clean pick up by Gill and has a shy at the bowling end but misses as Ben puts in a desperate dive. The replays show that even the dive would not have saved Stokes there. He was gone had the throw hit.
Nearly sneaked through! Fuller in length, angled in on middle, Stokes is a bit late in getting his bat down and ekes out an inside edge onto the front pad.
On a back of a length, on middle, Stokes rides the bounce and tucks it to mid-wicket.
From around the wicket, attacking the stumps, Ben Stokes knocks it with a straight bat to mid on.
On off, Stokes jabs at this full ball as he presses forward. Gets it off the outer half towards backward point for a single.
Pushed through a bit, on the off stump, Stokes uses the depth of the crease to defend in front.
Tossed up, around off, Ben Stokes leans ahead to smother the spin.
Shorter and on the off stump, Stokes goes on the back foot to tap it down.
More loop on this one and bowled from a bit wide on the crease, outside off, Stokes drills this full ball to cover again.
Looped up, full and wide on off, Ben Stokes firms the drive but picks out the man at cover.
Sliding on, shorter and on middle, Chris Woakes goes on the back foot and keeps it out. That will be TEA on Day 4!
Full and around off, knocked to cover by Woakes.
Pushed through, on middle, Chris Woakes brings his bat out in front to defend.

Play and a miss! Slower through the air and bowled by going wide of the stumps. Fuller and wider on off, Woakes is drawn on the front foot and wants to push it away with the turn. Gets beaten on the outside edge.

Was that a chance? Turning back in, short and on middle, Ben Stokes is deep in the crease and does well to keep it down. Plays it with the turn and the ball bounces in front before going through the legs of Yashasvi Jaiswal at short leg. They cross.
Darted in, short and on middle and leg, Chris Woakes waits back and taps it in the vacant short mid on region. A bit of hesitation but the batters complete the single.
Lovely stuff! Drifting in, on off, Ben Stokes goes back to a full delivery. The ball bites away to go past the outside edge.
A bit of turn, shorter and on off, Ben Stokes rocks on the back foot and plays it back to the bowler.
On middle and leg, on the fuller side, tapped to the left of Sundar.
Sliding on with the arm, on middle, on a nagging length, Ben Stokes defends a bit outside the line. Gets it off the inner half to square.
From wide on the crease, looped up, full and on off, Stokes knocks it to cover.
Short and a bit of extra bounce, on off, Stokes punches it to cover.
Tossed up, full and drifting in and around off. Chris pushes this gently to short cover.
Lands full and on off, Woakes leans on and defends.
Drifts on the pads, on a length, Woakes goes deep in the crease and steers it to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Sliding in on middle, on a fuller length, Woakes is solid in defence.
BEATEN! An absolute jaffa! Quicker and short on off. Drifts in and then bites away to beat the outside edge of Woakes by a whisker.
Flat and full, outside off, Stokes sweeps it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Pushes the batter back, does Sundar, on a nagging length, on middle, Chris is deep in his crease. Gets beaten on the inside edge due to the turn and wears it high on the back pad.
FOUR! Wonderful use of the feet! Tossed up by Sundar, on middle, Chris Woakes skips down the track and brings his wrists into play. Picks the gap between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.
Drags the length back, on off, Chris Woakes taps it back to Sundar.
On off, a bit of turn this time, on a length, Chris Woakes is forward to keep it out.
Slower through the air, goes on with the arm, on off, Woakes gets it off the outer half to cover.

Tight single! Short and on off, Ben Stokes gets on his toes and whips it to the right of mid-wicket. The fielder sprints to that side and gets low but fails to pick it up. Had he picked it up, it could have been interesting as Stokes had to hurry at the bowling end.
Not that wide for the cut, on a short of a length, Woakes chops it to backward point.
Around the off stump, Woakes pushes it to mid off.
Slanting into the pads, quicker and on a length, Woakes wrists it to the right of mid-wicket where Sundar moves to that side and prevents the single.
Fuller and slower, on middle, played back to Jadeja by Woakes.
This keeps coming on with the arm, at the stumps, on a length, defended with a straight bat.
On the off stump, on a nagging length, Woakes taps it to cover.
Fuller and on the off stump, Stokes is right forward for the block.
Sundar goes wide on the crease on the around the wicket angle, full and on middle, Ben Stokes lunges to defend.
This is slower and shorter in length, on off, Chris Woakes waits back and manages to adjust to the sharp turn. Tucks it past short leg and picks up a single.
A bit of air on this one, fuller in length, Woakes drives it to mid on.

OUT! TIMBER! A ripper from Washington Sundar and this is a massive wicket for India! The in-form Jamie Smith departs cheaply. This is pushed through by Sundar, on a nagging length, on the off stump, Smith hops back in the crease and brings his bat out in front. Plays for the turn but the ball keeps straight and goes past the outside edge before clattering into the off pole. Sundar has uplifted the Indian spirits after going wicketless for the first hour or so post Lunch. Jamie Smith departs cheaply on 8 (14) and England have slipped from 154/4 to 164/6.
Jamie Smith (wk) b W Sundar 8 (14b 0x4 0x6)

Sundar serves it full, on off, Smith presses forward and angles the bat face to drive it to the left of mid off. Mohammed Siraj gets across and tumbles to his left. Ends up parrying the ball away and concedes another run.
Flatter and quicker, on a length, outside off, Ben Stokes gets outside the line of the off stump and goes hard on the sweep but fails to connect. Gets beaten onto the front pad.
Full and on off, Smith works it wide of backward point and takes the single.
Keeps it wide on off, on a nagging length, Jamie Smith shoulders arms.
Full and around off, Stokes plays the reverse down to deep third for a run.
Pushed through from a bit wide on the crease, full in length, Ben Stokes taps it back to Jadeja.
Jadeja spots Smith stepping out and pushes it wider on off, Jamie reaches out and steers it to deep point for a single.
On the line of the off stump, Ben solidly defends this full ball.
Darted on off, on a length, Ben Stokes knocks it to cover.
Fuller and on off, Smith eases it to long on for one.
On off, on a nagging length, Smith works it off the back foot to mid-wicket.
A bit quicker, at the stumps, Smith jabs it to mid-wicket.
Short and on off, Jamie Smith leans back and keeps it out on the off side.

A huge shout for LBW but that looked to be doing too much! On off, on a length, spinning back in, Stokes does not quite get fully forward. Fails to smother the spin and is beaten on the inside edge. The ball hits him on the front pad but that was spinning past the leg stump.
Turning back in, fuller and slower, Stokes lunges for the block but the ball spins back in to hit the front pad.
Flatter and shorter, on off, Jamie presses back and dabs it wide of point for a single.
Fuller and around off, whipped past mid-wicket for a run by Stokes.
Full and angled in, on middle, Smith pushes it in front of mid on and gets to the other end.
On the off stump, on a length, Smith watchfully defends.
Floated up, fuller and on middle, Smith steps out and knocks it to the left of mid on for a single to get off the mark.
Pushed through, short and on off, Smith hangs back for the block. A bit of away drift and the ball stays low to catch the toe end of the bat.

OUT! CASTLED! Washington Sundar breaks through for India! From over the wicket to the right-hander, on the line of the leg stump, on the fuller side, Root plants his front foot across for the sweep. Ends up getting a bit too far across and fails to connect. The ball sneaks under the bat and crashes into the leg stump. A wicket at a very crucial juncture for the tourists as the 67-run stand is broken. Root falls for 40 (96). England are 154/5.
Joe Root b W Sundar 40 (96b 1x4 0x6)
Short and on off, Stokes taps it past cover for a single.
Fuller and slower, on off, Stokes drives it to cover.
Sliding on, on a nagging length, on middle, Ben Stokes keeps the front pad out of the way and defends.
Landed full and outside off, Stokes spreads across the crease and sweeps it to deep backward square leg for single.
Flat and short, on off, patted down on the off side by Ben.
Floated up, full and on off, pushed wide of cover for a run.
Leg bye! On a length, around off, Stokes gets outside the line of the off stump for the reverse. Fails to lay any bat on it. The ball rolls off the front pad on the leg side for a leg bye.
Short and on off, turning in, Ben Stokes dabs it down the deck.
Full and around the pads, Root clips it behind square on the leg side for one. 150 is up for England!
From a bit wide on the crease, wider on off, Ben Stokes chops it down towards cover.
On off, Ben Stokes leans ahead for the block.
Fuller and slower, blocked out off the front foot.
Quicker and flatter, on middle, Ben Stokes is deep in the crease in defence.
Full and on off, pushed back to Sundar.
Full and at the stumps, Ben Stokes defends with his bat close to the front pad.
On the fuller side, on off, Stokes shuffles across and sweeps it through backward square leg for a run.
Slower and shorter, on off, turning into the left-hander, Stokes goes back to block.
Full and on off, Stokes eases it to cover.

Fired in, full and on middle, Root plants his front foot across and works it in the vacant mid-wicket region. Wants to come back for the second but Mohammed Siraj gets to the ball quickly from mid on.
Flat and short, on middle, Root stabs it down.

Oh, close! Darted into the right-hander from around the wicket, Root walks inside the line of the ball for the lap but misses as the ball stays low and sneaks past the leg stump. Good take by Dhruv Jurel low to his left.
Sliding on with the arm, full and on the off stump, blocked out.
Short and on off, Root pushes it in front of mid on and takes a quick single.
A bit of turn and bounce for Sundar. On middle, on a nagging length, Root gets forward for the block. The ball spins past the inside edge to clip the top of the front pad.
Pushed through, outside off, Joe stays leg side to punch it away. The ball keeps a bit low and Root miscues it off the inner half to mid-wicket.
Short and on the pads, Root turns it to mid-wicket.
Drops it short, on off, punched to long on for a single by Ben.
Around leg, on a back of a length, glanced down to deep fine leg for one.
Banged in short, going across the batter, Ben Stokes drops his wrists and lets it go.
On middle and leg, on a length, Stokes brings his wrists into play and clips it through mid-wicket for a couple of runs.

Nipping back in, on off and middle, Joe Root shuffles across his stumps and is standing outside his crease whilst playing the flick. The ball jags back in to go past the inside edge and catches Root on the front pad. The Ball Tracking shows that the ball is clipping the leg stump and it is umpire's call. Mohammed Siraj is visibly frustrated as that looked pretty straight on the eye.
Pitched up, around off, Root presses forward and taps it to cover.
Leg bye! On a back of a length, at the hips, Ben Stokes misses out on the tickle. The ball goes off the thigh pad towards square leg for a leg bye.
