Darted fuller and around off. Ben Stokes misses to sweep that away and the ball rolls off his front pad to the short third region. They cross for a leg bye.
Full and outside off, pushed to short cover.
Lands it full and outside the off stump. Root drives this inside out through cover for a single.

A big appeal in unison for LBW, but the umpire stays still. Did it come off the bat or pad first? Given runs off the bat. A brief chatter between Jadeja and Gill and they do not go upstairs to review it. Pitched quite full by Jadeja, sliding on middle, Joe Root reverse sweeps it to deep third for a couple of runs. The replay also confirms later that there was bat involved.
Pushed through, full and on middle, Root defends it back to Jadeja.
Flat and a yard behind fuller, outside off, Stokes cuts it behind backward point for a single.
Fuller and on off, Root drives it off the inner half of the bat, and the ball goes through mid-wicket for a couple.
Back of a length, just outside the off stump. Root is outfoxed by the inward movement and misses it on the inside edge. Gets hit on the back thigh pad.
Nips into the batter on middle and leg. Root plants the front foot ahead and defends it to the leg side.

An appeal for caught behind, but the umpire says no. KL Rahul, too, instantly denies any edge on it. Pitched outside off and deviates into the batter sharply from the good length. Joe Root looks to push at it to the covers, but is undone by the deviation and the ball beats the inside edge and clips the flap of the front pad and is caught by Jurel behind.
Hard length, on top of off, Joe Root gets right behind the line and solidly blocks it off the back foot.

FOUR BYES! Jurel is having a really tough time behind the wickets! Pitched on middle and cuts across the batter, down the leg side. Root misses to tuck it across. Goes too wide from Jurel's dive to his left and races to the deep fine leg fence.
Good-length delivery, on the fourth. Stokes tucks it across to short mid-wicket.
Full and slanting on the leg stump. Stokes is beaten on the flick shot and is hit on the front pad.
Attacks the off stump, on a good length, Stokes lets the ball come at him and steers it out to backward point.

FOUR! Flayed away! Width offered by Bumrah, on a short of a length, Ben Stokes throws his hands at the ball. The ball flies off the outer half and beats the flying Washington Sundar at backward point to his right.
Honing in on the off stump, on a good length, solidly defended by Ben.
Slanting into the left-hander, on a nagging length, Stokes tucks it to mid-wicket.

A loud appeal for LBW, but the finger stays down. Shubman Gill asks for the impact and Siraj is not that sure and hence, they do not opt for a review. The impact too, looked to be outside off in real-time. This one jags in a long way from outside off and cramps Root for room as he looks to block it out. The ball beats his inside edge and hits the front pad as it seams in late.

FOUR BYES! Just misses the off stump by a kitten-whisker! Siraj fires it in and around off, on a good length. Joe Root covers the off stump to negate the movement and is beaten on the inside edge as he looks to block. Blinded by the batter, Jurel reacts late towards the ball and dives to his left, but the ball evades him to run into the fence behind.
On a length, around off, worked to mid off.

Had to really hurry! Overpitched on off, Stokes skips down the track and carves it to the right of mid off. He is through for a single and Root responds quickly to cross over. Shubman Gill swiftly gets to the ball and releases a flat throw to the bowler's end, but misses to score a direct hit. Stokes gets home sliding his bat in.
Nipping in on the leg stump line, on a length, Root steers it to deep square leg for a single.
Lands around the footmark, outside off on a good length, and just does not rise enough. Beats Root completely as he tries to bunt it on the off side.
Good-length delivery, at off, Stokes presents a solid back foot punch to the off side.
Again, the ball beats the bat! Stays low, angling into the batter on a length. Stokes swivels to pull, but gets beaten on the inside edge and is pinged on the back thigh pad.
Around off, on a good length. Stokes drags it across to short mid-wicket.
Length ball, on off, punched to point.

Nearly another chance! Cannons this on a good length, on middle. Stokes is cramped up for space as he looks to work it to the leg side. The ball beats the inside edge and lobs off the front pad and is taken by the gully fielder on the forward dive.
On middle, on a length, Stokes hangs in the crease and knocks it to the leg side, beside the strip.

Oh, nearly dragged on! Siraj spears it in, fuller and on the fourth, Joe Root gets on the front foot to drive it to the covers, but it cuts in a touch to take the inside edge onto the back pad. The ball then rolls behind to the left of the stumps.
The stumps are attacked, on middle and on a length. Joe Root just manages to get his bat on the ball to block.

Play and a miss! Wide on off on a fuller length. Joe Root does not really move his feet towards the pitch of the ball and tries to slash it from the crease. Gets beaten on the inside edge as the ball nips back in.
At 137 kph, on a back of a length, just outside off. Root walks forward and covers the off stump to negate any deviation. But decides to leave it in the end.
Short of a good length, outside off, Stokes punches on the rise between mid off and cover for a single.
Switch of ends for Mohammed Siraj. Full at 140 kph, on off, Ben Stokes drives it straight to cover.
Nagging length, on off, Root leans back and cuts it to backward point.

Another appeal for LBW, but not given again! Just doing a bit too much to zip down leg it seems. Bumrah goes fuller this time and pitches it on middle. It skids low and jags into the batter on the leg stump line. Root gets a bit too across to flick and misses and the ball pings his front pad.
Length, on the stumps, Root gets right behind it to block in front.

A huge appeal for LBW, but the umpire denies and walks away! Maybe a bit too high. Bumrah angles it into the batter, on a good length. It lands and nips in just enough to beat the inside edge of Joe Root, who looks to block it in front. Gets rapped around the front thigh pad.
Over the wickets to Root. At 136 kph, hard length, cutting in from off. Joe Root hops on the back foot and dabs it along the ground, to the right of the gully fielder, who makes a diving stop.
Jasprit Bumrah is back into the attack now. Starts from around the stumps and lands it on a length, around off, angling in. Ben Stokes whips it to deep backward square leg for a single.
A steep bumper, on the leg stump line. Joe Root gets inside the line and lets it be as the ball flies behind to the keeper. Joe looks at the leg umpire for a wide signal but there's none given.
Very full and on the off stump. Joe Root plays with a straight bat and drives it straight to Akash.
Short of a length, on off, Joe taps it off the back foot to the off side.
Angled in and around off, on a length. Root covers the line and tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Very full and outside off, Joe Root leans on it and solidly drives it towards cover. Washington Sundar dives to his left and misfields as the ball rolls behind to the deep. Two taken.
Good length, on middle. Root hops on the toes and forces it out to the cover-point region.

Oh, that's nasty and painful! Stokes is down on the pitch, grimacing in pain. Siraj brings the angle into the batter, good length, jagging back in a long way. Ben Stokes is surprised by the deviation as he looks to pull, but misses as it stays low. The ball pings him right on the box.
Shortish delivery, outside off. Ben Stokes rides the bounce and dabs it to the left of the gully fielder. The man there dives toward the ball and intercepts it.
Pitched full and on the fourth stump, and nips in a touch. Joe prods forward drives it through cover. The bottom hand comes off the handle but it goes in the gap for a single.
Intent! Full and outside off, angling away, Stokes steps out of the crease and slashes it along the ground to deep point. Gets a single.
On top of off, on a hard length, Ben Stokes hangs back in the crease and punches it to mid off.
Root stands out of the popping crease. Siraj goes full and on off, Root plays it with soft hands and taps it to the cover region for a single.
Uses the wider angle, does Akash, on a good length, outside off. Stokes rises with the bounce and fends it out to point.
Speared in fuller and on the leg stump. Root flicks it to deep square leg for a single.
Not that full and outside off, Root strides forward and blocks it out.
Pitched fuller and outside off, Root drives it along the ground to deep extra cover for a couple of runs.
Length-delivery, on off, Root punches it from the crease to cover.
Back of a length, on middle, blocked back to the bowler.
FOUR! Crunched away! Offers some width on off, does Siraj, on a length. Stokes gets the ball at a good height and cuts it through point for a boundary.
Full and outside off, driven firmly by Stokes, but straight to the man at cover.

An appeal for LBW, but not given. Siraj looks certain and there's a chorus of opinions from behind the stumps. KL Rahul mentions that the impact might be outside off. And so is the case. Shubman Gill hears everyone and decides not to opt for a review. On a good length, around off and nipping into the batter. Root plants the front foot out to defend, but the ball clips the front pad before rolling into the off side off the bat. The batters cross for a single and it is given as a run off the bat. But on the replay, it clearly showed that Root's bat was hidden a bit behind the front pad.
Touch full and angling on the pads, Joe Root flicks it to the left of Washington Sundar at deep square leg and hares back for the second run.

Fuller and outside off, Joe Root gets on the front foot and drives it to the right of mid off. Shubman Gill with a long sprint, chases the ball before the ropes. Root completes the second run and just when he turns back for the third, he slips a bit at the batting end and has to settle for two only.
Angling on middle, on a fuller length, Joe plays with a straight bat and pushes it gently back to Siraj.
Bowled from a wider angle, full and angling in on off, Stokes leans on the ball to block. A questioning first over from Akash after the break.
Bounce and deviation again! Around off, on a good length, with some lift. Ben Stokes hangs his bat away from the body and is beaten past the outside edge.
Nagging length from around the stumps. A bit of width on offer on off, with some extra bounce. Stokes is beaten on the square cut.

On the back of a length, outside off, Joe Root stays back and cuts it to the left of deep backward point. Jadeja mops it up to his left and keeps the batters down to a single. The 100 is up for England!
Full and straight, on off, pushed straight to mid off.
Nipping in from off, Root defends it out.

Oh, chance? But it wouldn't have mattered as it is a No Ball for overstepping! Outside off on a fullish length, and nipping away. Joe Root gets on the front foot to drive to the off side, but nicks it off the outside edge and with Dhruv Jurel standing up to the wickets, the ball goes in and out of his gloves and lobs to his right.
Fires it in, full and on off. Stokes meets the ball right under his eyes, and is solid in defence. And that will be LUNCH ON DAY 4!
Banged halfway, short and on top of off. Stokes arches back and lets it fly back to the keeper.
Full and straight on the stumps, pushed straight back.

Around the stumps. Fired on the pads, across the batter on a length. Stokes looks to flick but closes the bat face a bit too much and a leading edge is found. But luckily for Stokes, it goes between the gully and backward point fielders for a couple of runs.
On a length, outside off, Root punches it away to deep point for one more.

FOUR BYES, AGAIN! Keeps sliding down the leg side on a length. Root misses to flick it to the leg side and the ball further curves away to the left of the diving Dhruv Jurel to run behind into the deep fine leg fence. Prodigious movement there.

FOUR BYES! That's gone through everyone! Back of a length, jagging back in from outside off. Stokes is beaten on the inside edge as the ball stays a bit low on the bounce and also beats the diving Dhruv Jurel to his right before running into the fence behind.
Length ball outside off, Stokes leaves.

Oh, almost! Pitched fuller by Akash, in the vicinity of the off pole. It just lands and straightens up a bit. Stokes walks forward covering the off stump and looks to defend, but since it is played with soft hands, the outside edge falls short of the second slip fielder.
Angling in on the off stump, Stokes taps it to the leg side.
Similar line, but the length is fuller now, Stokes offers no shot at it.
On a length and just outside off, Stokes leaves this harmless delivery.
The nip-backer, on a good length, cuts in on off. Joe Root inside edges on the pads.
Tempting Root by bowling in the channel on off, on a good length. Root lets it through.
Fires it on a fuller length and slides on the pads, Joe Root gets inside the line of the ball to flick but misses and wears on the front pad.
Hits the deck hard at 136 kph, does Bumrah, outside off, well left by Root.
Touch full and on middle, Root gets across and flicks it to short mid-wicket.
Jasprit Bumrah is back on. Bowls a good-length delivery, angles in and deviates away from off. Joe Root watchfully lets it pass alone.
Outside off, on a nagging length. Stokes hangs the bat in the air to leave.
Fuller and on middle, Stokes gets on top of it and taps it out to cover.
BEATEN! Around the stumps, on a good length, angling in and on off. Ben Stokes plays inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.

OUT! KNOCKED HIM OVER! One shot too many for Harry Brook and Akash Deep's joy knows no bounds! Akash fires it in, full and laser-straight in front of the stumps. Harry Brook tries to be adventurous and premeditates his shot. Sits on his knee to sweep it away, but gets a bit too across in this process and misses to lay his bat on the ball. Or rather, the ball is a bit too full to play that shot. It beats the bat and smashes into the stumps. Harry Brook departs for a brisk 23 (19) and England are 87/4.
Harry Brook b A Deep 23 (19b 4x4 1x6)
Length, outside off, Root leans back and cuts it in front of square on the off side for a single.
On a back of a length, around the leg stump. Root hangs in the crease and tucks it along the ground to deep square leg. Two more added to the total.
Hits the deck hard, on off. Brook gets behind it and blocks it back to Nitish.
FOUR! Excellent placement! Very full and on middle, holding its line. An absolute fodder for Brook as he flicks between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.
In-between length, on middle, Root brings the bat in front and gets an inside edge as the ball trickles through backward square leg for a single.
On the back of a length, angling on middle and leg. Joe Root nudges it from the crease and gets a couple of runs at deep square leg.
Nagging length, outside off, curving away. Root knocks it off the back foot to mid off.
Into the stumps and full, Root flicks it to short mid-wicket.

SIX! Brook on the offensive now! That's a shot and a half! Akash again misses his length and line, goes full and outside off. Harry Brook plants the front foot ahead and clobbers it over wide long off for a cracking six.
FOUR! Action replay of the previous delivery! Fuller and outside off, Harry Brook gets low, gets his bat underneath the ball, and scoops it towards deep fine leg for a boundary.
FOUR! Inventive and effective! Full and just outside off, Harry Brook shuffles across a bit and gets down on a knee. Scoops it towards deep fine leg for a boundary on the bounce.
Pitched full and on off, Joe Root drives it towards deep backward point for a single.
Length ball, outside off, Root drags his bat inside the line to leave.
Outside off, on a length, well left by Root.

This one just scuttles off the deck as it stays low, full and outside off. Joe Root is completely flummoxed and gets beaten on the outside edge. The ball deflects off the keeper's right pad and rolls to the short fine leg region. They cross and it is called a bye from the on-field umpire.
Outside off, on a length, Root leaves it alone.

Another one that springs off the pitch, around off and on a length. Joe Root transfers the weight on the back foot and plays it very late. Glides it between gully and the slips. Karun Nair at gully, dives to his left and parries it to the second slip.
Angled on middle and leg, on a fuller length, Root flicks it to mid on.
BEAUTY! Kicks off from the deck, outside off, on a length. Joe Root plants the front leg ahead and drags his bat inside the line to leave at the last moment.
On the stumps and full, Root steers it to the mid-wicket region.
Shaping into the batter, on a fullish length, Root clips it to deep backward square leg for a single.

FOUR! What a delicious stroke! Akash goes fuller and outside off, Joe Root takes out a huge stride, gets on top of the ball and drives it through the cover and point gap for a boundary. Lovely extension of arms on that one.
Angling in and around off, Root is stubborn on his forward defence.
Stays low on the bounce, outside off, Root negotiates well and dabs it to gully.
Around off, on a fuller length, Root walks across the stumps and plays it closer to the body to block it out.
Fullish delivery, on off, Root opens the bat from the crease and guides it to point.
Good length, and slanting into the batter with an extra lift off the deck. Brook gets a bit across to play at it but misses and takes a blow on the front pad.
Length-delivery, on top of off, Brook goes inside the crease and knocks it to the off side.
Pitched fuller and in front of the sticks, with an away shape. Brook pushes it to the bowler with a straight bat face.
The stumps are attacked on a fuller length. Brook presents a solid front foot block.
FOUR! A freebie and that's hammered! Short and outside off, enough width and height for Brook as he smashes it a bit flat but right of Washington Sundar at cover-point for a boundary.
Banged on the hard length, outside off, Root climbs on the ball and cuts it to deep backward point for a single.
Tails in on off and middle, Brook works it to mid on.
BIG SWING AND A MISS! Seeing Brook advancing down the track to give it a whack, Akash pulls the length back and bowls it wider on off. Brook is through his shot and is beaten on the outside edge.
Jags in from the surface, on middle, Brook walks across and flicks it to mid-wicket.
At 133 kph, full and outside off, Harry Brook presses forward and stabs it onto the pitch.
Nice and full, on off, Brook forces it towards wide mid off.
BEATEN! Akash Deep beats the bat straight away! Good length, stays low on the bounce outside off. It beats Harry's outside edge as he plays away from the body, and just inside the line.
Good length, outside off, Brook punches it behind backward point for a single to get off the mark.
Goodness gracious! Bowled on a hard length, nipping away from off, and this opens up Brook completely. He is beaten on the outside edge and another good take by Dhruv Jurel behind the stumps.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Another start for Zak Crawley goes in vain and Nitish Kumar Reddy is all fired up as England lose another wicket! Reddy pitches the ball up, full and on the fifth stump line with some away shape. Zak Crawley taps his front foot out and goes for a cover drive, but plays at it with hard hands and a thick, healthy outside edge is found. The ball goes flat and towards the right of Yashasvi Jaiswal who takes a sharp catch at a widish of the two gullies. A big blow for the hosts as Zak Crawley departs for 22 (49) and England are 50/3.
Zak Crawley c Y Jaiswal b NK Reddy 22 (49b 3x4 0x6)
Nagging length, angling on middle and leg, Zak looks to work that across but plays over it and wears on the front pad. A muted appeal for LBW, but it wanes away instantly.
Swing and a miss! Deviates away from outside off, on a good length. Zak misses cutting it square and Dhruv Jurel gathers it watchfully behind to his right.
Length-delivery, outside off, Joe tilts forward and drives it through point for a single. 50 UP FOR ENGLAND!

A quick single! Fuller and straighter, on the fourth stump line. Root leans on the ball and drives it between cover and mid off. Calls his partner through for a single and Crawley responds well as mid off gets to the ball to his left.
Some extra lift from the fuller length, around off. Root gets forward and steers it straight toward backward point.
This one angles into the off stump, on a length. Joe Root plays it late from the crease and dabs it to backward point.
Nips away from middle, on a hard length, Root meets the ball under his eyes and knocks it down the pitch.
Swings away from outside off, on a fullish length. Root shapes to crack the cover drive but gets it off the inner half of the bat and the ball rolls back to Siraj.
Length-delivery, on off, Root advances forward and covers the off stump to negate the deviation and blocks it off on the pitch.

FOUR! Shot of real authority! With Jurel up to the wickets, Nitish bowls it around off, on a good length. Zak Crawley stands deep in the crease and has enough time and height to pull that between mid on and mid-wicket for a cracking boundary.
Short and outside off, almost dies on the bounce. Root punches it through cover-point for a single. He is off the mark.
Length-delivery, on off, Root blocks it solidly off the back foot.
Brings the angle closer to the stumps and then shapes away. Root lets the ball arrive and dabs it with soft hands, on the bounce to the second slip.
Back of a length, moving away wide on off, Crawley hangs back and cuts it to deep point for a single.
Hits the deck hard, around off, with a slight shape away. Zak gets behind it and blocks it out to the off side.

OUT! LBW! A massive appeal but turned down! Looks high but Mohammed Siraj is convinced and Shubman Gill too feels that height could be an issue but takes Siraj's word and goes for the review. Jagging back in, on a good length, on middle, Ollie Pope is beaten on the flick on the inside edge due to the movement. The ball sneaks past the inside edge to clip the front pad before going behind towards the slip cordon. The UltraEdge shows no bat and it is three reds on Ball Tracking with the ball hitting the top of the leg stump. Siraj is delighted and England are now 42/2.
Ollie Pope lbw M Siraj 4 (17b 1x4 0x6)

FOUR BYES! Mohammed Siraj errs in line and sprays it down leg, on a length, Ollie Pope fails to lay any bat on it. The ball keeps low and goes on the bounce to the left of the keeper. Dhruv Jurel moves to that side and gets his left hand to it but it is not enough to take the sting out of it and the ball trickles behind into the fence.

Jagging back in, on a good length, Ollie Pope's head falls over a bit to the off side as he looks to clip it away. There is a bit of extra bounce as well as the ball sneaks past the inside edge and hits Pope high on the back thigh.
Pitched up, on off, Ollie Pope leans into it and drives it to cover.
Angling into the right-hander, on a length, jabbed to mid on by Ollie.
Lands it on a good length, on the off stump, Ollie Pope keeps it out with a straight bat.
Around the pads, on a length, Zak misses out on the clip and wears it on the front pad.
On off, on a length, Zak Crawley gets forward for the block but the ball catches the outer half and dribbles to gully.

Tailing back in, on middle, on a length, Zak Crawley plants his front foot across and looks to wrist it away in front of square on the leg side. Gets a soft leading edge that rolls past Mohammed Siraj at mid off to his right for a couple.
Outside off, on a nagging length, Zak Crawley shoulders arms. Dhruv Jurel collects it on the bounce.
Beats the bat! Bumrah makes the batter play, on a good length, Zak Crawley is forced to play due to the angle. The ball straightens to go past the outside edge.
Slanting into the right-hander, on the fuller side, Zak Crawley shuffles a bit to cover the off stump and lets the ball go.
Another one not close enough to make the batter play, on a good length. An easy leave for Ollie.
Just outside the off stump, on a nagging length, Pope is happy to let it go.
In the corridor on off, on a good length, Ollie Pope holds his bat high and lets the ball go. The ball bounces in front of Dhruv Jurel.
Outside off, on a length, Pope shoulders arms.

Oh, perilously close to the off stump! This nips back in, on a length, just outside the off pole. Not that wide for the cover drive but Ollie Pope goes for it and ends up leaving a gap between the bat and the pad. The ball jags back in but the bounce takes it over the off stump.
Well wide on off, on a good length, an easy leave for Ollie.
On off, on a length, this keeps a bit low but Zak Crawley has it covered. Stays low with the bounce and stabs it down the deck.
Brings the line closer to the off stump, on a good length, Zak Crawley watchfully lets it go.
In the channel on off, on a good length, left alone by Crawley.
Just outside off, on a good length, Zak shoulders arms.

FOUR! Off the inside edge! With an upright seam, on a length, outside off, Zak Crawley leans towards the line of the ball for the drive. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the leg stump and races down to the deep fine leg fence.

Honing in on the off stump, on a back of a length, Zak Crawley plays it a bit tentatively and hangs his bat out without any real conviction. The ball catches the inner half off the bat and rolls through square leg for a brace.
Moving away, on a good length, outside off, Ollie Pope shoulders arms.

Leg bye! This keeps a bit low, on a back of a length, around leg, Zak Crawley fails to clip it away. The ball grazes the front pad and rolls to the left of the keeper. Zak hesitates at first before setting out for the run. Dhruv Jurel gets to the ball and fires in a throw at the bowling end. The throw misses by a long way but don't think it would have mattered much as Crawley was in anyway.
Slightly fuller, around off, Zak extends his hands into the shot and drives it to mid off.
Attacking the stumps, seaming in off the deck, on a length, Crawley works it off the inner half between mid-wicket and mid on for a couple of runs.
And again! The length is pulled back a touch and the line is a bit closer to the batter, Zak Crawley flays at the delivery but fails to connect.
Big swing and a miss! Shaping away from the right-hander, on a length, wide on off, Zak Crawley reaches out for the expansive drive and misses.

FOUR! WOAH! This rears off the deck, on a good length, over off, Ollie Pope looks to cover the line of the ball and play with a straight bat. The ball kicks up to catch the shoulder of the bat and flies over the slip cordon for a boundary.
On a back of a length, on off, Pope dabs it down on the off side.

Now Ollie Pope faces the brunt of the up-and-down behaviour of the surface. This takes off from a good length, over off, Pope tries to get on the front foot and turn it away with a closed bat face. The ball leaps and catches him on the right glove. It dribbles in front of the slip cordon.
On the off stump, slightly fuller, Crawley drops it with soft hands beside the strip on the off side and crosses over.
Jagging back in, on a short of a length, Zak waits back to defend. Ekes out an inside edge onto the front pad.
Beaten! On a good length, angling in and then nibbling away, Zak Crawley defends inside the line and is beaten.
Nipping back in, on a back of a length, over the top of off, Ollie Pope covers the off stump and keeps his bat close to the body to make the leave.

OUT! TAKEN! Mohammed Siraj lets out a roar and is right in the face of Ben Duckett! Add to that, there is a bit of shoulder contact as well. Siraj stays around the wicket and goes into the wicket, outside off, Ben stays on the back foot and looks to unleash the pull. Ben is unable to free his arms in a fashion he would have liked to get the shot away. Ends up spooning it straight to mid on where Jasprit Bumrah takes a dolly. Duckett falls for a run-a-ball 12. England are 22/1.
Ben Duckett c J Bumrah b M Siraj 12 (12b 1x4 0x6)
Delivers it on a good length, on off, Ben knocks it back to Siraj.

FOUR! Wow! Innovative and mighty effective! Pitched up by Siraj, around off, Duckett walks across his stumps and watches the ball all the way onto the bat. Executes the scoop nicely and plays it over the keeper for a boundary.
On a hard length, on off, Ben Duckett punches it on the up to cover where there is a slight misfield but it is backed up by the point fielder.

Swing and a miss! Siraj hurls it on a nagging length, just outside the off stump, Duckett gives the bowler the charge and has a swipe across the line. The ball sneaks under the blade and goes on the bounce to the keeper.

This takes off! Zak Crawley continues to have a testing morning. On a short of a length, around off, Zak Crawley stays back to deal with it. This shoots off the deck and catches Zak high on the handle of the bat. Crawley does well to fend it down on the off side.
Now then, this keeps low! On a back of a length, around off, Zak Crawley lets it go. The ball keeps low and scoots through. It goes on the bounce to the keeper.

FOUR! Fortuitous boundary for Zak Crawley! On the fuller side and Zak is lured by the width on offer. Goes for the big booming drive and a thickish outside edge is induced. It flies towards gully and beats the outstretched right hand of the diving Nitish Kumar Reddy and runs behind to the fence.

With a deepish short leg in place, Jasprit Bumrah serves it on a nagging length, over the top of the off stump. Zak Crawley trusts the bounce and makes the leave. The ball keeps rising on its way to the keeper and Dhruv Jurel takes it at head height.
Angled into the pads, on a short of a length, turned away behind square on the leg side for a run.

From around the wicket, on a back of a length, around off, Ben Duckett lets the ball come to him and gets on top of the bounce. Punches it past point and Washington Sundar cuts it off with a slide. There is a slight fumble on the slide but the batters are content with two.

A loud shout for LBW but the finger stays down! This looks straight and Mohammed Siraj is convinced. Shubman Gill goes for the review with a couple of seconds left on the timer. Nipping back in, on a good length, on middle and leg, Zak Crawley presents a straight bat to defend but is beaten on the inside edge due to the deviation off the pitch. The ball goes through to hit Zak below the knee roll on the front pad. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the Ball Tracking shows that the ball is missing the leg stump. It did not look so in real-time. At worst, it looked to be umpire's call. India lose their review.
This stays a bit low, attacking the stumps, on a length, Crawley plants his front foot across and eases it to mid on.
Sprayed on the pads, on a length, Zak gets inside the line and sets up to help it away but misses. The ball sneaks past the inside edge and catches him on the front pad.
Full and straight, at the stumps, Zak Crawley taps it back to Siraj.
Jagging back in sharply, on a good length, on middle and leg, Zak Crawley is beaten on the flick on the inside edge and wears it on the front pad.
On off, on a short of a length, Ben Duckett plays it square of the wicket to deep point for a single.

Oh, that's nasty! Zak Crawley is lucky to be still out there. That could have gone anywhere. Jasprit Bumrah hits the deck hard and bashes the hard length, over middle, Crawley stays on the back foot to keep it out. The ball rears up off the deck to catch the left glove. It balloons and drops beside the strip on the leg side. Bumrah goes after it with a slide across the pitch to his right but the ball drops short.
Fuller and honing in on the off stump, Zak gets the front pad out of the way to allow the bat to come through. Drives it straight to cover.
In the channel on off, on a good length, curving away, Zak Crawley shoulders arms.

A bit of lift off the deck, on a nagging length, on middle, Zak Crawley hangs back and tries to meet the ball right under his eyes. The ball kicks up a bit to hit the splice of the bat as Zak takes the bottom hand off the bat.

Too straight from Bumrah, on the pads, on a length, Ben Duckett glances it down towards deep fine leg. The call is for two but Ravindra Jadeja gets across to his left in the deep and keeps the batters down to a single.
Pushed across the left-hander, on a short of a length, Ben Duckett sees the width on offer and goes after it. Does not manage to time it well and mistimes the cut to cover-point.
Drags the length back, on middle, Zak pushes it with a straight bat to mid on.
Lands it full, around off, Crawley gets forward and firms the drive to cover.

Beaten! On a good length, on the fourth stump, Zak Crawley expects the ball to angle into him but the ball straightens a bit. Results in Zak getting into a tangle. Tries to get his bat down to chop it down but the ball sneaks under the blade.
A hint of away shape, on the off stump, on the fuller side, Zak Crawley covers the line and blocks it out right under his eyes.

Pitched up, just around the off stump, a bit of shape back into the batter, Ben Duckett presses forward and knocks it with a straight bat to the left of mid off. The fielder gives it a chase and cuts it off. Three runs taken.
FOUR BYES! Runs straight away! Sliding down leg, on a length, Ben Duckett misses out on the tickle. Fails to lay any bat on it and the ball beats the diving Dhruv Jurel to his right for a boundary.

A peach from Jasprit Bumrah but Zak Crawley survives! Just outside the off stump, on a good length, angling in and then it straightens to beat Crawley on the outside edge in defence. The ball rises on its way to the keeper and Dhruv Jurel collects it around his neck. A feisty end to Day 3!

Wow! It's all heating up! Jasprit Bumrah lands it on a good length and there is a bit of lift off the deck. Zak Crawley lunges for the block. The ball kicks up a bit to catch Zak on the gloves and rolls beside him to his right. Crawley calls for the physio and that brings about a reaction from the Indian slip cordon. Shubman Gill walks over to Zak and sarcastically asks if he is okay and goes on to make the 'X' sign of impact sub with his hands pointing towards the pavilion, possibly hinting that Crawley wants to retire hurt. That clearly irks Crawley, who responds animatedly, and there's some finger-pointing involved as well. Ben Duckett tries to defuse the situation and calm Shubman Gill down.
Honing in on top of the off stump, on a back of a length, Zak Crawley lets the ball come to him and defends it right under his eyes.
Slanting in and then nibbling away, just outside the off stump, Zak Crawley holds his bat high and makes the leave.

Zak Crawley and England are away! Straying on the pads, on a length, Crawley clips it to the left of deep fine leg. Akash Deep moves to his left and tumbles in the deep to cut it off. Zak is off the mark with a couple.
Angled in, on a back of a length, a bit of away movement, Zak Crawley shoulders arms.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! The long stop is in on the action straight away, and that's that for India's innings. After the previous swing and a miss, Jofra Archer asked Ben Stokes to get the long stop in. This is banged into the surface from around the wicket, around off, Sundar stays back and heaves across the line. Gets a top edge that goes straight up and towards long stop. Harry Brook takes a couple of steps in and does the rest. Archer finishes with two wickets and India have been bowled out for 387!
Washington Sundar c H Brook b J Archer 23 (76b 1x4 1x6)
Swing and a miss! Banged into the wicket, over off, Washington Sundar has a swipe across the line but fails to connect. The ball sails over the flailing blade.
This moves away in the air, full and outside off, Siraj tucks his bat inside the line and lets the ball go.
Swinging back into the right-hander, full and around the off stump, Mohammed Siraj covers the line and keeps it out.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! A beauty from Chris Woakes! Too good for Jasprit Bumrah. With an upright seam, bowled from wide of the crease, on a fractionally fuller length, Bumrah has to play it due to the angle. Presents a straight bat for the block. Just enough away movement and bounce to catch the outside edge and the keeper, Jamie Smith takes a safe catch to his right. Third wicket for Woakes. India lose their 9th wicket with the scores level.
Jasprit Bumrah c J Smith b C Woakes 0 (8b 0x4 0x6)

Full and angled in at the pads, Washington Sundar wrists it to the right of deep mid-wicket. Calls for two straight away but Ben Duckett is quick to his right in the deep and keeps it down to a single.
Keeps it nice and full, on off, Sundar leans forward and taps it out on the off side.
Woakes lands it full and in the corridor on off, Washington Sundar watchfully lets it go.
Tailing back into the pads and the length stays full, Jasprit Bumrah misses out on the flick. The ball rolls off the pads behind square.
Pitched up, on off, Jasprit Bumrah gets forward and taps it to cover.
On off, on a short of a length, Washington Sundar stands tall and punches it to deep cover. Takes the single this time, does Sundar and that brings about a cheer from the crowd.
On a back of a length, outside off, punched to deep point.

On a back of a length, angled in at the hips, Sundar tucks it to the right of deep square leg. 'Two, two' is the call from Sundar but Bumrah is not going anywhere. Puts his hand up and Washington later realises that there were never two there.
Banged into the deck, wide outside off, Washington Sundar opens the face of the bat and ramps it to deep third. No single taken.
Carse hurls it full and on the line of the off stump, Jasprit Bumrah defends it solidly.
Brydon Carse gets the yorker in, on middle and leg, Jasprit Bumrah brings his bat out in front of the left toe and keeps it out.
In the corridor on off, on a nagging length, Bumrah dabs it to deep point but they do not run.
Seaming away, on a back of a length, over off, Jasprit Bumrah waits back and plays it close to his body. Steers it down to gully.
Sliding down leg, on a length, Jasprit Bumrah misses out on the tickle. Jamie Smith with a good take diving away to his left.

OUT! TAKEN! A stunning catch from Harry Brook! Made it look ever so easy there. Very full and a bit of an away shape on this one, Deep crouches a bit, gets his bat down and opens the bat face to glide it behind square on the off side. Fails to keep it along the ground and hits it uppishly to the right of second slip. Brook dives to that side and sticks his right hand to pluck it nonchalantly. Carse has his first wicket of the inning. India are 385/8 with a deficit of 2 runs.
Akash Deep c H Brook b B Carse 7 (10b 0x4 1x6)
And again! Closer to the off stump, on a good length, just outside the off stump. Washington Sundar defends inside the line and is beaten all ends up.
Ripper! Angled in, on a nagging length, in the corridor of off. Sundar has a feel for the delivery but the ball straightens off the deck to go past the outside edge.
On off, on a short of a length, guided to deep backward point but Sundar does not take the single.
From around the wicket, on a length, on middle, Sundar works it to mid-wicket.

Bye! On a hard length, on top of the stumps, Akash Deep arches back and lets the ball go. The ball goes over the stumps and goes on the bounce to the keeper. Jamie Smith gets down on a knee to gather it but fails to collect it cleanly. The ball goes off his knee and rolls behind for a bye.

SIX! Oh, hello! Jofra Archer steams in from over the wicket and slants it into the pads, on the fuller side, Deep picks it up off the pads and swings to clear the man on the deep backward square leg fence for a six.
Brydon Carse switches to over the wicket and gets a bit of shape back into the left-hander, full and at the stumps, Sundar pushes it to mid off.
On a hard length, on top of off, Sundar gets on his toes and punches it to the right of Carse.

Brydon Carse nails the yorker, on middle, Akash Deep gets his bat down and squeezes it out to the right of mid on. Ben Stokes has a shy at the bowling end but misses. It would not have mattered much as Deep was in.
Shaping away from the right-hander, on a good length, Akash does not follow the line this time and lets the ball go.
In the channel on off, on a good length, seaming away, Deep hangs his bat out intially before withdrawing it.
On a back of a length, on off, Sundar punches it to deep cover and takes the single.
Outside off, on a good length, left alone by Deep.

Given LBW but successfully overturned by Akash Deep for the second time in the over! On a back of a length, on middle. Jagging back in to beat the inside edge of Deep as he tried to defend. The ball has hit the back leg, so it does not have much distance to travel. The finger is raised but Akash Deep takes the review once again. This looks straight. The UltraEdge shows no bat but the Ball Tracking shows that the ball is missing the leg stump, both on height and line. Deep is saved by the review once again.
Fuller in length, on middle, Deep plays it with a straight bat to Woakes.

A loud shout for LBW and the finger is raised! Akash Deep has reviewed it. Looked to be going down leg in real-time. Jagging back in, on a back of a length, on middle and leg, Deep plays all around it and is beaten on the inside edge. The ball brushes the front pad before going on to hit the back pad. The UltraEdge shows no bat but the ball Tracking shows the ball is missing the leg stump.

OUT! STRANGLED DOWN LEG! The change of angle brings luck for Chris Woakes and England! Woakes has a sheepish smile on his face as this was not a wicket-taking delivery by any means. Full and down leg, Jadeja looks to tickle it fine and help himself to a boundary. Does not get the tickle wide enough of the keeper. Jamie Smith dives low to his right and completes a fine catch. Jadeja falls for 72 (131). India are now 376/7, trailing by 11 runs.
Ravindra Jadeja c J Smith b C Woakes 72 (131b 8x4 1x6)
Pushed across the left-hander, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja leaves the ball alone.
Fuller and on off, blocked out.
And again! Nipping back in, on a good length, Washington Sundar holds his bat high to leave the ball alone. Hands on heads for Jamie Smith as the ball was perilously close to the off stump.
Close leave! Curving back into the left-hander, on a length, around the off stump, Sundar shuffles a bit to cover the off stump and lets it be.
On a hard length, over off, Washington hops and stabs it down on the off side.
Honing in at the stumps, on a length, Washington defends it off the front foot.
Going down leg from around the wicket, Washington Sundar leaves the ball alone.
Slanting back into the left-hander, on the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja adjusts to the late movement and brings his bat out in front to keep it out.
Another easy leave for Jadeja as this is well wide on off.
Outside off, on a good length, Jadeja shoulders arms.
Fuller in length, attacking the front pad, Ravindra Jadeja leans forward and pushes it back to Woakes.
A bit of away movement off the deck, on a back of a length, over off, Ravindra Jadeja steers it to backward point.
Angled in at the hips, on a back of a length, Sundar nudges it to deep square leg. The 50-run stand comes up between Washington and Jadeja with this single.

Leg bye! Full and tailing back in late, on middle and leg, Washington Sundar is beaten on the flick. Half a shout for LBW but that looked to be heading down leg. The ball lobbed off the front pad and went to the right of gully for a leg bye.
From a bit wide on the crease, on a nagging length, on middle, Washington Sundar gets right behind it.
Honing in on the off stump, on the fuller side, Sundar presses forward for the block.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Washington Sundar holds his bat high and makes the leave.
Banged in short but well outside off, an easy leave for Sundar.
From around the wicket, pitched up, on off, Sundar drives it to mid off.
Good-length delivery, quite wide on off, Jadeja lets it through alone. Woakes chalks up a maiden on his return to the attack.
Back of a length, holds its line outside off, and Jadeja watches the ball carry all the way through to Smith behind.
Outside off on a good length, no shot offered by Jadeja.
In-between length, at off, angling in with some bounce. Jadeja fiddles at it and dabs it to the slip cordons. The man from gully dives to his right and stops it.
Nibbles away further from outside off. Ravindra Jadeja prods half forward and opts to leave.
Around the wickets. On a length, with a huge deviation away from the batter. Ravindra Jadeja does not play at it.
Lifts up off the deck, outside off and on a good length. Sundar drops the wrists to let it be.
Overpitched on off, angling in. Washington Sundar shovels it back to the bowler. Carse collects it on the follow-through and show a bit of aggression to the batter.
Shapes into the batter, full and on off, Sundar flicks this down the slope, to the left of mid-wicket for a couple of runs.
Jags back in from outside off, Sundar leaves.
Hard length, on the bodyline, tucked into the leg side.

A giant nip-backer from off, on a length. Ravindra Jadeja is caught in the crease as he gets an inside edge to flick it across. The ball hits him around the front knee roll and lobs to the backward point region. Jadeja crosses over for a single and winces in a bit of pain.
Floated wide on off by Root, Sundar lets it be.
Tossed up on off and middle, Sundar smothers the spin.
Darted full and on middle, Sundar is solid in defence.
Flat and full, on off, blocked under the bat.

SIX! What a lovely stroke from Sundar this! Just gets some room outside off, on a full length and he pounces on it. Plays the lofted inside out shot over cover and clears the boundary ropes for half a dozen. India trail by just 16 runs now.
Shortish delivery, outside off, Sundar plays the late cut to backward point.
Shaping into the batter from off, on a fullish length. Jadeja defends it down the track with soft hands.
Nagging length, outside off. Left alone by Jadeja.
Bashes the length hard, on middle and leg. Jadeja misses to tuck it across and wears it on the thigh pad. The ball then lobs and drops in front of square leg.

FOUR! That's deliberately played by the looks of it! More frustration for Ben Stokes. Outside off, on a good length. It lands and nips away. Ravindra Jadeja opens the bat face at the last second to guide the ball wide of gully for a boundary.

INSIDE EDGE, FOUR! The deficit recedes further for India! Hands on head for Stokes as he just cannot believe it. Fuller and just around off. Ravindra Jadeja is drawn into the front foot and looks to drive, but the inside edge is found and it whistles past the stumps to the deep fine leg fence for a boundary.
Starts from around the stumps, short of a good length, on middle. Washington Sundar gets across and nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Looped full and outside off, Jadeja carves it out and squeezes it straight back to the bowler. India now trail by 31 runs.
Lands it full and outside off, pushed to mid off.
Shortish and outside off, punched towards cover-point.

FOUR! Finds the gap to perfection! Drops short, does Root, outside off. Jadeja gets enough width and he bisects that narrow gap between cover-point and backward point. Beats the diving Ollie Pope at cover-point to his right and gets a boundary.
Slower and wider on off. Ravindra lets it be.
Spins away from outside off, on a fuller length. Jadeja sits down to sweep, but it bounces a bit and passes above his bat.
Hits the deck very hard, does Stokes. Sundar rises with the bounce and dabs it out on the off side.
On off and full, Sundar steers it out to point.
Back of a length, around off, Sundar taps it to point.

FOUR! Classical back foot punch! Important runs for India off Sundar's bat. Length ball, around off. Washington Sundar hops on the back foot and punches it neatly to the right of cover for a boundary. Stokes admonishes himself in frustration. The 350 comes up for India!
Inviting line and length, around off, Sundar draws the front foot out and blocks it solidly.
Nagging length and outside off, Washington offers no shot.

SIX! Clean as a whistle! Root drops it full and flat on off. Ravindra Jadeja picks the length early and shimmies down the track. Gets his bat under the ball and with no intention to keep it down, sails it over mid off. It lands on the boundary cushions on the full and goes for a six. The replay confirms the same as well. India's deficit trims down to 39 runs.
Pushed through, full and outside off, Jadeja drives it to short cover.
Tossed up, full and outside off, Washington Sundar drives to the off side and beats the diving cover fielder for a single.
Drifts in and around off, on a length, but this comes straight on as Sundar steers it to backward point.
And again! A quick single! Fuller delivery, quicker and outside off. Jadeja drives it inside out to wide mid off and runs through for a single as Stokes again misfields there.
Flat and on a length, on off, Jadeja hangs back and nudges it to the leg side.
Just outside off, on a good length, Sundar leaves it alone. And again, Stokes gives a bit of an earful to the batter. This is Stokes' fourth maiden over.
Nips away from the deck, short of a length and outside off. Sundar drops his wrists down and lets it be. A bit of a cold stare to the batter by Stokes.

BEATEN! Around off, on a fullish length, nibbling away from the pitch, Sundar brings the bat in front for the forward defence, but it seams away and beats the outside edge. Almost dies on the way to the keeper as Jamie Smith collects on the bounce.
Full and around off, Sundar draws the front foot out and pushes it to mid off.
This one kicks up a bit and jags back in, on a length, around off. Sundar hangs back and leaves it, but is caught off guard by the excessive bounce.
Length-delivery, on the fourth and fifth stump line. Sundar leaves it alone.
Oh, a tight leave from Jadeja! Length, drifting in and close to the off pole. Ravindra Jadeja stands tall and offers no shot. A lot of ooohhs and aahs behind the stumps.
On a length and on the stumps. Sundar works it to deep square leg for a single. Jadeja looks for a second run, but has to settle in for a single as Sundar slips at the non-striker's end.
Another risky run! Flat and full, on off, Jadeja pushes it towards mid off and just skates on to the other end. Nitish obeys and reaches safely as Stokes misfields.
Well outside off, on a length. Ravindra Jadeja has a swish at the ball well after it passed him.
Pushed through full and on off, Jadeja lunges forward and clips it to short mid-wicket.
A round-arm delivery, keeps going straight and around off. Jadeja hangs back and leaves.
A whisperer! Just outside off, on a fractionally fuller length. It lands and seams away from Sundar to beat the outside edge. Stokes looks at the heavens as this has missed by a kitten-whisker!

Fuller delivery, at off, Jadeja pushes at it and hits it off the inner half of the bat as the ball rolls through square leg. A single taken. The deficit is now under 50 for India. They trail by 49 runs.
Back of a length, in the vicinity of off, Jadeja trusts the bounce and hangs his bat in the air to leave.
Angling in from off, on a good length. Washington Sundar hops across on the crease and tucks it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
A short-pitched delivery, outside off, Sundar stays back and drops his wrists to leave.
Speared in fuller at 140 kph, on middle, Washington Sundar covers the line and pushes it to mid on.
He draws the front foot out on this full ball and defends it out to short cover.
Tossed up and overpitched on off, Sundar carves it through cover-point for a single.
Darts in a yorker, on the stumps. Sundar is quick to jam his bat down and squeezes it back to the bowler.
Quicker through the air, fuller and on middle. Sundar leans on and pushes it gently back to Root.
Pulls the length by a yard does Root, on off, Sundar hangs back and tucks it to wide mid on.
Flat and quick, 93 kph, full and around off, eased to point by Sundar.
Too full and straight on off, Jadeja taps it out to the left of the bowler. India trail by 52 runs!
Good-length delivery, on off, Jadeja knocks it off the back foot.
Steep bouncer from Stokes, on top of off. Ravindra Jadeja quickly arches back and lets it pass through.
Not that short and not full either, on off, angling in. Jadeja covers the line to block it back to Stokes.
Nips in from off, on a hard length, Jadeja dabs it down on the pitch.
Short delivery, angling into the bodyline, Sundar jumps on the crease and wrists it to deep fine leg for a single.

Seeing Jadeja advancing down the track, Root fires it wide on off and on a length. Jamie Smith collects and by the time he could break the stumps, Jadeja is quick enough to stretch and drag his back foot inside the popping crease. Good reflexes from the southpaw.
Pitched full and pushed through on off, drilled to mid off.

FOUR! Just beats the fielder! FIFTY FOR RAVINDRA JADEJA! Three half-centuries on the bounce for him in this series. His 25th fifty in Test cricket, and he brings out the famous sword celebration! Very full from Root, on off, Jadeja plants his front foot out and drives it to the right of Root who fails to lay his hands on it and the ball also beats Ben Stokes at mid off who dives to his left and races to the fence.
Floated fuller and on the stumps, blocked off watchfully.
Length ball, drifting on the leg stump. Jadeja hangs back in the crease and looks to work across, but misses and is hit on the front pad.
Root spots Jadeja stepping downt the track and fires it in. Jadeja blocks.
Short of a length, just outside the off stump. Sundar leaves it alone. A very rhythmic over from the English captain.
Hard length, on the bodyline of the batter. Jadeja hops on the crease and nudges it to the leg side for a single.
Length-delivery, in the channel of the off stump. Ravindra Jadeja makes a close leave.
Excellent bowling from the English skipper. Questioning Jadeja on a length-delivery which takes off the deck, around off. Angles in and then straightens to beat Jadeja's outside edge.

Woah! That has flown through! Banged short and over the right shoulder of Sundar. He stays inside the line as the ball takes off to go behind. Jamie Smith has to leap and parries it off the gloves, and it lobs behind to his right. They cross for a bye.
A whistler by Stokes! Length-delivery, on off, just bouncing up a bit. Sundar leans back to cut it square, but misses as the ball passes above his angled bat.
Full and outside off, driven through cover for a single.

Oh, some wild turn! Root lands right on the footmark, outside off on a fuller length. It pitches and then bites away prodigiously to beat Sundar's bat as he tries the inside out cover drive. The ball beats Jamie Smith to his left and is gathered by the first slip fielder.
Flatter and fuller, around off. Sundar takes a giant stride out to defend.
Darted too full, on middle, Sundar drills it out to mid on.
Yard behind full, on off, Jadeja stays back and punches it to the right of the cover fielder for a single.
Round arm, short and on off, Jadeja quickly goes back and cuts it to point.
Short on off, Sundar rises with the bounce and drops it to the off side with soft hands.
On off, on a length, Sundar blocks off the back foot.
Outside off, on a length, shoots low. Sundar leaves.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! An absolute beauty from Stokes as he fishes out Reddy! And again, out of nowhere, the English captain provides the breakthrough for his side. Lands it on a hard length, on off and middle. It lands and curves away late, while also lifting off the deck. Does just enough to clip the gloves of Nitish, who hangs his bat a bit away from his body. Jamie Smith does the rest behind with a regulation catch. Nitish Kumar Reddy departs on 30 (91) and India are 326/6, trailing by 61 runs.
Nitish Kumar Reddy c J Smith b B Stokes 30 (91b 4x4 0x6)
Aims the off stump, does Stokes, on a length, Reddy keeps it out to the off side.
Good-length delivery, seaming away from off. Reddy hangs back and taps it to cover.
A round-arm delivery, on a length, outside off. Jadeja rocks back and cuts it straight to the point fielder.
Pitched full and on off, Jadeja lunges forward and defends.
Full and well outside off, Jadeja leaves.
Flat and full, on middle and leg, Jadeja goes back blocks it out.
Short and turning away from off. Punched off the back foot to wide cover.

FOUR! Into the gap! Dropped short by Root, on middle. Ravindra Jadeja hangs deep in the crease and pulls it over mid-wicket and the ball dribbles into the fence in the deep, beating Sam Cook's dive to his right.
Nagging length, outside off, Nitish makes a watchful leave as Smith gets a good carry behind.
Hard length, on middle and leg. Reddy hangs on the back foot and dabs it across to mid-wicket.
Back of a length, sliding down leg. Reddy misses to nudge it around the corner. Uh, oh! No Ball called as Stokes has overstepped.
Extra bounce on off, on a length. Reddy shoulders arms at it.

FOUR! Streaky, but will do! That could be really frustrating for Stokes. Full and just seams away late from off, Nitish Kumar Reddy pushes at it to play at cover, but gets an outside edge and the ball rushes through the right of gully for a boundary.
Hard length, on middle and leg. Reddy hops off and bunts it to mid on.
Nagging length, on top of off, Reddy taps it out to point. Jadeja takes a few steps forward and Nitish sends him back on a very sharp and loud call.
Slower through the air, drifting in and around off, Jadeja carves out the full ball to cover.
Around the stumps. Outside off, full and turning away. Jadeja leaves.
Lands it full and on the stumps, Reddy clips it to deep square leg for a single.
Floated fuller and on middle and leg. Reddy flicks this with the spin to the mid-wicket region.
Drags the length back and gets some turn in from off. Reddy hangs back and works it to the leg side.
Over the stumps, tossed on off, Reddy flicks the full ball to short mid-wicket.
Angles in and across the batter, down the leg side, on a length. Jadeja leaves as he gets inside the line. And that will be TEA ON DAY 3!
Wide on off and shaping away, Jadeja offers no shot at it.
Full and on middle and leg, Reddy drives it to the left of mid on. The fielder half-stops and parries the ball to the mid off region, allowing the batters to cross over.
On the fifth stump line, full, Reddy drives it to cover.

Overthrows! But more so, a risky attempt to run! Back of a length, angling in and around off. Jadeja taps it to the right of Ollie Pope at short cover and runs a few steps forward for a single, but Nitish denies it. Jadeja turns around to retreat and Ollie Pope dives and underarms the throw at the batting end, but misses and it rolls behind square on the off side. Eventually, they get a single.
Fuller and nipping in from off, Jadeja lunges forward to block, but inside edges onto the front pad.
Pitched fuller and on off, Reddy completely leans on it and drives it to mid off.
Length-delivery, on off, Ravindra Jadeja hangs back and taps it to the right of Archer at point and they cross over for a single. Archer slightly fumbles to pick up, but the ball rolls close to him.
Around off, on a back of a length, Jadeja hangs back and punches it to short cover. Some words exchanged between Stokes and Jadeja.
Stokes follows it up with another short delivery, rising around the chest level. Nitish hops off and steers it to deep square leg for a single.

Dear me! That's nasty, really nasty! Stokes bashes the hard length, and it sharply nips back into the batter from off. Nitish tries to sway away from the line to leave, but it doesn't shoot up as much as he anticipates and he tries to take his eyes off the ball. But gets very little time to react, and the ball smashes in front of the helmet. Nitish seems to be shaken by that but gives a thumbs up as he gathers himself up. A mandatory concussion test will follow for him.

BUZZERS! Full and outside off, Jadeja pushes it to the cover region and is off for a single, but Nitish sends him back and he retreats. The throw is a bit wayward at the batting end, and rolls to the deep fine leg region, which allows them to cross over eventually.
Touch full and outside off, Reddy leaves as it nibbles away.
Full and on middle, Reddy plants the front foot out and drives it straight to cover.
Slants it in, on the stumps, full in length. Nitish solidly defends it straight back.
The angle of attack is on the pads again, Nitish misses the flick this time and wears it on the pads.
FOUR! Played it very fine! In-drifter on the pads, on a fractional fuller length. Nitish Kumar Reddy gets inside the line and glances it towards the deep fine leg fence for a boundary.
An inswinging yorker from Woakes, on the stumps, Jadeja jams his bat down in time and flicks it wide of mid-wicket for a single.
Attacks the off pole, on a length, Reddy meets it right under the eyes and keeps it out to point.
Fuller delivery, fairly outside off, Reddy offers no shot.
Full and straight on off, Jadeja drills it to the left of mid off for a single.
Outside off on a length, Jadeja leaves.
Nips in from the back of a length, around off. Jadeja watchfully lets it be.

Good running this time around! Hard length from Stokes, on off, Jadeja punches it on the rise to the right of Archer at cover. Jofra lets the ball through and the ball rolls behind to the deep. Two taken. The 50 partnership is up between Jadeja and Nitish.

BEAUTY! In the corridor of uncertainty, full and curving away from off. Nitish Kumar Reddy draws his front foot ahead to block, plays inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge. A whistler from Woakes this.
Full and around off and middle, Reddy pushes it down to mid on.
Pitched fuller and on off, Nitish defends it out.
BEATEN! On the inviting line from Woakes, full and just moves enough to beat Nitish's outside edge who pokes at it tamely.
Just kicks up a bit from the fullish length, around off. Jadeja negotiates nicely and steers it to backward point for a single.
Attacks the off stump, does Woakes, on a fullish length. Jadeja lunges ahead and defends it to cover. Shouts 'No' to deny the run.
Full and straight, on off, Reddy knocks it to point. A maiden over by Archer.
An inswinger from off, on a length. Reddy presses forward and stabs it out to the off side.
Nagging length, just outside off, Reddy leaves it alone.
On the stumps, on a length, Reddy forces it out to point.
Back of a length, kicking off the deck on off, Reddy hops on the toes and drops it onto the pitch.
What a delivery! Archer bends his back and bowls a steep bouncer, just outside off. Nitish Kumar Reddy just about manages to drop his wrists down while swaying away from the line to leave.
Length, shaping away from outside off, Reddy steers it through backward point for a single.
Another one that shapes into the batter, Reddy flicks it to mid-wicket.
Good length and tailing in, Reddy pushes it to mid on.
Full and outside the off stump. Reddy gets forward for a drive to the off side, but gets an inside edge back onto his pads and the ball rolls past the off stump.

And again a huge miscommunication, but fortunately for India, no harm done! Back of a length, on off, shaping away. Reddy punches it to the off side, to the point region and is through for a single. Jadeja, too, runs a few steps forward and suddenly stops and seeing him, Nitish has to retreat from halfway.
Chris Woakes is back into the attack. Moving away from the batter, outside off. Reddy leaves it alone.
Jadeja leaves as this length ball shapes away from him.

An appeal for LBW, but the umpire denies. Possibly doing a bit too much to slide down leg. A toe-tickling full ball from Archer, with a huge inward movement. Reddy gets an inside edge on the flick and the ball deflects off the pads and rolls to the leg side and they cross for a run.

The 300 is up for India with this quick single. Archer is on his haunches with a wry smile on his face. Full and slanting on middle and leg, Jadeja flicks it wide of mid-wicket and calls Nitish through for a single. India now trail by 87 runs.
Back of a length, outside off, Jadeja leaves.
Brings the angle much closer, but still outside off, Jadeja offers no shot as the ball nibbles away.
Lands on one of the footmarks, outside off on a length and nips away sharply. Jadeja leaves.
Much better to end the over from Carse. Lands it on a length, shapes in and out from off. Nitish drags the bat inside the line to make the leave.
A gentle outswinger but well outside off, Reddy shows no interest in going fishing at it.
Fuller delivery and outside off, Reddy shoulders arms at it.

FOUR! Easy pickings and that will give Nitish a world of confidence. Carse strays down leg on a fuller length. Nitish Kumar Reddy uses the pace of the ball and just helps it with a flick to deep fine leg for a boundary. The partnership is worth 45 runs now, and India trail by 88 runs.
On a length, shaping away from off, Nitish hangs on the back foot and fends it with soft hands to the gully region.
Pitched fuller and with a tinge of an away shape, on off, Nitish leans on it and times his drive to the off side, but finds the man at cover.
Archer strays down the leg side, on a fuller length, Jadeja gets inside the line to flick, but misses. Smith, behind the stumps, gathers it low by diving to his right.
Speared in at 137 kph, full and on middle and leg. Jadeja closes the bat face a bit early to flick, and gets a leading edge to the cover region.
Bangs it hard on the surface, nipping away from outside off. Jadeja drops his wrists and lets it pass.
Full and swinging down leg, Jadeja misses to flick.

Oh, dear! Another yes and no! Back of a length, moving away from off. Jadeja hops back and punches it to the left of point region. He is off for a single, and is already around halfway, but Nitish is ball-watching at first and then denies for a single. Jadeja turns back to return.

FOUR! Archer is greeted back into the attack with a boundary! Jofra errs in line and bowls it on the pads, on a fuller length. Jadeja gets inside the line and flicks it behind square for a boundary at deep fine leg. An easy fodder for Jadeja.
A tempter from Carse, full and just around off, moving away from the batter. Nitish prevents himself from playing at it. A questioning over from Carse with the second new ball.
Shapes in and around off and then sways away from the batter. Nitish offers no shot at it.
On a good length, outside off, left alone by Nitish.

BEATEN AGAIN! Carse is making the new ball talk instantly! Seam-up delivery, moving away from Nitish, who looks to defend on the front foot. Plays inside the line and gets beaten past the outside edge.

BEATEN! A real snorter from Carse! Fuller and shaping away a shy bit from off. Nitish Kumar Reddy shapes to play the cover drive, but the ball cuts away and beats the outside edge by a kitten-whisker.
An inswinger from off, on a length, Jadeja taps it across to the right of mid-wicket for a single.
Full and at the stumps, firmly driven down the deck by Reddy. Root gets across to his right and the ball deflects off his right boot towards mid on.
Full and around leg, Reddy tickles it past leg slip to his left and beats the man at short fine leg. Collects a couple of runs, does Nitish. India trail by 97 runs.
Sliding on with the arm, full and on middle, Jadeja whips it in front of Ben Stokes at mid on and gets to the other end quickly.
Wider on the crease, full and on off, Jadeja taps it to the right of Root.
Pushed down leg, Jadeja pads it away.
Darted in from wide of the crease on the around the wicket angle, full and on middle, Jadeja brings his bat out in front to defend.
Missed out! Brydon looks to go full but ends up bowling a low full toss, on off, Reddy drives but without much timing and picks out the man at cover.
Hurls it on a good length, on the off stump, Reddy defends it right under his eyes.
Keeps it full and straight, Nitish pushes it to mid on.
Pitched up, on off, Reddy drives it with a straight bat to mid on.
On middle, angled in, on a nagging length, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets right behind it.
On middle, on a back of a length, Ravindra Jadeja nudges it through square leg and crosses over. India trail by exactly 100 runs now!
Full and on off, blocked out by RJ.

Was that a chance? Oh, yes, the replays show that the ball carried but it was a really tough chance. Looped up, on off, Jadeja charges down the track and belts it down the deck. The ball is hit extremely hard and it clips the fingertips on the left hand and deflects onto the boot. It rolls behind for a single. Shoaib Bashir is in pain as he trudges off. Seems to have dislocated a digit on his left hand.
Full and on middle, Jadeja defends it off the front foot.

Drags the length back, on off, Reddy makes room and cuts it wide of deep point to his left. The batters think about the second run but the fielder in the deep is quick to get to the ball and keeps it to a single.

FOUR! Up and over! Tossed up, on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy skips down the track and goes over mid on. Not quite from the middle of the bat as the bat turned a bit in Reddy's hand at the point of impact but the ball has enough legs to reach the fence.
Short and on the off stump, Reddy blocks it out.
On middle and leg, on a good length, Reddy presents a straight bat. The ball rolls off the inner half to deep square leg for one. India trail by 107 runs!
Close leave! A hint of nip-back into the right-hander, on a nagging length, Nitish Kumar Reddy shoulders arms and the ball misses the off stump, both on height and line but not by much.
On off, on a short of a length, Jadeja lets the ball come to him and guides it to the left of gully for a quick single.
Banged in short, over middle, Ravindra Jadeja arches back and lets the ball go.
The length is pulled back slightly, just outside the off stump, left alone by RJ.
Attacking the stumps, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja clips it to short mid-wicket.
Full and on off, Jadeja tucks it wide of mid on and gets to the other end.
Jadeja goes back to a full delivery, just outside the off stump. RJ makes a close leave.

Good effort in the deep! Looped up, full and wide on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy reaches out in front and cracks the drive all along the ground in front of square. Jofra Archer sprints and dives to his right from deep point to save a run for his side. Three runs taken.
Slower through the air, on middle and leg, Reddy presses back to work it with the spin. Gets beaten on the inside edge and wears it on the thigh pad.
More loop on this one, full and at the toes, turned away in front of square on the leg side for one.
Tossed up, full and outside off, Reddy plants his front foot across and gets to the pitch of the ball. Drives it to long on for a single.
Beaten! Fuller in length, in the channel on off, Ravindra Jadeja plays inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.
On a back of a length, on off, punched off the back foot to cover.

FOUR! Edged away! On a good length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja stays back and tries to cover the line. The ball nibbles away a bit to catch the outside edge. Not sure if it would have carried but the ball goes through the big gap between the lone slip and gully for a boundary.
A tempter for RJ, full and wide on off, Ravindra Jadeja leaves the ball alone.
Carse goes wide on the crease and angles it in, on a good length, just outside off. Jadeja gets beaten on the outside edge as the ball straightens off the deck.
Nitish Kumar Reddy is off the mark on the 21st ball! On a back of a length, on middle, Reddy hops and taps it beside the pitch on the leg side for a single.
Fuller and on off, Jadeja gets forward to smother the spin.
Flatter and fuller, on the off stump, Jadeja stabs it down on the off side.
FOUR! Punished! A half-tracker from Shoaib Bashir, on off, Ravindra Jadeja rocks on the back foot quickly and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary. The deficit is now 120 runs.
Tossed up, on middle, Jadeja defends it off the front foot.

'Two' is the call and they get it! Looped up from around the wicket, full and around leg, Jadeja clips it through backward square leg and Jadeja hares back for the second as Harry Brook from first slip gives it a chase.
Drops it short, on off, cut straight to backward point.
This zips through and keeps climbing on the batter, over off, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets into a bit of a tangle but manages to duck under it.
On middle, on a nagging length, Nitish Kumar Reddy dabs it down on the leg side.

It's all heating up at Lord's! Jofra Archer bangs it in, at the left shoulder of the batter, Nitish Kumar Reddy hurriedly drops his wrists and ducks under it. Archer walks all the way up to Reddy in his follow-through and has a word or two to say. Reddy responds with a thumbs up.
At 92 mph, attacking the off stump, on a nagging length, Reddy is late on the ball. Ekes out an inside edge onto the pads.
On a hard length, on middle and leg, Jadeja hops and drops it beside the strip on the leg side. Calls Reddy through for a single and he makes it.
Banged in short, around the ribs, Ravindra Jadeja gets inside the line and keeps the bat and the gloves well away to let the ball go.
Turning in, fuller and on off, Reddy smothers the spin.
Looped up, full and on off, driven firmly to mid off.
Short and on off, Reddy waits back to defend.
Floated full and outside off, Nitish leans on and watches the ball go all the way through to the keeper.
Short and on off, punched away to deep cover for a single.
At the stumps, blocked out with a straight bat.

Another mix-up! It's Ollie Pope again and he misses the stumps this time as well! On a back of a length, on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets on top of the bounce and pats it in front of cover. Sets off for a run and expects Jadeja to cross over. Jadeja sends him back and Reddy is almost halfway when Pope gets to the ball at cover after moving to his right. Picks the ball with one hand and Reddy is out by a mile if the throw hits. Ollie opts not to take a second or two to settle himself and fires in a throw at the batting end and misses.
In the channel on off, on a short of a good length, Reddy lets it go.
Continues to go into the deck, around the right shoulder of the batter at 91 mph, Nitish Kumar Reddy hops and rides the bounce to stab it down.
Bashes the hard length, outside off, Nitish Kumar Reddy shoulders arms.
On a hard length, over off, Reddy holds his bat high and makes the leave.
Fuller and sliding on middle and leg, Jadeja flicks it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Full and just around off, Reddy leans on it and defends it out.

The call is for two, but they will get the third as well! Drops it fuller and on middle and leg. Ravindra Jadeja sweeps it fine behind square on the leg side. Harry Brook from first slip gives it a long chase as the ball loses its steam on the way to the ropes at wide deep fine leg. The batters in the meanwhile, cross each other thrice.
Looped up through the air, around off and full, Jadeja waits for it and taps it to the off side, just beside the pitch.
Pushed through, full and on middle, clipped by Jadeja to short mid-wicket.
Tossed up, full and on off, Jadeja leans on and defends it gently.
Length on middle and leg, knocked straight back.
On a back of a length, outside off, left alone by Reddy.

It's all happening at Lord's! On a back of a length, nipping down the slope from around the wicket, on middle and leg, Jadeja is beaten on the flick as he gets inside the line. The ball goes off the pads to the left of mid-wicket. Ravindra Jadeja is off for the run but Nitish Kumar Reddy does not run, perhaps a bit distracted by the vociferous appeal for LBW from Archer. Ollie Pope is alert to the situation. Gets to the ball quickly and slides to his left to pick the ball. He turns around and has a shy at the batting end. Misses by a long way and Reddy is nowhere in the picture. Pope had more time than he thought and could have steadied himself before having a shy. The ball rolls towards backward point, allowing Reddy to complete the run. Over to the LBW appeal now, Archer is convinced but Stokes is not so and he feels that the ball is going down leg with the angle. Opts against the review. The Ball Tracking later shows the ball was clipping the leg stump and it would have been umpire's call.
On a back of a length, over middle, Jadeja rocks back and plays it back to Jofra. 4 short balls in a row. Is this full ball coming?
Angled in at the ribs on a shortish length, Ravindra Jadeja gets inside the line to help it away but wears it high on the handle of the bat and fends it down.
A good short ball by Archer at pace, just around the left shoulder. Ravindra Jadeja sways away from the line quickly.
On a short of a good length, on top of off, Jadeja gets on top of the bounce and defends.
Gives the ball a lot of air, full and on off, Reddy lunges for the block.
This stays a bit low, at the stumps, on the shorter side, Reddy stays low with the bounce and manages to keep it out.
Shorter and on off, Reddy goes on the back foot and dabs it down the deck.
Loopy delivery once more, around off, Nitish gets right forward and plays it to mid off.
Floated up, on off, Nitish Kumar Reddy gets a good stride in and knocks it to mid off.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Hundred and out for KL Rahul! A soft dismissal and Shoaib Bashir has the big wicket. Slower through the air, on the fuller side, on off, Rahul gets on the front foot alright but pushes tamely at the ball. The ball drops in front of the bat and catches the outside edge. It goes low towards first slip where Harry Brook stays low and snaffles it with ease. Rahul falls for 100 (177). Wickets for England on either side of the Lunch break and this will uplift their spirits big time. India are now 254/5, trailing by 133 runs.
KL Rahul c H Brook b S Bashir 100 (177b 13x4 0x6)
Honing in on the off stump, on a back of a length, Jadeja gets on top of the bounce and stabs it down on the off side.
Dug in short, over middle, Ravindra Jadeja ducks under it.

HUNDRED FOR KL RAHUL! A knock of high class and immense discipline from the Indian opener. It’s back-to-back Test centuries at Lord’s for Rahul. This is his 10th Test hundred overall, and remarkably, 9 of those have come away from home. Archer serves it on the fuller side, Rahul presses forward and drives it to the left of mid off. Calls Jadeja through for a quick single and Rahul makes his ground at the bowling end. KL takes the helmet off and it is all smiles on the Indian balcony as they applaud what has been a special knock. Rahul is the only second Indian batter after former batter Dilip Vengsarkar to score at least two centuries at Lord's, with Dilip having three to his name. An incredible feat this from Rahul.
On a short of a length, on top of off, KL hops back and taps it to cover.
Keeps it full, on middle, Rahul pushes it to mid on.

Tight single! Archer steams in from around the wicket and aims it at the sticks, on a length, Jadeja knocks it to the left of mid on and sets off for a single. Chris Woakes has a shy at the bowling end but misses by a long way. It could have been close had the throw hit.
