Nice loop on this one for Bashir, on a length, around off, Rahul does not quite commit to the front foot and gets half-forward. Fails to smother the spin and the ball catches the inner half before dribbling on the leg side.

Darted into the left-hander from around the wicket, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja gets on the back foot and jabs it between mid-wicket and mid on. Chris Woakes gives it a chase from mid on and pulls it in. Jadeja is off the mark with three runs.
Bashir drops it short and the ball stays a bit low, on middle and leg, Rahul presses back and nudges it past mid-wicket for a single. Moves to 99, does KL!

OUT! RUN OUT! Ben Stokes, you beauty! The golden arm of Stokes delivers for England in the form of a direct hit for a change. A brutal blow for India right at the stroke of Lunch. From around the wicket, this is tossed up, on off, Rishabh leans forward and taps it with soft hands in front of cover. Pant hesitates at first before committing to the single. Stokes swoops in, picks the ball up and turns around. In one motion, he releases the throw and scores a direct hit at the bowling end. The third umpire is called into action. Rishabh stretches forward but the replays show that he is short of his crease. A dive would have probably saved Pant but he decided not to and ultimately paid the price. Stokes lets out a roar and he is pumped up. Rishabh Pant falls for 74 (112). At Lunch on Day 3, India are 248/4, trailing by 139 runs.
Rishabh Pant (wk) run out (Ben Stokes) 74 (112b 8x4 2x6)
Floated up, on off, Rishabh Pant gets forward to smother the spin.
Rahul will feel that he missed out there! A half-tracker from Bashir, outside off, KL presses back and cuts it hard. He can't get it square enough of the man in the deep at point. Just a single.
Banged short on off, Rishabh Pant ducks under the steep bouncer and lets it be.
The line for the left-hander is around off, Rishabh Pant ducks under this short ball.
On middle and leg, on a hard length, pulled through square leg for a single.
Short of a good length, down leg, Rahul gets inside the line and lets it go.

The short ball plan almost comes to fruition for Ben Stokes and England! Brilliant effort by Zak Crawley on the fence. A well-directed bumper by Stokes at the helmet of the batter. Rishabh Pant is hurried on the hook and the ball gets big on him. Gets a top edge that travels all the way down to deep fine leg. Zak leaps and gets both hands over his head. Realises that he is going over the ropes and releases the ball in time. Just a single off it then!

FOUR! Clever, very clever! With a long stop in place, Stokes goes short, on off, Pant arches back and uses the pace on the ball by opening the bat face. Glides it to the left of the man at long stop and picks up a boundary.
Dragged down, on off, slapped to deep cover for a single.
Full and on off, stabbed down on the leg side.
Loopy delivery, very full, around leg, Pant sets up for the paddle but it dribbles off the edge towards leg slip.
Slower and fuller, on off, Rishabh Pant lunges and keeps it out.
Pushed through, on middle, Rishabh hangs back to block.
Attacking the front pad from around the wicket, Pant gets forward to defend.
On off, on a hard length, Pant drags the pull in front of square and takes a single.
Into the wicket, over middle, Rahul rises with the bounce and pulls it through backward square leg for one more.
Stokes goes short and gets it around the ribs, KL swivels and pulls it straight to backward square leg.
Short and down leg, Rahul gets inside the line and lets it go.

FOUR! Gap picked with surgical precision! At pace, on a shortish length, over middle. Rahul is waiting on the back foot and rolls his wrists over the ball to pull it along the ground. Threads it between backward square leg and square leg for a boundary.
Pace taken off, on a short of a good length, Pant helps the pull down to deep backward square leg for a run.
Full and on off, clipped to short mid-wicket.
On the shorter side, on middle, Rishabh crouches and pulls it firmly to deep backward square leg for a run.
Slows it down and gives the ball a bit of air, fuller and on middle, Pant gets forward for the block.
Short and on off, KL presses back and punches it to long on for one.
Sliding onto the pads, on a length, Pant turns it to deep backward square leg for a single.

SIX! Shoaib Bashir is welcomed with a biggie! Floated up from around the wicket, full and on off, Pant skips down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and thumps it back over the bowler's head for a six.

In the air...but safe! Short ball aimed at the ribs, Pant lifts his front leg and flaps at the ball. Gets a top edge that goes down to Zak Crawley at deep fine leg on a couple of bounces. Single taken.
Well bowled! A sharp and quick bumper from Ben at the badge of the helmet, Rishabh Pant hurriedly ducks under it.
Sliding down leg, another slower one, on a short of a length, Rishabh Pant lets it go.
Seemed to be the slower one and the length is outside off, forcing Pant to drag the pull. Rishabh swivels but is early into the shot and fails to connect.
Stokes stays around the wicket for Rahul. Bangs it in short, over middle, KL gets on top of the bounce and controls the pull to the left of backward square leg for a single.

Another short ball from around the wicket that cramps Pant for space. Rishabh Pant gets into a bit of a tangle whilst playing the pull. The ball goes off the gloves and rolls towards backward square leg for a single.
FOUR! Lovely shot! On a short of a length, on off, KL Rahul stands tall and punches it sweetly through covers for a boundary.

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! Dug in short by Brydon Carse, around middle and leg. Due to the slowness of the surface, Rishabh Pant is early on the pull as he swivels to get the shot away. Gets it off the toe end of the bat and the ball spoons towards mid-wicket where Ben Stokes is standing a few yards in off the ropes but does not pick it. The ball lands wide of him to his left for a single.
Sliding down leg, on a back of a length, Pant misses out on working it fine with the angle.

Swing and a miss! On a hard length, over middle, Rishabh Pant gives Carse the charge and has a swipe across the line. Gets beaten as the ball sneaks under the blade. Pant admonishes himself on missing out.
Down leg, on a short of a length, helped away to deep fine leg for a single.
Around leg, on a short of a length, Rahul tries to help it away but misses and catches it on the thigh pad.

SIX! That goes all the way and with this hit, Rishabh Pant brings up his FIFTY. 17th Test half-century for him, and sixth versus England. His fourth fifty-plus score in this series, and on two occasions, he has converted them into triple figures as well. The purple patch in the series continues for Rishabh and he will be hungry for more. Banged in short again by Stokes, Pant makes use of the angle and gets inside the line. Pulls it flat but gets enough elevation to clear deep fine leg for a six.
On middle and leg, short ball, pulled through square leg for single.
Bowled into the deck again, around leg, Pant is cramped for space but manages to get the pull away. Does not time it well and it dribbles in front of deep fine leg. They cross.
Stokes lands it on a short of a good length, angled into the left-hander, Pant looks to get inside the line and help the ball on its way but the ball zips over the blade.

Ouch, that has hurt! Stokes goes wide on the crease and bangs it into the wicket, on middle and leg. Rishabh Pant does not get his hands through the ball in a fashion he would have liked. He is hurried into the shot and cops a blow on the left glove. The ball rolls wide of square leg. Not sure if that has hit Rishabh on the already injured index finger.
On a hard length, on off, Rishabh rises with the bounce and drops it beside the strip on the off side.
Wide! Ben Stokes bends his back and digs it in short, over off, Rishabh Pant ducks under it and the ball goes over his head. With this wide, the century stand comes up between Pant and KL.
On a shortish length, on off, steered to backward point by KL.
On a hard length, at the right shoulder, KL gets on his toes and stabs it down on the off side.

FOUR! Smart batting! With a packed leg side field for the short ball, Carse digs it in short, over middle, KL Rahul backs away at just the right time so the bowler can't adjust to him moving towards the leg side. Rahul gets on top of the bounce and hits it through the vacant mid off region for a boundary.
Haha, what was that? On a back of a length from around the wicket, over middle, Rishabh Pant brings out the reverse and plays the paddle down to deep third for a single.
Short again, around the ribs, Rahul rides the bounce and gets inside the line to control the shot. Helps it down to deep fine leg for a single.
Banged in short by Carse, over off, Rahul hangs back and taps the ball on its head to work it to square leg.
Very full by Stokes, on off, Rahul jams it out through point and crosses over. 200 comes up for India and the deficit is now 187.
Angling into the pads, on a length, glanced to deep fine leg for a single.

From around the wicket to the left-hander, on a length, attacking the stumps, Pant skips down the track and has a massive hoick across the line. Shanks it towards mid-wicket where Harry Brook moves to his left and makes the stop.
The length is pulled back, on off, KL Rahul waits back and runs it down to deep backward point for a single.
Pitched up, on off, KL leans into it and firms the drive to short cover.
On a back of a length, around off, Rahul rises with the bounce and dabs it towards point.
Pitched fuller and around off, Pant leans on it and drives it to the cover region.
Aims the off pole, does Carse, Pant brings his bat in front and blocks straight back to the bowler. Once again, gets his bottom hand is off the handle.
Fuller and outside off, Pant pushes it to short cover.
Back of a length, angling across off. Pant cuts it to point. He looks a bit in discomfort and flexes his left hand.
Hard length, on off, Pant rises on the back foot and punches it to cover.
Pitched outside leg on a fuller length. Pant tries to flick it away, but misses and the ball rolls off the front pad to the leg side. With no man there, Woakes himself sprints towards the ball.
On middle and leg, Pant flicks the full ball to deep square leg for a single. Another productive over for the Indians.
Length ball, on the stumps. Pant pushes it to the mid on region.

FOUR! Slashes and slashes hard! And all of a sudden, runs have started to flow through boundaries for India! Outside off, on a length, not much pace to deal with and Pant throws his bat at it. Gets a thick outside edge and the ball flies past the vacant gully region for a boundary.
Full again, around off, Pant presses forward and taps it to short cover.
Full and on off, Pant blocks it to the off side.
Gentle-paced delivery outside off. Pant keeps it out to point.

FOUR! Almost a carbon copy of the fourth ball of this over! Hat Trick of boundaries for Rahul! Carse angles it onto the pads, on a good length. KL Rahul aligns himself to the line and times the ball through square leg and collects another boundary. India trail by 195 runs now.

FOUR! Smartly played! It isn't timed that well but still gets a boundary. Slightly short and outside off. KL Rahul waits for it and with no backward point in place, he cuts it to the right of gully for a boundary. Brook gives a long chase from gully, but the ball wins the race.
FOUR! That has raced away to the fence! Into the pads, on a good length. KL Rahul steers it towards the deep square leg fence for a boundary.
Pitched quite full and on off, Rahul forces it to the man at the catching mid off.
Around off, on a good length, cutting back in. KL hangs back and punches it to short cover.
Length on off, defended on the off side.
Fuller and outside off, a gentle push down the ground from Pant. Archer from mid off cuts it off as they cross for a double.
Length, nipping in from off. Pant hops off and tucks it to the left of the bowler.

A polite appeal for LBW, but not given. But what was Pant trying to do there? Woakes bowls it full and around off. Rishabh Pant premeditates and plonks his back knee on the pitch, and tries to scoop it behind to the leg side. But misses and falls over on the pitch as the ball rolls to the off side.
Fuller one, on off, Pant presses foward and defends it to cover.
Instantly, Smith is called up to the wickets now. Full ball, on off, Pant defends it out.

FOUR! He has picked the bones out of it! Too full from Woakes, on off, Rishabh Pant dances down the track and smashes it to the immediate right of the bowler for a boundary. Woakes did try to stick his right hand out, but it was hit with venom and raced behind to the fence.
Fuller delivery, outside off, KL Rahul drags his bat inside the line and hides it behind the front pad to leave.
This one nips back into the batter, on a length. KL Rahul is blocked for space and tries to flick it on the leg side. Gets an inside edge onto the front thigh pad as the ball rolls to point.

FOUR! That almost struck Pant at the non-striker's end. Wobbled seam, full and on middle. KL Rahul just transfers the weight on the front foot and drives it to the right of the bowler. Pant arches away from the ball and lets it run down the ground for a boundary.
Back of a length, at the stumps, KL tucks it to mid-wicket.
Extra bounce on the hard length, sliding down the leg stump line. KL Rahul glances it very fine on the leg side and it is chased by Ollie Pope from deep backward square leg. Two taken.
No Ball for overstepping. Hard length, on middle and leg, Pant nudges it across to the square leg region and crosses over.

Brydon Carse is into the attack now. Bowls a short one, on off, Rishabh Pant weighs on the back foot and pulls it to the vacant deep mid-wicket region. The man from deep square leg cuts it off to his right and keeps the batters down to a couple of runs.
FOUR! Excellent placement! Just around off, on a back of a length, KL Rahul uses the depth of the crease to his benefit and cuts it through backward point for a boundary. India trail by 223 runs.
An inswinging slower ball, dipping in and around off, Pant carves on the full to the covers for a single.
Smith is back to his original position now. A slower delivery, trying to find the blockhole, on off. Pant bends a bit and squeezes it back to the bowler.
Close leave! In the channel of off, on a fuller length. Pant watches it closely and shoulders arms.
Length ball, outside off, Pant cuts it to point.
Short and outside off, nipping away. Pant stands tall and slashes it hard, but finds Ben Stokes at cover. Grunts in frustration as he couldn't pierce the gap.
Another short ball, on a similar line, KL Rahul swoops away from the line and leaves.
No Ball for height! Archer continues to bang the surface hard, on off, KL Rahul sways away from the line, but the ball flies over the head height.
Digs in another bumper, at 138 kph, on top of off, Rahul leans back and lets it through to the keeper.
Short of a good length, lifting up from the deck, on off, KL Rahul drops the wrists, arches back and lets it pass.
There's the surprise bumper, going down leg. KL Rahul ducks and it is called the first bounce for the over by the umpire.
Back of a length, outside off, Rahul punches it to the cover region.
At off, on a length, KL Rahul rises with the bounce and knocks it to the bowler.

Audacious! Woakes holds the line on off, and goes fuller, Rishabh Pant, out of nowhere, tries to play the switch hit but misses. A good take by Jamie Smith who is standing up the wickets. Too full to play that shot. Three maidens on the trot.
Much closer now, but still outside off, on a fullish length, Rishabh shoulders arms.
On a length, at the fifth and sixth stump line. Pant covers the off stump and decides to leave.
Similar line, similar length, Pant does the same. Keeps it out to point.
Around off and full, Pant lunges ahead and taps it to the point region.
Smith is up to the wickets again. Full from Woakes, on off, Pant strides forward and blocks it.
At 143 kph, just outside off on a good length, KL Rahul watchfully leaves.
Length ball, around off, Rahul knocks it on the rise to the off side.
A good-length delivery on middle. KL nudges it in the vicinity of short mid-wicket.
Back of a length, on off, KL Rahul punches off the inner half of the bat and the ball rolls to the right of Archer.
Hard length, on top of middle. KL Rahul tucks it to the leg side.
The line of attack is on the stumps, on a length. KL Rahul blocks it off the back foot.
Angles it on top of off, on a hard length. Pant lets it arrive and knocks on the back foot to the leg side.
Back of a length, angling in and around off. Pant stands tall and gently taps it to the off side.
Good length, on the leg stump, steered away to short mid-wicket.
With Smith up to the wickets, still, Pant comes down the track on this fuller delivery, on off. Just decides to block it out.
Fuller and outside off, Pant dabs it to cover.
Jamie Smith is standing up the wickets now. Fractional fuller on off, Pant knocks it to the left of Woakes.
Touch fuller at 144 kph, around off, KL Rahul leans on it and gently pushes it to short cover.
Wide on off, on a good length, Rahul does not poke at this harmless delivery.
On top of off, on a hard length, at 140 kph. KL Rahul lets it come and taps it out to cover.
Short of a length, on off and middle. Pant dabs it across to the mid-wicket region for a single.

Ohh! That kicked off the deck prodigiously. Short and on the leg stump line. KL Rahul hops on the back foot to deal with the extra bounce. Hits it off the splice of the bat and it balloons but lands in the vacant backward square leg region for a single.
Fuller and speared on off, Rishabh clips it to the left of mid-wicket for a single.
At 132 kph, on that in-between length, on off, KL Rahul punches it off the back foot to the off side.
An attempted yorker, on off, KL carves it out and drills it back to the bowler.
Straight and full, on middle, 130 kph, KL Rahul tilts forward and pushes it back to Woakes.
On off, and on a back of a length, KL Rahul punches it on the up to short cover.
Switches the angle for the right-hander. Good length, on middle. KL Rahul hangs back in the crease and nudges it to mid on.
Starts from around the stumps, does Woakes, and lands it full, on off, 129 kph, Rishabh flicks it along the turf to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Over the stumps. Good length, outside off, KL Rahul lets it be. 9 runs off the opening over of Day 3.
Length-delivery, on middle and leg, Pant glances it behind square on the leg side for a single.

FOUR! Intent from Pant in the very first over! Around the wickets now, on a length, angling in and on off. Rishabh Pant shimmies down the track and slashes it over point for a boundary. Takes the bottom hand off the handle but it's timed well enough. That seemingly stung him at the point of contact.
Hits the deck hard, short and on off, Rishabh Pant dabs it down on the pitch with soft hands.
Goes fuller and on off, does Archer, Pant gets forward and pushes it to mid off.

FOUR! The Moving Day gets moving right away! A loosener from Archer, full and on the pads, Rishabh Pant brings the wrists in play and just flicks it behind to deep fine leg for a boundary. India trail by 238 runs.
Pushed through, very full and on off. Solid in defence, is KL Rahul. And that will be STUMPS ON DAY 2, with India trailing by 242 runs!
On a length, around off and middle. KL Rahul hangs back and nudges it to short leg.
Over the stumps. Dropped short and on middle and leg. KL Rahul tucks it off the back foot to square leg.
The length is pulled back by a yard, on middle, Pant gets across on the crease and nudges it gently through square leg for a single.
Too full and very slow through the air, Pant smothers the spin on the front foot.
Around the stumps, full, on middle, blocked straight back.
On the back of a length, outside off. KL Rahul drags his bat inside the line and hides it behind his pads to leave.
Overpitched delivery, outside off, carved out by KL Rahul to the off side.
Another No Ball for overstepping. Outside off, full, goes straight on. KL Rahul leaves this harmless delivery. Carse shakes his head in disappointment on his way back to the bowling mark.
Not too short and not too full either, on off, KL Rahul punches it on the up to short cover. Uh, oh! Carse has overstepped here and it is a NO BALL.
This one jags back in from outside off, on a good length. KL Rahul dabs it down with soft hands to mid on.
Fractionally full, and outside off, KL Rahul with the forward defence.
Makes the batter play at it, does Brydon, full and in the channel of off. KL Rahul strides across and guides it to backward point.
Pitched around off and halfway short. KL Rahul arches back to leave.
Goes straight on with the arm, on a length, around off. Rishabh Pant goes deep inside the crease and punches it to point.
Full on off, Pant eases it back to the bowler.

Short delivery, just outside off, Rishabh Pant hangs back in the crease and cuts it to the left of the diving Brydon Carse at backward point. Chris Woakes from cover chases the ball down the slope to the deep and the batters cross each other twice.
Spins away from off, on a fuller length, Pant gets on top and keeps it out.
Drags back the length, does Bashir, on off, Pant covers the off stump on the back foot and blocks.
Drifting in and on middle, Pant pushes the full ball to the left of the bowler.

Driven nicely, but not timed well enough! Fuller and outside off, KL Rahul plays on the front foot and caresses it through cover and point. Ben Stokes from cover chases it to the deep and the batters hare back for the second quite easily.
This one nips back in a long way with extra bounce, on off. KL Rahul rises with the bounce, and maintains a good shape to punch it to the cover region.
Outside leg, on a good length. Rishabh Pant tries to steer it to the leg side, bu the ball deflects off his thigh pad and rolls behind to short fine leg. They cross for a leg bye.

Good proactive running, but had to hurry there! Fuller delivery, outside off, KL Rahul leans on it and drives it to the left of cover and calls Pant through for a single. Ben Stokes moves to his left and releases the throw at the bowler's end, but has a shy.
Touch full and in the channel of off, nipping in a shy bit. KL Rahul looks to push it across, but inside edges it onto the front pad as the ball rolls on the strip.
Over the stumps, full and outside off, KL Rahul drives it neatly, but straight to the man at cover.
Much fuller, on off, carved out by Pant to the off side. That comes off the toe end of the bat, and Pant grunts in agony.
Darts it full and on middle. Rishabh Pant plants his back knee and falls over on the pitch, and scoops it over short fine leg for a couple of runs.
Drags the length back a bit, on middle, tucked across to short mid-wicket.
Drops it full on off, Pant defends it back to the bowler.
Nice and full, on off, blocked off by Pant.

Very slow through the air, outside off and full, KL Rahul leans on with a giant stride and steers it through the point region for a single. FIFTY FOR KL RAHUL! His 19th Test half-century and he has stood like a wall, fortifying one end with calmness and patience. He will definitely aim to convert this into a huge score.
Around middle and leg, full in length, Rishabh Pant misses to flick it and gets rapped on the front pad and the ball rolls to the mid-wicket region. Possibly doing a bit too much to slide down leg.
Full on middle, angling in, Pant with the forward defence, as he takes off the bottom hand off the bat.
Too full and straight on off, KL Rahul forces the drive to wide cover for a single.
On top of off, on a length, KL Rahul taps it out to short cover.

FOUR! Three quick boundaries for India! Woakes offers a lot of width outside off, on a good length. KL Rahul adjusts to the extra bounce, getting on the toes and cuts it uppishly to widish deep third for a boundary.
Full and angling in on off, KL Rahul presses ahead to defend, but inside edges onto the front pad.

FOUR! Played with audacity and clear intent! Bashir lands it right into the arc, around off on a fullish length. Rishabh Pant gets low and slogs it over mid-wicket for a boundary on the bounce. An expensive over from Shoaib Bashir as 9 runs come off it. India trail by 259 runs.
Drops it on a length, on middle, Rishabh Pant gets across and nudges it to square leg.
Floats it full on middle, Pant taps it straight back.

FOUR! Into the gap! Bashir pulls the length back and offers a little bit of width on it. Rishabh Pant goes back in the crease and plays the late cut, beating the diving backward point man to his right for a boundary.
Around the stumps, looped up full and on off, Pant watchfully defends it on the front foot.
Landed outside off, on a length, KL Rahul rocks back and plays with the spin. Punches it down to long on for a single.
Angles it into the batter, full and on middle, Pant knocks it to mid on.
Nagging length, inviting Pant to have a crack at it, outside off. Pant opts to shoulder arms.

BEATEN! A quicker one followed by the pace-off delivery. Outside off on a length, skidding through quickly. Rishabh Pant stands deep in the crease with Jamie Smith upto the wickets. Is late to cut it away and is beaten on the outside edge.
Slower one by the looks of it, around off on a length, Rishabh Pant hangs back and guides it behind square on the off side with soft hands.
On off and full, Pant meets the ball right below his eyes to block.
Some bounce around off, on a length, KL Rahul steers it in the vast space at backward point for a single.
Flat and overpitched, on the stumps, KL Rahul takes it on the full and miscues the flick shot through mid on for a single.
Very slow through the air, on off, Pant lunges forward and works it to the right of mid on for a single.
FOUR! Swept away neatly! Pitched fuller and outside off. Rishabh Pant picks the length in a trice and brings out the broom. Sweeps it through the vacant deep square leg region for a boundary.
Around the stumps to Pant. Flighted delivery, full and on middle. Pant pushes it back to Bashir.
Too full, on off, KL Rahul drills it down to long on for a single.
Looped up, full and on off, KL leans on to smother the spin.
At off, on a nagging length. Pant dabs it to the point region.

Around off, on a good length, nibbling away with the angle. KL Rahul gets on the front foot and steers it away through backward point. Harry Brook from gully gives it a long chase and stops it right before the ropes. In the process of picking the ball up, Brook gets a bit off-balanced and falls over and the batters cross each other thrice.
Back of a length, on middle, KL Rahul nudges it to mid on. He is keen on sneaking in a single but Pant sends him back on a sharp call.
Just a bit too full, and around off, Pant pushes it with soft hands to the point region for a single. He is off the mark.
Around the stumps, on a length, outside off. Pant offers no shot.

OUT! EDGED, AND GONE! CAUGHT BEHIND! Chris Woakes' ploy to keep Jamie Smith up to the wickets has given him success. He holds the line around the off stump and gets the ball to curve away from the batter, on a fullish length. It keeps wobbling away with the angle and Gill pokes at it to block. Gets an outside edge as the ball straightens up the hill. Jamie Smith reacts quickly to it and takes a sharp catch. A wicket out of nowhere for England as the Indian skipper walks back to the pavilion on 16 (44). India are 107/3, trailing by 280 runs.
Shubman Gill (c) c J Smith b C Woakes 16 (44b 2x4 0x6)
A maiden over to begin with for Bashir! Some turn into the batter from off, on a yard behind fuller length. KL Rahul hangs back and steers it to short mid-wicket.
Fuller delivery, at the stumps, eased to the right of the bowler.
Full and sliding down leg. KL Rahul pads it and the ball lobs behind to the leg slip fielder.
On middle, on a length, KL Rahul rocks back in the crease and punches it to the leg side.
Floated up, on middle, KL Rahul pushes it gently back to Bashir.
Starts off from over the stumps and lands on a length, on off, KL Rahul hangs back and nudges it to short mid-wicket.
Keeps the line on off, and drags the length back by a yard or two. Gill responds with a watchful forward defence.
Angled into the stumps, full in length, Gill presses forward and blocks it off the inner half of the bat to short mid-wicket.
Nice and full, outside off, Gill defends it off the front foot.
In the channel of off, on a length, Gill makes a watchful leave.

FOUR! Right out of the coach's manual! Straight and full, overpitched by Woakes, on off, Shubman Gill plays with a straight bat, maintains a good balance by leaning on the ball and drives it straight down the ground for a cracking boundary.
Full, on middle and leg, Gill clips it with soft hands to the leg side.

In the air... but lands safe! Shortish delivery, on the bodyline. Shubman Gill miscues the pull shot over square leg and it lands well before the deep square leg man fields it to his right. A single taken.
Archer follows Gill as he shuffles outside leg. Bangs it into the pitch, angling it outside leg. Shubman Gill adjusts well to it and knocks it to the cover region.
Just around off on a shorter length, Shubman Gill ducks at it.
Angling onto the pads, on a length, Shubman Gill gets behind the line and tucks it to the square leg region.
Short again, and climbing around the shoulder height of the batter. KL Rahul controls the pull shot, along the ground, and hits it to deep fine leg for a single.
A steep bouncer on middle, KL Rahul dodges this by sitting underneath it.
Full and outside off, Gill prods forward and is solid in defence.

Sliding down leg on a good length. KL Rahul misses to glance it to the leg side and the ball carries behind to the left of the keeper. Jamie Smith dives to gather the ball, even gets his hands on it, but parries it to his left, which allows the batters to sneak in a bye.
Keeps testing the batter around off, on a fuller length, Rahul patiently waits and defends it under his bat.
Straighter, fuller and around off, KL Rahul gets on top of the ball and blocks it to the off side.
On off and full, blocked out by KL on the front foot.
Hard length and outside off. Rahul covers the off stump and steers it past gully for a couple of quick runs. The 100 comes up for India!

A maiden from Archer. His third. Fuller and outside off, Gill draws his front foot out to drive through covers. But his bat twists at the point of contact and the ball rolls off the inner half of the bat to the leg side.
Around off, landing on the fuller length, Shubman Gill presses forward and solidly blocks it out.
Too full, on middle, Gill pushes it straight to mid on.
On a back of a length, around off, Gill taps it on the rise to point.
Surprises Gill with that occasional bumper, does Archer, but slides it down leg. Gill first shapes up to pull but drops his wrists and ducks under it.
Fuller ball, on leg, flicked away to mid on by Gill.
Delivers it on a back of a length, on middle, KL rides the bounce and stabs it down the deck.
At the stumps, full in length, Shubman Gill wrists it to the left of the man at mid-wicket. Brydon Carse dives to that side and parries it in the direction of Shoaib Bashir at mid on. They cross.
Fuller in length, on off, Shubman mistimes the drive to mid on.
On a nagging length, over the off stump, Shubman Gill gets right behind it.

FOUR! Off the edge! On a good length, on off, Gill does not jab at the ball and lets the ball come to him. Looks to defend it right under his eyes. Gets an outside edge that goes down and wide of gully for a boundary.

Jamie Smith is up to the stumps. On a back of a length, over off, Gill gets on top of it and punches it to the left of cover. Wants to sneak in a single but Rahul sends him back and rightly so, as Ollie Pope was quick to get to the ball.
Angled down leg, on a short of a length, Rahul walks inside the line and leaves the ball alone.
On a hard length, on off, KL Rahul stands tall and drops it beside the pitch on the off side. 'No run, no run' is the call from KL.
With a leg gully in place, Archer tempts Rahul to play the tickle, on a back of a length, around the pads. KL resists and lets it go.
Attacking the front pad with a full ball, Shubman Gill works it through square leg and crosses over.
A juicy half-volley, on the pads, Shubman Gill clips it well but picks out the man at mid-wicket.
Sprayed down leg, on a short of a length, helped down to deep fine leg. Shoaib Bashir sprints to his right to mop it up and Gill hares back for the second run.

Full and around the pads, KL tickles it but the ball brushes the pads as well on the way through and therefore, it slows down before the ropes. The keeper, Jamie Smith, gives it a chase and hauls it in. Two runs taken.

FOUR! Excellent wristwork! A half-volley, on the pads, KL Rahul stays balanced in the crease and flicks it between square leg and short mid-wicket. It races down the slope, and Shoaib Bashir's slide goes in vain.
On off, deviating away late, on a length, KL presents a straight bat to defend. The outside edge goes down and past gully for a couple of runs.
Jamie Smith comes up to the stumps. Chris Woakes serves it full, on off, Gill wrists it to the right of mid on for a single.
Keeps it nice and full, around the off stump, Rahul leans forward and steers it wide of point for one.
Woakes starts with a yorker, on the off stump, KL gets his bat down to squeeze it out.
On off, on a length, pushed to cover off the front foot.

Nip-backer from Stokes, on a good length, on off and middle, Gill brings his bat out in front of the front pad to keep it out. Stokes feels he nearly sneaked through, but Gill was solid as a rock. The two skippers exchange smiles.
Pitched up, on off, driven to mid off by Gill.
Hurls it on a nagging length, on middle, tapped to short mid on.
Slanting into the right-hander, on the fuller side, Gill gets forward for the block.
Lands it on a good length, on the off stump, Shubman Gill gets right behind it.
Fuller in length, in the corridor, KL leans ahead and hides his bat behind the front pad to make the leave.
Dug in short by Jofra, over middle, Gill does not quite get hold of the pull. Gets it off the inner half to deep fine leg for a single.
On the off stump, on a nagging length, Shubman pats it down in front of cover.
On a back of a length, around the off stump, Gill presses back and dabs it down on the off side.
Banged in short, around the right shoulder, Shubman shapes up to unleash the pull but then decides to drop his wrists and lets the ball go.
This zips through, on a good length, Gill lets it go.
In the corridor on off, on a good length, KL tucks his bat behind the front pad and makes the leave.
Honing in at the stumps, on a nagging length, KL is a bit squared up due to the ball straightening, but manages to keep it out.
Goes fuller and outside the off stump, Rahul leans forward and plays it to cover.
FOUR! Easily done! Stokes errs in line. Hurls it at the hips, on a back of a length, Rahul tickles it fine of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
On a shortish length, over middle, Shubman Gill drops it with soft hands in front of the man tight at mid on for a quick single.
Serves it on a good length, in the channel on off, Gill plays for the ball angling into him but it straightens off the deck to beat the outside edge.
Lands it on a short of a length, over off, Rahul dabs it from the crease to cover-point.
Archer goes short again, outside off, KL sways away from the line of the ball.
Archer goes into the wicket and gets the ball to rear off the deck, over off. KL Rahul is taken aback but manages to fend it down whilst taking the bottom hand of the bat.
Banged in short by Archer, over middle, KL ducks under it.
Serves it on a hard length, on off, KL rides the bounce and taps it to gully.
On a back of a length, outside off, KL Rahul shoulders arms.
On off, on a good length, a solid block by Gill as he gets on the front foot.
On a back of a length, on off, Gill stands tall and pats it down on the off side.
Full and outside off, left alone by Shubman Gill.
On off, on a length, played to mid off by Gill.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Spectacular grab by Joe Root! On a back of a length, around the off stump, Nair hangs on the back foot and is opened up a bit due to the ball straightening off the deck. Gets an outside edge that goes low and dips on its way to Root at first slip. Root is standing a bit wide at first slip and there is a fair bit of gap between him and the keeper, Jamie Smith. Root gets low and sticks out his left hand and manages to scoop it. The third umpire is called into action and the replays show that Root has his fingers clearly under the ball. 211th catch of Root's Test career and he overtakes Rahul Dravid for most catches by a fielder in Tests. But another disappointing dismissal for Karun Nair as he yet again couldn't capitalise on the start he got. He departs on a well-made 40 (62) and India are 74/2.
Karun Nair c J Root b B Stokes 40 (62b 4x4 0x6)
Pitched up, just outside the off stump, Nair leans ahead for the drive. Miscues it off the inner half to mid on.
On the shorter side, around off, KL Rahul watchfully lets it go.
On off, on a good length, Rahul expects the ball to come into him more than it did. Presents a straight bat to block and the ball rolls off the outer half to gully.
This kicks up a bit and jags back into the right-hander, on a short of a length, on middle, KL fends it down on the leg side.
At the stumps, on a nagging length, patted down the deck by KL.
Carse lands it full, on off, Rahul presses forward and drives it to the right of mid off. Shoaib Bashir is in pursuit and mops it up with a slide. Two runs taken.
Tailing back into the pads, on the fuller side, Nair plays it with a straight bat between short mid on and short mid-wicket. Ollie Pope gives it a chase and pulls it in. Three runs taken.
Fuller in length, on the off stump, firmly driven down the ground by KL but it is cut off by Brydon Carse at mid off with a slide to his right.
On a back of a length, on off, Rahul hangs back and pushes it to cover.

A loud shout but turned down! Taken in the slip cordon but the appeal looks to be more for LBW! Ben Stokes takes the review with a couple of seconds left on the timer. Angling back into the right-hander, on middle and leg, Rahul is beaten on the flick on the inside edge. The ball lobs off the front pad and it is taken at second slip. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the Ball Tracking shows the ball is missing the leg stump, both on height and line. England lose their review.
Bowled from wide of the crease, on a length, on the off stump, Rahul presses forward for the block.
On a short of a length, on the off stump, KL waits back and stabs it down.
FOUR! Sumptuous! Stokes gets it a bit too full at 87 mph, around off, Rahul just leans into the drive and plays it between short mid off and cover for a boundary.
The length is pulled back and it is in the corridor on off, Karun shoulders arms.
Full and on off, Nair plays a stylish drive to Shoaib Bashir at wide mid off.
Coming back into the right-hander, on middle, on a good length, Karun gets behind it to block.
Too straight, on the pads, on a back of a length, Karun helps it to the right of deep backward square leg this time and picks up another couple.
On middle, on a good length, Nair wrists it wide of deep backward square leg for a couple of runs. With this brace, the 50-run stand comes up between Nair and KL.
FOUR! Uppish but in the gap! Width offered by Carse and the length is full, Nair plays a bit in front of his body. Opens the bat face slightly and carves it through backward point for a boundary.

Stokes lands it full, outside off, Karun Nair caresses the drive through covers and it is played down the slope. It comes off the bottom part of the bat and that allows Brydon Carse to haul it back in. Three runs taken.
Straying on the pads, on a good length, flicked through square leg for a single.
Delivers it on a back of a length, on the off stump, KL gets right behind it.
On the off stump, on a good length, Rahul defends it close to his body.
Sliding down leg, on a short of a length, Rahul fails to help it away.
Around leg, on a back of a length, KL turns it away to mid-wicket.

Cut in half! Nip-backer from Brydon Carse, on a length, just outside the off stump, Karun Nair gets forward to smother the movement. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball sneaks past the off pole.
Full and slanting in, on middle, Karun gets into an awkward position again as he plays this. Pushes it a bit uppishly and the ball lands wide of the man at short mid-wicket to his left.
On middle, on a length, Nair gets into a bit of a tangle as the ball angles into him. Shapes up to work it on the leg side. It goes off a soft leading in front of short cover.

FOUR! Beautiful shot! Carse hurls it on a length, around off, Nair leans into the shot and is able to transfer his weight on the front foot. Creams the drive through covers for a boundary. 50 up for India!
Serves it full, at the stumps, KL clips it to the right of mid on for a single.
Full ball, around the off stump, Karun's bat comes down at an angle. Skews off the outer half wide of cover for a single.
Around off, on a length, blocked out off the front foot by KL.
Pitched up by Stokes, on off, Nair just eases into the drive and gets it past the man at short mid off to his right. The fielder goes after it and hauls it back in. Three runs taken.
Fuller in length, on off, Karun Nair gets on the front foot to defend.
On middle and leg, on a length, Nair keeps it out on the off side.

Given caught behind but successfully overturned by Karun Nair! On a back of a length, angled in at the hips, Nair hops to help it away and it is taken by Jamie Smith moving to his left. It did clip something on the way to the keeper, but was it the bat? Karun Nair reviews immediately. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the ball actually clipped the thigh pad.
On a back of a length, around off, Karun rises with the bounce and guides it to backward point.

A beauty from Woakes to end the session! Wobble seam delivery, on a good length, just outside the off stump, KL Rahul leans ahead for the block but the ball seams away to zip past the outside edge. That will be TEA on Day 2!
On a length, in the channel on off, Karun gets forward and does not jab at the ball with hard hands. Steers it with soft hands wide of backward point for a single.
Attacking the stumps, on a good length, Karun gets right behind it and pats it with a straight bat to silly mid on.
Slanting into the pads, on a length, KL plants his front foot forward for the flick. Ekes out an inside edge onto the front pad and it lobs and drops behind square on the leg side. They cross.
Fuller in length, on the off stump, KL blocks it out off the front foot.

On a nagging length, on off, Rahul gets behind the line and expects the ball to go away. It slides on with the angle and KL ends up defending inside the line. Gets an inside edge that rolls in front of square leg.

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! Karun Nair survives. Carse hits the deck and gets a good lift off the deck, on middle, on a short of a length, Nair hangs back and tries to turn it away on the leg side. The ball shoots off the deck and lobs off the bottom glove but luckily for Nair, drops safely well in front of cover.
Serves it on a nagging length, on off, Karun presses back to block.
At the stumps, full and straight, Karun taps it to mid on.
On a back of a length, on off, Karun pats it down on the off side.
Full ball, curving towards the batter, Karun Nair is a bit late on the drive and the bat turns in his hand. Plays it off the toe end towards short mid off.
Delivers it on a nagging length, on the off stump, Karun gets on top of it and dabs it down on the off side.
Attacking the stumps on the fuller side, KL Rahul brings his bat out in front of the front pad to keep it out.
Drags the length back but keeps the line on the off stump, KL stabs it down on the off side.
Full and on the off stump, pushed off the front foot to mid off.
Fuller in length, on the fifth stump line, Rahul gets forward and defends with his bat close to the front pad.
On middle and leg, jabbed towards short mid-wicket.
On a good length, on the line of the off stump, KL Rahul stays back to block.
Straying on the pads, on a length, tucked in front of square leg by Karun.

Peach! Carse bowls the effort ball. Goes into the wicket, on a hard length, over the top of the off stump. Nair plays the line of the ball but it kicks up a bit and nips away to go past the outside edge.
Angled in at the hips, Rahul rises and nudges it to the left of deep backward square leg for a single.
Bashes the hard length, over off but the slowness of the surface allows KL to rock back and ride the bounce to defend.
Very full and sliding down leg, Rahul misses out on the tickle. Jamie Smith with a diving take to his left.
Honing in at the stumps, on a length, Rahul gets right behind it.
Slightly fuller but Archer continues to be around off the stump, Karun Nair presses back to keep it out on the off side.
On off, on a nagging length, Karun covers the line and plays it back to Jofra.
With a short leg and a leg gully in place, Archer looks to get the ball high around the ribs but fails to do so. It is around the hips and Karun gets on top of it to fend it down on the leg side.
Hits the deck hard, around the off stump, Karun Nair holds his bat high and makes the leave.
On a length, on off, knocked wide of cover for a run by KL.

Hurls it on a good length, on middle. The ball is not quite full for the drive, but Nair goes for it and is a bit early on the shot. Plays it a bit uppishly but well away from Archer, more towards KL Rahul at the non-striker's end. It rolls to the left of mid on for one.
Fuller in length, on off, Karun tries to block it out straight but the ball catches the outer half and rolls to deep point for a single.
Beats the bat! On a good length, around the fifth stump, Nair hangs back to defend but the ball nibbles away a bit to beat the bat.
Moving away a touch, on the off stump, on a length, Karun defends it solidly.
Length delivery, on the pads, Rahul wrists it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Angling into the right-hander, on a length, KL sets up to work it away with the angle on the leg side. The ball straightens a bit to catch a soft leading edge and it dribbles in front of cover.
Brydon Carse comes into the attack. Starts with a full ball, shaping away late, on middle, Rahul presents a straight bat to keep it out.
Fuller in length, on off, Nair gets on the front foot and knocks it to the left of mid off. Chris Woakes goes after it and hauls it in. Two runs taken.

FOUR! The plan almost came to fruition for England there! With a leg gully in place, Archer serves it around the hips, on a back of a length, Karun tries to help it away. The ball gets a bit big on him and Nair is a bit rushed. Takes the bottom hand off the bat to fend it down. The ball clips the gloves and goes between the keeper and leg gully for a boundary.
FOUR! Lovely shot! This will help Nair feel a little better. Archer pitches it up, on off, Karun presents a straight bat and just times the drive to the right of mid off for a boundary.
On a short of a good length, on off, Karun gets on his toes and pats it down on the off side.

An absolute jaffa! Angling into the right-hander with the slope, on a hard length, on top of off, Nair's bat comes at an angle but there was not much he could have done better there. The ball straightens off the deck to beat the outside edge.
A hint of away shape, on off, on a length, Karun stays back to a delivery which could have gotten on the front foot. Glides it towards backward point.
Attacking the stumps, on a length, Rahul gets forward for the block.
Woakes keeps it full, on off, Rahul eases it to mid on.

Bowled from wide of the crease by Woakes, full and on off, Rahul defends a bit away from his body, but he does so with soft hands. Gets an outside edge that dribbles towards gully where it is stopped with a dive.
Fuller in length, on middle, played with a straight bat to mid on.
On a good length, on the off stump, KL stabs it down on the off side.

FOUR! Easy pickings! Chris Woakes has not quite gotten his lengths right in this spell. On a back of a length, at the hips, Rahul gets inside the line and helps the pull fine of the man at fine leg for a boundary.
On a good length, outside off, Nair shoulders arms.
Follows it up with a full ball, around off, Nair is a bit late in getting on the front foot. Slices it off the outer half to the left of backward point for a couple of runs.
Bends his back and digs it in short, over off, Nair sways away and sees the ball go past him.
Serves it on a good length, just outside the off stump, KL presses forward and taps it wide of cover for a single.
On middle, on a back of a length, KL gets right behind it.
Going down leg, on a back of a length, Rahul lets it be.
Honing in at the stumps, on the fuller side, Rahul wrists it to deep square leg for a single.
Moving away off the deck, on a good length, in the channel on off, Rahul has a feel for the delivery before withdrawing his bat.
Bowls it on middle and leg, on a length, turned to mid-wicket by KL.
Around leg, on a length, Karun Nair works it to deep backward square leg and crosses over.
This is on a short of a length, on off, Karun covers the line and pushes it down the deck with a straight bat.
Angling in at the hips, on a back of a length, Rahul helps it down to deep backward square leg for a single.
Jofra comes up with a full ball, outside off, Karun Nair is unable to transfer the weight on the front foot. Drives it without any timing to cover.
Delivers it on the off stump, on a good length, knocked to cover by Karun.
Continues to zip it through, on a back of a length, Karun offers no shot.
On a back of a length, outside off, Karun Nair shoulders arms.
Bashes the hard length, outside off, Karun holds his bat high and makes the leave.
Hurls it on a good length, in the channel on off, Rahul plays it late and right under his eyes. Drops it beside the strip on the off side and is off for a quick single.
Woakes keeps it nice and full, on the off stump, Karun Nair is solid in defence.
Beaten! Fuller in length, just outside the off stump, Karun is drawn forward in defence but plays inside the line and gets beaten.
On middle, on a good length, Karun blocks it out by getting right behind it.

Much better from Chris Woakes! Angling in and then nipping away off the deck, on a good length, on the line of the off stump, Nair is squared up in defence and the ball whistles past the outside edge.

Woakes continues to be on the shorter side, around off, Karun rises with the bounce and hangs his bat out in front. Gets it off the outer half and it goes down the slop to the right of gully for a couple of runs.
On a back of a length, on middle, Rahul gets on his toes and tucks it to the right of mid on for a single.

Keeps the stumps in play, on a good length, Karun stabs it to the leg side off the back foot. Archer gets a huge applause from the crowd as he completes an extremely rhythmic first over. A wicket maiden from him straightaway!
Cannons it fuller and on off, Karun Nair looks to drive it to the off side, but gets a thick inside edge as the ball seams in a touch. It then rolls to the leg side, in thereabouts of mid-wicket.
Hits the deck really hard, outside off. Karun Nair leans back to let that pass.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! A dream start to the comeback for Jofra Archer as he draws the first blood pretty early! He bangs it hard on the surface, around middle with the ball deviating away off the deck. Jaiswal opens up and brings his bat in front to defend, but the ball nips away from the surface and takes the thick, healthy outside edge. Flies flat and straight towards the second slip as Harry Brook takes a regulation grab. The Lord's crowd is right behind Archer as he is delighted. India are 13/1 as Jaiswal goes for 13 (8).
Yashasvi Jaiswal c H Brook b J Archer 13 (8b 3x4 0x6)
BEATEN! Good gas from Archer, angling around off, kisses the surface on a length and goes quicker. Jaiswal is late to react and is beaten on the outside edge.

Starts off from over the stumps. Bashes the hard length straightaway, skids through quickly on the leg stump line with some bounce. Yashasvi Jaiswal is hurried and opens the bat face deliberately and taps it out to the off side.
Back of a length, on middle and leg, KL Rahul looks to nudge it into the leg side, but misses and is hit on the thigh pad.
Hard length, angling outside off, Jaiswal cuts it square behind point for a single. Looks for the second but KL Rahul sends him back.
FOUR! Off to a flier, is Jaiswal! Woakes bowls it on a nagging length, but the line of attack is on the pads. Yashasvi Jaiswal gets on the back foot and nudges it through square leg for a boundary.

FOUR! That's deliberately played! On a good length, in the channel of off, shaping back in a bit. Yashasvi Jaiswal rises on the toes and opens the bat face very late to pierce the narrow gap between gully and third slip for a boundary.
Touch fuller on middle, Jaiswal tucks it across from the crease.

FOUR! India and Jaiswal are up and running! Short ball to start with from Woakes, outside off. Yashasvi Jaiswal rises with the bounce, uses the width on offer and slaps it through covers for a boundary.

OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! And that's curtains on England's innings! Carse shows his cards very early as he shuffles way outside off. And spotting that, Siraj fires in a pinpoint yorker, right at the base of the middle stump. Carse tries to whip that away to the leg side, but does not lay any bat on it and hears the stumps shattering behind him. Siraj finishes with a couple of wickets as England are bundled up on 387.
Brydon Carse b M Siraj 56 (83b 6x4 1x6)
A shortish delivery, on off. Carse looks to swat at it, but ends up getting a bottom edge onto his pad.

Woah! What was that from Siraj? Bends his back and digs in a steep bumper, but going way down leg and deviates further away from the batter. Carse walks forward and then ducks under the ball as it just flies way far to the left of the keeper to the deep fine leg fence.
Siraj hurls it on a length, around off, Brydon Carse skips down the track and swings hard. Gets a thickish outside edge that goes on the bounce to deep third. No single taken.
Good length, on off, defended on the off side.
Around off, on a hard length, cutting back in. Bashir presses half forward and stabs it to the cover region.
Length and outside off, left alone.
On the off stump, on a length, Bashir covers the line and defends.
Very full, shaping away, Shoaib skips down the track and ends up getting too close to the ball. Looks to squeeze it out but misses.
Moving away, on a good length, Bashir has a waft at the ball and gets beaten on the outside edge.
Siraj nails the wide yorker, Brydon Carse backs away and ends up giving himself too much room. He has to let the ball go eventually.
Angling back in, on middle and leg, Shoaib Bashir looks to defend. Gets an inside edge that goes down to deep backward square leg for a single.

DROPPED BY JUREL! Oh dear! Siraj is down on his haunches in disbelief! Back of a length, outside off with some extra lift on it. Brydon Carse swings and swings really hard at it, but only manages to get an outside edge and the ball flies to the right of the leaping Dhruv Jurel behind the wickets. Jurel sticks out his right hand to pluck out of thin air, but parries it to the gully region for a single.

Outside off, on a good length, slapped by Carse with brute force to the deep cover region. Akash Deep throws it at the wrong end as the batters complete the second run. Siraj is not happy with the throw as he wanted Akash to throw at his end.

FIFTY FOR CARSE! A brilliant knock from him so far! Back-of-the-hand slower ball from Siraj, full and outside off. Brydon Carse waits, and waits for it and smashes it over the bowler for a boundary on the bounce.

DROPPED? Or is it? Back of a length, angling on middle and leg. Brydon Carse clears the front leg and swings across, but mistimes it aerially off the toe end of the bat. The ball sails and descends to the right of Akash Deep who is standing a few yards ahead from the ropes. Akash misjudges it and tries to grab it with the dive to his right, but does not even manage to get any hand on it. Akash falls over and the ball bounces near him and gets parried behind off his right boot before rolling towards the fence behind. But Akash recovers and stops the ball, keeping the batters down to a couple.

Good length and around off, nips back in a touch. Bashir gets a thick inside edge as the ball rolls towards the deep backward square leg region. Wants a single but Carse refuses it and sends him back.

Was there a glove or bat involved? Bumrah bangs it around the halfway on the pitch and slides it down leg. Shoaib Bashir tries to play the pull shot but it passes close to the bat and Dhruv Jurel flings himself to his left, even gets his left hand on it but doesn't cling on it and parries the ball just behind him. The UltraEdge shows later that it went through alone with no spike on it.
With a crowded slip cordon, Bumrah goes full and it just tails in a bit on middle. Shoaib Bashir keeps it out to the off side.

OUT! CASTLED! A 5-WICKET HAUL FOR JASPRIT BUMRAH AT LORD'S! This is his 13th five-fer and the most by any Indian bowler in away Tests, overtaking former Indian skipper Kapil Dev. Bumrah bowls his stock delivery as he aims the stumps, on a good length. It lands and jags in a touch and also stays down a fraction. Jofra Archer attempts to block off the back foot. But plays all over the wrong line, which creates the yawning gap between the bat and the pad. Enough for the Dukes ball to sneak through that and smash into the stumps behind. Archer goes for 4 (11) and England are 370/9.
Jofra Archer b J Bumrah 4 (11b 1x4 0x6)
Full and around middle and leg, Carse flicks it to the wide mid on region for a single.
SWING AND A MISS! Bumrah angles it on the top of off, on the hard length. Brydon Carse charges down the track, but gives himself too much of room as he swings for the hills. Misses to connect.

Good length, on middle, Archer tucks it to widish mid on. The fielder moves to his right and stops it. A bit of yes and no between Carse and Archer for a single, but they settle without running for it.
Another jag-backer on a length, on the stumps. Archer gets into an awkward position to tuck into the leg side.

An appeal for LBW but the umpire is unmoved. Looked too high to the naked eye. This lands on a good length and jags back in from middle, on a good length. Jofra Archer is hurried by the pace and is cramped up for space to work that into the leg side. Gets beaten and is pinged on the thigh pad.
Good-length delivery, on off, Archer rises with the bounce and works it to backward point.

An absolute pearler! Shapes in and around off, on a length and then curves away from the batter. Jofra Archer is totally squared up as he brings the bat in front to block, but the ball beats the outside edge by a thin margin.
Short of a lenght, outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover.
Around off, on a length, Carse gets half forward and steers the ball past backward point for a couple of runs.
Good-length delivery, on middle and leg. Brydon Carse gets squared up a bit and keeps it out to short cover.

FOUR! Handy runs these for England! Bumrah cannons it on the legs, Brydon Carse hurriedly gets his bat down. The ball comes off the inner half of the bat and races down to deep fine leg for a boundary.
Length, shaping into the batter, Carse looks to whip across but gets an inside edge onto the front pad.
Similar line and length, Carse dabs it to the right of Nitish at gully, but this time he makes a sharp stop to his right. Bumrah appreciates the effort.

MISFIELD, FOUR! A schoolboy error there by Nitish Kumar Reddy! Back of a length, nipping away from outside off. Brydon Carse opens the bat face late and the ball goes off the outer half of the bat, to the left of Nitish Kumar Reddy, who is a bit late to bend low enough. It races behind to the deep third fence.
Nagging length, shaping away from off, Archer decides to leave that alone.
A yard behind full, on off, Archer takes a good stride forward and drives it to the off side.
On middle and leg, on a length, Archer nudges it to the leg side with soft hands.

FOUR! Just past the slip and gully! Hard length, and outside off with some bounce on it. Jofra Archer is late to withdraw his bat, and the ball goes off the bottom end of the bat. Just runs between gully and the third slip fielder for a boundary behind. Archer is off the mark in a streaky way.

OUT! EDGED, AND GONE! CAUGHT BEHIND! Mohammed Siraj breaks this frustrating stand for India and gets a big fish out, Jamie Smith! Siraj hits the deck hard, keeping the line of attack outside off. The ball lands and deviates away from the batter. Jamie Smith plays it from the crease but his feet do not move and he ends up playing away from the body. As a result, a faint outside edge is found and Dhruv Jurel does the rest behind the sticks. Being dropped on 5 by KL Rahul, this has been a brilliant inning from Smith under pressure, as he perishes for 51 (56). England are 355/8.
Jamie Smith (wk) c sub Dhruv Jurel b Mohammed Siraj 51 (56b 6x4 0x6)
Length-delivery, outside off, Carse crouches a bit and works it behind point for a single.
On a back of a length, on middle, Smith blocks it straight back to Bumrah.

PEACH! Evidence of nice carry and swing! Seam-up, good length, angling in and then shaping away from off, Jamie Smith hangs back in the crease and plays it away from the body, getting beaten on the outside edge as the ball curves away.

Fired on the back of a length, on the leg stump. Carse misses to tuck it across and the ball deflects off the thigh pad and runs in the vacant short fine leg region or thereabouts. Dhruv Jurel, the keeper, chases the ball to his left and the batters take a leg bye.
Angled on top of off, on a good length, Brydon Carse leans on it and punches it to point.
Ohh! Some lateral movement there! Pitched outside off, fuller in length, Carse leaves and the ball shapes away from behind the sticks. Jurel gathers diving low to his right.
Bumrah begins from over the stumps. Attacks the off pole, on a length, Carse stays leg side of the ball and taps it to cover.

Ouch, that will hurt! Full and straightening off the deck, outside off, Brydon Carse defends inside the line and gets beaten. The ball keeps a bit low and goes on the bounce to the keeper. Dhruv Jurel gets low to make the stop. The ball clips him on the edge of the fingers on the right hand and rolls behind for a bye. Jurel tries to shake off the pain. That will be LUNCH on Day 2!
Full and on off, Brydon Carse taps it to cover.
Sliding onto the pads, Jamie Smith works this full ball to deep mid-wicket for a single.
On middle and leg, on a length, tucked in front of mid-wicket for a run

FIFTY FOR JAMIE SMITH! A free-flowing knock from Smith so far and he will look to go on and make it a big score as he did at Edgbaston. Full and around the pads, tickled down to deep fine leg for a single by Jamie. 184 in the first innings and 88 in the second in Birmingham and the Lord's Test has started well for him.
FOUR! Glorious from Smith! A full ball by Nitish and wide on off, Smith gets his hands through the ball and creams the drive to the left of mid off for a boundary. Moves to 49, does Jamie!
Bumrah continues to be stump-to-stump. On a length, defended with a straight bat by Brydon.
At the stumps again and on the fuller side, Carse taps it to cover.
Dug in short, around the left shoulder, Brydon Carse ducks under it.

Attacking the stumps and the length stays full, Carse knocks it in front of mid on and the two batters are keen for a single intially but the shot is timed well and Brydon sends Smith back eventually.
FOUR! Fine shot! Pitched up, width offered and Brydon Carse cashes in. Leans into the drive and plays it through cover-point for a boundary.
Jasprit Bumrah is back into the attack. Lands it on a back of a length, outside off, Smith glides it wide of backward point for a single.
Hard length, angled onto the pads, Smith gets inside the line and steers it to deep square leg for a single.
Straighter on off, on a length, blocked out watchfully by Smith.
Good length, on middle, Jamie Smith clips between deep fine leg and deep backward square leg for a couple of runs.
Cuts back in from middle, on a shortish length. Jamie Smith misses to tuck it off the back foot and the ball goes off the thigh pad to the leg side.
Nips in and around off, on a length. Jamie Smith brings the bat down with the angle and gets an inside edge onto the front pad. The ball then rolls into the point region.
Wayward down leg, on a length. Jamie Smith swivels to pull but misses and Jurel dives low on his left to gather the ball.
Another attempted yorker, on the stumps, and this shapes away from the batter. Jamie Smith looks to work it across, but the ball gets squirted out to the off side, wide of cover for a single.
An attempted yorker by Nitish, on middle, Brydon Carse shimmies down the track and carves it to the right of mid off for a single.
Pitched fuller and on off, Carse gets on the front foot and drives it straight to short cover.
Wide on off, on a length, Carse does not poke at it.
Good-length delivery, on off, Smith punches it to point for a single.

A whisperer! Invites the batter on a fuller length, just around off. It shapes in and then just curves away. Jamie Smith gets sucked into the front foot cover drive, but gets beaten past the outside edge.
Nagging length, outside off, Carse leaves this harmless delivery.
FOUR! Classic textbook shot! Touch full, and around off, Brydon Carse gets on top of the ball and just gloriously drives it through covers for a boundary.
Short of a good length, on off, tapped out to point.

FOUR BYES! Oh, dear me! Short and on middle. Brydon Carse ducks under it to dodge and the ball swings very late and away from the keeper, Dhruv Jurel, who dives to his left, but doesn't get to the ball and it races behind to the fence for four byes.
Length ball outside off, Carse reaches after it and hits it straight to point.

Back of a length, angling into the body on the leg stump line. Brydon Carse steps out and mistimes his heave, but luckily for him, the ball lands in the safe zone, wide of deep mid-wicket and is chased by Yashasvi Jaiswal to his right. Two taken.
Carse flicks this full ball to deep square leg for a single.
Back of a length, outside off, Brydon Carse opens up and punches it wide of backward point for a single.
A hint of an away shape outside off, Carse leaves it alone.
Pitched full and angled on the leg stump. Carse drives it straight to mid on.

FOUR! This brings up the 50 partnership between these two! Width on offer from Nitish, full and outside off, Carse liberates his arms and finds the gap between backward point and cover for a boundary.
Nitish Kumar Reddy is brought back on. Starts off with a full delivery that shapes away from off, Jamie Smith slices it through covers for a single.
Pitched fuller and on off, pushed down to mid off.
Hard length, skidding off the deck, outside off, Carse covers the off stump, and dabs it out to backward point.

Good bit of fielding! Shapes in and around off, on a fuller length, Smith cracks the straight drive. The fielder from mid on, Yashasvi Jaiswal, puts in a dive to his left and makes a half-stop, bringing the sting out of it and slowing it down as it rolls to the deep. The man from mid off chases it and keeps the batters down to a single.
Good-length delivery, nipping in from off, Brydon Carse looks to push it in front, but gets an inside edge and the ball rolls behind square on the leg side for a single.
Fuller delivery, just outside off, Carse plays a confident drive on the front foot, but finds the man at cover.
On off, straight and full, Carse presses ahead and knocks it back to the bowler.
Pitched outside off, Carse strides forward on the full ball and caresses it through point for a single. The partnership moves to 45 runs.
This comes quicker with the arm, full and flat, on off, Carse watchfully blocks it out to the silly point fielder.
Fuller and floated up on midde, Carse leans on it to defend.
Tossed up nicely, on middle, Carse defends it to silly point.
Around off, blocked to cover.
Length, on off, Jamie hangs back and drags it to the mid on region for a single.

A quick single! Deviates into the batter, on off, full in length. Jamie Smith pushes at it off the inner half of the bat and hits it wide of mid on for a quick single. There's a shy at the bowler's end, but the ball hits Smith instead.
Length, outside off, punched to short cover.

Back of a length, angling on middle and leg. Brydon Carse has an awkward hoick across the line, and misses. The ball lobs off the thigh pad and falls to the right of the mid-wicket fielder. They cross for a leg bye.
Aims the middle pole, does Deep, full in length, Carse gets forward and taps it out to the off side.
BEATEN! Angles in and straightens up a bit on off, on a good length. Brydon Carse walks a step out and tries to play the initial line, but the ball beats the outside edge by a kitten-whisker.

A huge nip-back from Akash as he switches his ends. Lands on middle, on a length, and cuts in sharply into the batter. Brydon Carse is cramped up for space and takes a blow around his front thigh pad.
Bowls it into the batter and gets it to turn away from middle. Smith hangs back and keeps it out to the off side.
Floated fuller and outside off, Brydon Carse shimmies down the track, but mistimes it off the toe end towards mid off for a single.
Nice and full, tossed on off, Brydon Carse blocks it to silly point.
Pitched full and around off, Carse forces it out to short cover.
Around middle and off, on a fuller length, Carse goes back in the crease and blocks it off.
Jadeja is back on. Drops it full and on off, Carse lunges forward and pushes it to the off side.
Pitched full and just outside off, Carse drives it along the turf to deep backward point for a single.
Bangs the surface hard, does Siraj and angles it on the leg stump line with some extra bounce. Brydon Carse gets his bottom hand off the handle and dabs it beside the pitch on the leg side.
Good length, around off, Smith punches it on the rise to the right of cover for a quick single.
Length-delivery, nipping back in on off, Brydon Carse plays it pretty late off the back foot and guides it past backward point for a single.
Hits the hard length, on top of off, Carse taps it off the back foot to the point region.
Fuller and on off, Jamie Smith leans on it and drives it to extra cover for a single.
Full and on the off stump, Carse gets on the front foot and pushes it to mid off.
Fuller in length, outside off, Smith drives it to deep cover and crosses over.
On off, on a nagging length, punched away to deep point for another single.
Fuller and angling in, on off, Jamie walks down the track and knocks it to the left of Shubman Gill at a widish mid off for one more.
Bashes the hard length, over off, Brydon Carse rides the bounce and drops it in front of point for one
On top of off, on a short of a length, Jamie guides it to the right of gully and takes a quick single.

Half a shout for caught behind but turned down! Incredible one-handed take by Dhruv Jurel diving away to his left. There was a sound but it seemed to have brushed the back thigh. Yes, the replays confirm the same. Nip-backer by Siraj, on a nagging length, on middle, Carse hangs back and is cut in half. The ball clips the back thigh and goes behind.
On the pads this time, on a length, turned away in front of square for a single by Jamie.
Delivers it on a hard length, on off, tapped to mid off.

Sliding onto the pads, on a short of a length, Smith whips it off the hips to the right of deep square leg. Yashasvi Jaiswal puts in a dive in the deep to his right and parries it towards the converging Washington Sundar. A couple more for Smith. 300 comes up for England!
On a back of a length, on middle, Smith hangs back to defend.

Nipping back in, on a good length, just outside the off stump, Jamie Smith looks to defend it with a straight bat but plays inside the line of the ball. The ball dribbles off the outer half and beats the diving Nitish Kumar Reddy at gully to his right. Ravindra Jadeja mops it up in the deep. Two runs taken.
Beats the bat! On a good length, seaming away from the off stump, Brydon Carse presses forward to keep it out but the ball zips past the outside edge.
Goes searching for the yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss from wide of the crease, on middle and leg, Carse knocks it to mid on.
This is on a back of a length, around off, Smith steers it down to deep backward point for a single.
On off, on a nagging length, Smith hangs back to block.

FOUR! The boundaries keep flowing for Jamie Smith! Bumrah sprays a full ball, on the pads, Smith brings his wrists into play and stays balanced in the crease. Flicks it in front of square and beats the sprinting Ravindra Jadeja to his left for a boundary.
On top of off, on a short of a length, Brydon Carse stays leg side of the ball and brings his bat out in front. Gets it off the outer half towards backward point for a single.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Too straight from Siraj again, on a back of a length, around leg, Smith tickles it fine of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
Angling in at the hips, on a back of a length, Smith hops to help it away but misses.
On a hard length, outside off, Jamie Smith looks to drag the pull in front of square on the leg side. Ends up playing it a lot straighter and it goes straight to mid on.
Similar delivery to the previous one, around off, Smith pushes it to cover.
FOUR! All class! On a short of a length, on off, Jamie Smith gets on top of the bounce and with a high elbow, punches it to the right of deep point for a boundary.
Full and on off, pushed to the right of Shubman Gill who is a bit wide at mid off. They cross.
Beaten! Angling in and then straightening off the deck, on top of off, Smith plays the line of the ball and sees the ball whisper past the outside edge.

Good effort in the deep! On a length, around off, Brydon Carse uses the pace on the ball and opens the face of the bat. Glides it past gully and Washington Sundar goes after it with a sprint to his left from deep point. Puts in a slide to flick the ball away from the fence. The ball threatens to spin back towards the ropes but Sundar mops it up quickly. Three runs taken.
On the fuller side, outside off, Brydon Carse lets it go without covering his off stump.
Jasprit Bumrah bends his back and serves a bumper but that keeps going down with the angle. Brydon Carse hurriedly ducks under it.
FOUR! Width offered and Brydon Carse cashes in! A rare loose ball by Bumrah this morning. Well wide on off, on a nagging length, Carse reaches out and hits it through covers for a boundary.
On a hard length, on off, Jamie Smith rides the bounce and fends it down beside the strip on the off side for a single.

An ambitious attempt by Brydon Carse! Full and slanting into the right-hander, Brydon Carse skips down the track to go down the ground. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball sneaks past the leg pole. It goes on the bounce to the left of Dhruv Jurel, who does manage to get a hand to it on the dive. The ball rolls behind for a couple of byes.
Pitched up, around off, Smith knocks it down the ground and Shubman Gill cuts it off with a dive to his right at mid off.
On off, on a good length, Jamie Smith blocks it out off the front foot.
On a back of a length, on off, Jamie Smith dabs it down on the off side.
Slidng down leg, on a length, Smith misses out on the tickle.

Nearly trickled back onto the stumps! Shaping away from the right-hander, on a good length, Smith tentatively pushes at the delivery. Gets an under edge that goes down on the deck and bounces over the stumps. Smith realises that the ball may go back onto the stumps and sticks out his right boot to deflect the ball away from the stumps. Siraj walks over to the stumps at the batting end and performs Stuart Broad's 'bail change' trick for some luck.
Another one this morning that gathers pace after landing, on a good length, outside off, Brydon Carse lets the ball go past him.
Beaten! Just outside the off stump, angling back in, Carse has a slight poke at the delivery and gets beaten on the outside edge.
On the fuller side, going away in the air, Brydon lets it go.
Safely kept out by Brydon Carse! Attacking the stumps, on a length, Brydon Carse gets right behind the line and pats it down the deck.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! India get the review right and Jasprit Bumrah has two in two! In the channel on off, on a good length, Chris Woakes has a waft at the delivery. The ball zips past the bat and it keeps rising on its way to the keeper. Dhruv Jurel gathers it in front of his face, and neither Jurel nor Bumrah go up in an appeal. The men in the slip cordon and Ravindra Jadeja at backward point seem to have heard something, and Shubman Gill goes for the review. The UltraEdge returns a spike when the ball is next to the bat and the on-field decision is overturned. A golden duck for Woakes as England slip down from 260/4 to 271/7. Bumrah has his fourth wicket and is on a hat-trick now.
Chris Woakes c sub Dhruv Jurel b Jasprit Bumrah 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! DRAGGED ON! Jasprit Bumrah gets the centurion. First Stokes, now Root and this is the 11th time in Test cricket that Bumrah has dismissed Root. The nip-backer does the trick again for Bumrah. From over the wicket, on a good length, just outside the off stump, Root is half-forward and looks to play it close to his body and right under his eyes. The movement off the deck results in the ball catching the inside edge and it deflects off the edge to crash into the stumps. Joe Root falls for 104 (199) and both overnight batters are out in no time. England are now 271/6.
Joe Root b J Bumrah 104 (199b 10x4 0x6)
FOUR! Fine shot! On a back of a length, width on offer, Smith stands tall and punches it sweetly through cover-point for a boundary.
Beaten! On a good length, shaping away, Jamie Smith defends inside the line and gets beaten.
Pitched up, on off, Root presents the straight bat and drives it to the right of mid off where it is cut off with a tumble to that side.

DROPPED! KL Rahul puts it down. Mohammed Siraj has his hands on his head in disappointment. On a back of a length, on off, Smith fiddles at the delivery away from his body. Gets an outside edge that flies quickly to second slip. It goes at chest height to KL Rahul and gets to him quicker than he expected. Rahul is unable to quickly decide whether to take it with his fingers pointing upwards or downwards. Sets up to take it whilst staying side on with his fingers pointing upwards. The ball hits him on the palm and pops out. A single taken as the ball goes behind.
On a good length, around off, Smith lets it be.

FOUR! Uppish but in the gap!
