Full and wide on off, a bit of away shape, Smith lets his hands flow into the shot and plays the drive a bit uppishly but well wide of the man at backward point to his right for his first boundary. This four brings up 1000 runs in Test cricket for Jamie Smith! He becomes the joint-fastest wicket-keeper batter with Quinton de Kock of South Africa to take the fewest innings (21) to achieve this feat.
From wide of the crease, tailing back into the pads, Smith clips it through square leg and gets off the mark with a single.
Closer to the batter, on a length, Smith watchfully leaves the ball alone.
Moving away in the air, on the fuller side, Smith shoulders arms. The ball gathers pace after landing and Dhruv Jurel collects it at neck height.
Outside off, on a length, Smith makes the leave.

OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! An absolute beauty from Jasprit Bumrah! The off stump goes for a toss and it is followed by a cold stare from Bumrah towards the English skipper. This is the nip-backer from around the wicket by Bumrah, on a good length, around the off stump, Stokes brings his bat out in front to cover the line but does not account for the movement off the deck. The ball nips back in to go past the inside edge and uproots the off stump. After hearing the death rattle, Ben did seem to indicate that the ball kept low but the replays suggest that was not the case. Bumrah breaks this 88-run partnership as Ben Stokes departs for 44 (110) and England are 260/5.
Ben Stokes (c) b J Bumrah 44 (110b 4x4 0x6)
FOUR! Punished with disdain! Jasprit Bumrah errs in both line and length. Bowls it short and wide on off, there to be put away, Stokes stands tall and slaps it past backward point for a boundary.

Had the throw hit, Ben Stokes was gone! Yashasvi Jaiswal was the man and Stokes had given up. Siraj lands it full, on off, Stokes taps it to the left of cover and is off for a run. Jaiswal moves to his left quickly and picks it up cleanly. He is off balance while throwing the ball, resulting in the throw not being accurate. Has a shy at the bowling end but misses. Stokes had already given up on running.
This stays a bit low, on the fuller side, on a good length, Stokes presents a straight bat but the angle results in the ball catching the outer half and it dribbles towards backward point.
Keeps it around the off stump, on a short of a length, Ben Stokes gets on top of the bounce and pushes it to cover.
Angling across, on a length, Stokes defends it off the front foot.
On middle and leg, on a length, Stokes wrists it to mid-wicket.
Pushed across the left-hander, on a length, Ben Stokes shoulders arms.
Angling in, on a back of a length, on middle, Joe Root gets right behind it.
Sprayed down leg, on a short of a length, Root misses out on the tickle. Dhruv Jurel moves and tumbles to his left to gather it.
Delivers it on a back of a length, around off, Joe Root watchfully lets it go.
Outside off, on a good length, Joe leaves the ball alone.
The length is pulled back and it is a tighter line, Root lets it go.

EDGED AND FOUR! That will be HUNDRED for Joe Root! He just loves batting against India. No batter has scored more Test runs against them than Joe. The Lord’s crowd rises to its feet and goes 'Roooooot' as the champion batter brings up his 37th Test century. With this hundred, Root climbs to 5th on the all-time list for most Test centuries. Bumrah lands it full and gets the ball to shape away, Root uncharacteristically reaches out. Gets it off the outer half of the bat and it goes uppishly but well wide of the man at gully to his right for a boundary. 8th Test hundred for Root at Lord's and his 11th against India in Tests, which is the joint-highest against India, joining Steven Smith of Australia. Incredible feat from the modern-day great of England.
Attacking the stumps from around the wicket, on off, Stokes gets right behind it to block. That will be STUMPS on Day 1!

On off, on a good length, Ben Stokes covers the line and stabs it down the deck. A dot and that will mean Root will remain on 99 overnight, unless there is a no ball or a wide that allows them to sneak a bye.

On a back of a length, outside off, Joe Root gets on his toes and punches it away to the left of deep point. It is hit to the dominant left side of Ravindra Jadeja there and Ben Stokes, with a loud call of no, refuses the second run. Jadeja picks the ball up and teases Root for the second run by rolling the ball in front of him.
Tighter line, on a back of a length, on the off stump, Root stays back to dab it down on the off side.

Pitched up, moving away in the air, outside off, Root frees his arms and drives it along the ground to the right of deep point. Ravindra Jadeja is quick across the turf in the deep and cuts it off. Root moves to 98 with this brace and the 250 is up for England!

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! This straightens off the deck and shoots up a bit as well, on off, on a good length. Root is turned around as he looks to work it on the leg side. Gets it off the splice of the bat and drops it well away from the despairing dive of Deep beside the strip on the off side.
Fuller in length, tailing back into the left-hander, Ben Stokes ekes out an inside edge onto the front pad.
Half a shout for LBW but that is sliding down leg! Shaping back into the left-hander, on middle and leg, on a nagging length, Stokes is baten on the flick and gets hit high on the front pad.
Nipping back in, on a back of a length, on middle, Stokes hangs back to deal with it. Gets beaten due to the movement and wears it on the thigh pad.
Sliding down leg, on a length, Stokes lets it go.
Outside off, on a good length, Root eases it to the left of backward point for a single.
Jasprit Bumrah serves it full and the shape takes the ball further away from the right-hander, Root reaches out and just glides it late to the left of deep point for a couple of runs.
A tempter from Akash, full and moving away in the air, Stokes seemed a bit tempted initially to go for the drive but then resisted and left the ball alone.
Bowled from wide of the crease, seaming away, on a good length, outside off, Ben Stokes shoulders arms.
On the pads again from Deep, on a length, Root helps it to the left of deep fine leg for a run.
Slanting into the pads, on a length, Stokes works it away with the angle towards deep fine leg for a single.
From around the wicket to the left-hander, outside off, on a back of a length, an easy leave for Ben Stokes. The ball just about carries to Dhruv Jurel.
Pitched up, on off, Joe Root walks closer to the line of the ball and clips it to the right of mid on for a single.
On off, on the fuller side, Ben Stokes watchfully defends.
Full and around off, played all along the ground to deep cover for one.
Slanting in, on a length, on off, Root defends with his bat close to the front pad.

Turning into the left-hander, slower and full, on off, Stokes knocks it in front of long on. Karun Nair charges in off the ropes and hurls the ball in, making Stokes hurry towards the bowling end instead of jogging.
Fuller and at the stumps, flicked to mid-wicket.
Short and on middle, tucked on the bounce to short leg.
Slows it down considerably, full and outside off, Stokes drives it to deep cover and hobbles to the other end.

Sundar switches to around the wicket with a leg slip in place. This is pushed across the right-hander, on a length, Joe brings out the reverse and plays it to deep backward point. Root moves into the 90s with this single.
Nicely tossed up, on off, Joe Root presses forward to smother the spin.
Sprayed on the pads, on a nagging length, helped down to deep fine leg for a single.
Keeps it full and around off, solidly defended by Ben.
Floated up, full and on off, Stokes blocks it out.
Fuller and slower, on off, driven to cover by Joe.
Darted in, flat and short, on off, Root is on the back foot to block.
Fired in, very full and this sneaks under the flailing blade of Joe Root. Dhruv Jurel does well to stay low and gather it. NO BALL called for overstepping.

A loud shout for caught behind! Dhruv Jurel is convinced but Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul are not so. Shubman Gill decides against the review. Turn and bounce for Jadeja, short and taking off, Root presses back to punch it away on the off side. Gets beaten on the outside edge and Jurel does well to rise with the bounce and grabs it sharply. The UltraEdge shows a flat line.
Shorter and on the off stump, Joe stays leg side of the ball and guides it to backward point.
Full and straight, pushed back to Jadeja by Root.
Outside off, glided off the front foot to backward point.
Offers flight, full and on middle, Joe Root clips it to the right of mid on where Mohammed Siraj is quick to get across and tumbles to his right to keep it down to a single.
Short and outside off, cut away to deep point for a single.
The length is pulled back, on the off stump, Ben rocks back and taps it to cover. Stokes walks away gingerly towards the leg side.
On off, drifting in, Ben Stokes pushes it to cover.
Fuller and on the off stump, driven to cover.
Sliding on with the arm, on middle, Stokes gets on the back foot to defend.
FOUR! Hit with real authority! Floated up by Jadeja, a bit too full, outside off, Root gets down on a knee and drags it between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.
Fuller and quicker, on middle, Stokes works it to the left of mid-wicket and takes a single.
On the off stump, on a nagging length, Stokes is back to keep it out.
Fired in, flat and short, on middle, Ben Stokes rocks back to block.
Full and angled in, on middle, Root whips it wide of mid on and gets to the other end.
Full and on the pads, Joe clips it to the right of mid-wicket where Washington Sundar cuts it off with a slide.
On middle, on a length, Ben Stokes gets forward to defend. Ben limps a bit as he walks up to his partner at the end of the over.
Very full, on off, Ben Stokes jams it out.
Slows it down and gives the ball a bit of air, on off, Root drives it firmly to the left of mid off for one.
Attacking the front pad, Joe Root lunges to turn it to mid-wicket.
Fuller and slower, on the pads, Stokes works it to deep backward square leg for a run.
Slanting into the left-hander, on the off stump, Stokes goes right back to defend.
This keeps coming on with the arm, on middle, Root goes back to a full delivery but manages to keep it out. First maiden of the game for Jadeja.
Drags the length back a touch, around the off stump, Root stabs it down.
Tossed up, on off, Joe pushes it in front of mid off.
Keeps it full, on the off stump, knocked to mid off.
Sliding on, full and on middle, Root wrists it to mid-wicket.
Spin is in tandem now as Ravindra Jadeja comes on. Darted into the right-hander, on a length, on off, Joe blocks it out.
Flatter and shorter, on off, Stokes waits back to dab it down on the off side.
Turning away sharply, on a nagging length, Stokes shoulders arms.
Fuller, on off, Ben Stokes tentatively defends.
Turning into the pads, on the shorter side, Root helps it down to deep fine leg and crosses over.
Looped up, very full, clipped to short mid-wicket again.
Floated up, full and on middle, Root flicks it to short mid-wicket.
Lands it full, just outside the off stump, left alone by Ben.
On off, on a back of a length from around the wicket, stabbed down on the off side.
On a back of a good length, outside off, cut away to deep point for a single.

FOUR! Sumptuous from Root! Not a bad ball by any means, on a length, around off, Root walks across his stumps and plays it on the move. Whips it to the right of the bowler for a boundary. The 50-run stand is up between these two!
Attacking the off pole, on a good length, Root gets right behind it.
On the off stump, on a short of a length, Ben Stokes gets on his toes and nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
This keeps straight, on the shorter side, on off, Root tucks it down on the leg side.
Sprayed at the toes, Stokes works this full ball to deep mid-wicket for a run.
Slanting in, full and on middle, knocked back to Sundar.
Flatter and wider on off, spinning away, Stokes lets it go.
Slower and turning into the right-hander, on middle, Root plays the reverse to deep backward point for a run.
Short and outside off, punched away to deep point for a single.
Around the off stump, on a nagging length, Stokes gets behind the line and jabs it to the left of mid on for a single.
On the fuller side, going across, Stokes blocks it out off the front foot.
Reddy switches to over the wicket and pushes it across the left-hander, on a back of a length, Ben Stokes hops to punch it away but the ball keeps low. Dribbles off the toe end in front of cover.
Full and tailing back into the left-hander, Stokes misses out on the flick. Gets beaten on the inside edge and wears it on the front pad.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Ben Stokes watchfully lets it go.
Delivers it on a back of a length, on top of off, Stokes gets on top of the bounce and jabs it to mid on.
Shorter and slower, turning away, Stokes slaps it with the turn to deep cover for a single.
Very full, on the pads, Stokes flicks it straight to mid-wicket.
On the off stump again, on a length, driven to cover.
Bowled from wide of the crease, drifting in, full and on off, Stokes defends it off the front foot.
On the pads, on a length, Joe works it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Flat and short, around middle, Root flicks it to square leg.
Beaten! Short and wide on off, Ben's eyes light up as he throws his hands at the ball. Gets beaten on the outside edge.

Ben Stokes survives! From around the wicket, Reddy slants it back into the left-hander, on a back of a length, on middle, Stokes is across his stumps and also walks down the track. Gets beaten on the flick and wears it on the front pad. A confident shout for LBW but turned down. The ball goes off the pads behind square on the leg side and the batters run two. KL Rahul reckons that it could be more than 3 metres on impact but Jasprit Bumrah convinces Shubman Gill to take the review. No bat involved on UltraEdge and Ball Tracking shows that the impact is in line and it is not more than 3 metres but it is clipping the leg stump. It is umpire's call on the projection and the on-field decision is upheld.
Drags the length back but keeps it around the off stump, left alone by Ben.
Better from Reddy! Angling back into the left-hander, just outside the off stump, Stokes opts to leave without covering his off stump.
FOUR! Easily done! Nitish Kumar Reddy gets the line wrong as he sprays it on the pads, on a length, Stokes gets inside the line and tickles it fine towards deep fine leg for a boundary.
Starts from around the wicket and goes a bit wide on the crease. Serves it in the channel on off, on a length, left alone by Stokes.
Flatter and quicker from Sundar, outside off on a length. Ben Stokes is quick to hang back in the crease and cuts it to deep point for a single.
Sliding on the leg stump line, Ben Stokes gets on the front foot and clips it to deep backward square leg for a quick couple of runs.
Fuller ball, tossed up outside off, driven inside out to short cover.
Flighted outside off, on a yard behind fuller length. Stokes rocks back and knocks it straight back.
Tossed up, on middle, Joe Root flicks it to wide mid on for a single.
Pushed through full and on middle, Root leans on and clips it to short mid-wicket.
Short and angling on the leg stump. Joe Root swivels and controls the pull shot to long leg for a single.
Keeps the stumps in play, full and on middle. Root plants the front foot across and flicks it to short mid-wicket.
Fires it fuller and on off, Root eases it back to Siraj with soft hands.
Fuller delivery and outside off, Root taps it out to backward point.
Ouch! Back of a length, jagging back with some lift off the deck. Joe Root defends it off the crease but gets an inside edge on the front thigh. Looks a bit hurt and rubs off the bruised area.
Some bounce for Siraj on a good length, angling into the batter. Root pushes at it and plays over the line as he gets rammed on the thigh pad.
Over the stumps for Root. Flat and quick, full and sliding onto the pads. Joe Root clips this behind square on the leg side for a single.
Drags the length back a bit, outside off. Ben Stokes quickly goes deep in the crease and cuts it to deep point for a single.
Pushed through full and on off, pushed to mid off.
Fuller and on off, Stokes gets forward to block.
Darted into the batter, on a flatter trajectory, with some bounce. Ben Stokes fends it out to the off side.
Looped fuller, on off, Ben Stokes lunges forward and drives inside out to cover.

An occasional bumper from Siraj, which lifts off the deck, angling on the bodyline. Ben Stokes swivels and pulls, but one hand comes off the handle, but he manages to pull it towards deep backward square leg. The 200 is up for England with this single!
Identical line and length, Stokes again with the forward defence.
Aimed at the off stump, full in length, Stokes gets on top of the ball and blocks it out.
Hard length, outside off, Ben Stokes mistimes the back foot punch, playing it a bit uppishly through cover-point for a couple of runs.
Stokes shows his cards early as he advances down the track, and spotting that, Siraj looks to bang it in but sprays it down leg. Stokes is far across and lets it be.
Full and on off, Root gets on the front foot and drives it wide of mid off for an easy single.

This keeps sliding into the batter, on a length, on middle, skidding off the surface as well. Ben Stokes quickly hangs on the back foot, clears the front leg and hits it through the line to the bowler.
Nice and full, on off, pushed back to Sundar.
Full, drifting on off, Stokes defends it off the inside edge and the ball rolls back to the bowler off the front pad.
BEATEN! Provides a bit more loop on this one, and lands it around off. Gets a good grip as the ball bites away from Stokes, beating his outside edge as he looks to drive through covers.
Length, on off, Stokes hangs back and punches it to the cover region.
Around the stumps, bowls it from a wider angle, and drifts into the batter. Stokes leans on and pushes the full ball out to cover.
Outside off, on a good length, Stokes leans back and cuts it to deep backward point for a single.
Fuller and pushed around off, Stokes keeps it out to extra cover.

Angled across off, too full, Stokes hits it off the bottom of the bat, and finds the fielder at cover. The replay shows that it came right off the bottom as the bat got twisted at the point of contact.
Fractionally fuller length, around off, Stokes is solid in defence on the front foot.
Straighter, fuller, on middle, Stokes drives it crisply, but finds wide mid on.
Mohammed Siraj is brought back into the attack. Goes full and on middle and off, Ben Stokes flicks it down the hill to the deep mid-wicket region for a couple of runs.
Quick and full, outside off, Joe Root plays with hard hands and gets an inside edge to the leg side.
Nice and full, on off, Root is solid in defence.
Length, on off, Root steps back and punches it back to Jadeja.
Full and flat, outside off, Root mistimes the off drive, and gets it off the inner half of the bat, as the ball rolls back to the bowler.
Darted fuller on middle, Root flicks it out to short mid-wicket.
Not too full, and not that short either, on off. Stokes hangs back in his crease and punches it across to long on for a single.
Seaming in and around off, Joe Root clips this full ball wide of mid on for a couple of runs as Yashasvi Jaiswal, from mid on, chases it before the ropes. Keeps the batters down to a couple of runs.
Full and angling on the pads, Ben Stokes flicks it all along the turf to deep square leg for another single.
Back of a length, on off, punched to the left of the bowler.
Fuller and outside off, Joe Root leans on and slices it off the outer half of the bat. A single at deep backward point.
Oh, beaten! Outside off, on a good length, jagging back in a touch with some uneven bounce. Joe Root shapes to cut that square on the off side, but gets beaten on the inside edge.
Nagging length, angling on off and middle. Root meets the ball right below his eyes and taps it out to the off side.
Spinning in from off, Stokes flicks the full ball to short mid-wicket.
Flighted delivery, on off, Root works it comfortably down to long off for a single.
Edgy! Lands just outside off and holds its line, Ben Stokes is hurried on the back foot and gets an outside edge. The ball shoots past the left of the first slip fielder for a single.
Fuller ball, on off, Stokes lunges forward and defends it to the off side.
Floated fuller and on off, Stokes pushes it to the left of Jadeja.
Slowish through the air, full and on middle, Root clips it in front of square leg and skates through for a quick single.
Pitched up, around off, worked straight to mid off.

FOUR! Up and just over! Back of a length, deviating away from the batter. Ben Stokes mistimes the square cut and plays it uppishly, but luckily for him, the ball flies over Jasprit Bumrah at backward point and races to the fence behind him.

FOUR! Just liberates his arms, does the English skipper! Akash offers width outside off, on a good length, sits up nicely for Stokes. He hangs back and cuts it square to deep backward point for a boundary.
This one just jags back enough on a good length, around off. Ben Stokes stabs it on the pitch, off the back foot.
Hard length, skidding through, outside off. Joe Root lets the ball arrive and taps the ball to the left of cover for a single.
Cuts back in and on off, on a length. Root rises high and taps the ball on the pitch with soft hands.
Fuller delivery around off, Stokes pushes it straight to mid off.
Stokes is off the mark! Sliding on the pads, fuller in length, Stokes clips it to deep backward square leg for a couple of runs.

A real snorter! An appeal for caught behind from the slips, but Bumrah walks back to his bowling mark! In the channel on off, on a length. It lands and just straightens up a bit. Stokes brings his bat in front to defend, and is beaten all ends up.
Oh, a very close leave! Around the fourth stump line, on a fullish length. Ben Stokes opts to offer no shot as the ball nibbles away.
Good length, on the stumps. Joe Root gets it off the inner half of the bat as the ball rolls into the mid-wicket region for a single.
BEATEN! Just outside off, on a good length. Joe Root plays it away from the body and is beaten on the outside edge.
Stretches the length now. Goes full and on off, angling in. Stokes responds with a solid front foot block.
Bangs it hard on the surface, does Deep, on a length around off, Ben Stokes gets on the back foot and steers it to backward point.
Far and wide from the off stump, Stokes shows no interest to play at it.
Length-delivery, outside off, Stokes offers no shot at it.
Angles into the batter, on top of middle, Joe Root hops on the toes and nudges it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Shapes away from outside off, on a good length, Root prevents himself from fishing at it.
Good aggression from Bumrah! A sharp bumper, on top of off, Stokes arches back to let the ball pass behind to the keeper.

OUT! CASTLED! BOWLED! Jasprit Bumrah finally gets a wicket to his name after putting in the hard yards with the ball! Landed on a good length by Bumrah, just outside off and it just jags back in off the pitch, cutting Brook in half. Harry Brook draws his front foot out to block, but gets beaten on the inside edge as the ball sneaks past the bat to smash into the off pole. Third inning in a row, Brook has fallen to the nip-backer. Harry departs for 11 (20) and England are 172/4.
Harry Brook b J Bumrah 11 (20b 2x4 0x6)
Fuller and around off, making the batter play at it. Brook draws his front foot out and drives it straight to cover.
A bouncer, going down the leg stump line. Brook gets inside the line to leave. Jurel gathers it to his left.
Deviates in from off, on a fuller length. Brook leans on the ball and blocks it to cover.
Length-delivery, around off, Brook knocks it out to the off side.
Slides it into the batter, on middle and on a length. Root hangs back in the crease and blocks it back to Jadeja.
Pulls back the length by a few yards, outside off, Brook hangs deep in his crease and cuts it to deep point for a single.
Holds the line on the off stump, full in length, Brook drives it inside out, but straight to short cover.
Drops it fuller and around off, Brook with a gentle push to short cover.
Flat and quick, just outside off, Root drives it to deep cover for a single.
Nice and full, on off, blocked watchfully by Root.
Woah! A huge nip-backer on a good length, on middle. Harry Brook pushes at it, but plays over the wrong line and is rapped high on the thigh pad.
Fuller and around off, pushed to short cover by Brook.
Attacks the stumps, on a good length, Brook hangs in the crease and tucks it to mid on.
A sharp bouncer, on the leg stump. Brook ducks under it.
Back of a length again, on off and middle, Root works this across to the leg side for a single.

Oh, almost dragged on! Fortuitous for Root! Back of a length, nipping in from outside off. Root hangs back to punch it on the up, but inside edges just past the stumps for a couple of runs as the ball rolls to deep fine leg.
Short and outside off, cut away to deep point for one more.
Pushed through, outside off, Brook eases this full ball to deep cover for one.
Flatter and shorter, on off, Brook dabs it to backward point.

FOUR! Off the edge! Turning away, on a length, Brook plays it with soft hands as he looks to work it through the off side. The ball grips and spins away to catch the outside edge. It goes down on the ground as it bounces in front and goes right through gully and first slip for a boundary.
Short and a hint of turn, around off, Root presses back and punches it to deep point for a single.
Full and on off, Root blocks it out to silly point.

FOUR! Classic textbook shot! Right from the coach's manual! Bumrah offers some width outside off, on a fuller length. Harry Brook presses forward and caresses it through the cover region for a cracking boundary.
A yard behind fuller length, outside off, Root gets on the front foot and drives it along the ground to deep cover. An easy single.

Half a shout for caught behind but turned down! KL Rahul is confident but Jasprit Bumrah says he is not sure and Shubman Gill decides against the review. Dug in short by Bumrah, at the badge of the helmet, Root looks to ride the bounce and help the pull away. Tries to roll his wrists over the ball to keep the shot along the ground but misses and it is taken by Jurel to his left. The UltraEdge shows no spike when the ball is next to the bat.
Back of a length, just outside off, Root lets it be.
Aims the off pole, does Bumrah, on a fuller length, Root plays late and works it to point.
Over the stumps, full and around off, Joe Root drives it gently to short cover.

This goes straight on and is fired quicker on the leg stump line. Joe Root hangs back in the crease and punches it to the left of the cover fielder. Calls Brook through for a quick single. An excellent start for India and Jadeja right after the Tea break.
Brook gets off the mark! Pitched fuller and around off, Harry Brook drives it to deep cover for a single.
Drops it full and outside off, with a hint of turn away from the batter. Brook forces it with the spin to the point region.
Tosses it up, full and on middle, Brook leans on it and defends it.
Drags the length back, on middle, Brook opens up and blocks it off the back foot.

OUT! EDGED, AND GONE! CAUGHT BEHIND! First ball after the Tea break and Jadeja produces an important wicket for India! He starts from 'round the stumps and drifts the ball into the batter. Lands it full and on off, and gets a good bit of grip on the surface as it spins away from Pope. He presses forward to push it away to the off side, but he is a bit casual and tentative to do so and only manages to get an outside edge. Sharp work by Dhruv Jurel behind the sticks as he snaffles the catch. Ollie Pope departs for 44 (104) and England are 153/3.
Ollie Pope c sub Dhruv Jurel b Ravindra Jadeja 44 (104b 4x4 0x6)
Flatter delivery, drifting in and around off, Ollie Pope lunges forward and opens the bat face as he steers this through point for a single. And that will be TEA ON DAY 1!
Just a bit short of a full length, on middle, tucked into the mid-wicket region.
Fuller ball, on the stumps, Pope blocks it watchfully.
Drifts in and on middle, Ollie Pope defends it to the leg side.
Too full on middle, Root flicks it along the turf and milks a single at deep mid-wicket.
Flat and full, on the leg stump, Root clips it to square leg.
Grips away from off, on a fuller length, Pope manages to ease it to the off side with soft hands.
JAFFA! This one turns away from the fuller length, just around off. Ollie Pope leans on to defend but the ball bites away and beats the bat with some bounce.
Nicely tossed up, full and on middle, Joe Root carves it out to mid off and calls his partner through for a quick single.
Fuller delivery, outside off, Ollie Pope steers it through cover-point for a single. The 150 comes up for England!
Flighted delivery, full and on the stumps, Pope keeps it out to the off side.
Begins from around the stumps, does Jadeja. Lands it fuller and on middle. Ollie Pope lunges forward and taps it to the left of the bowler.
Straight and full, on off, Root presses ahead and blocks it right under the bat.
Short of a length, outside off, Ollie Pope steers it behind backward point for another easy single.

Just gets the ball to nibble it back, on middle and leg. Ollie Pope looks to flick it across, but gets a thick inside edge onto the front pad. The ball then rolls into the point region. Hands on his face for Akash Deep.
On off, on a length, defended back to the bowler by Pope.
Seaming into the batter, full and on leg, Ollie Pope flicks it wide of mid on for a couple runs as Sai Sudharsan chases it in the deep.

FOUR! Poor and gets the treatment! Another one strayed onto the pads, on a good length. Ollie Pope uses the pace of the ball and uses his wrists to tickle it away to the deep fine leg fence for a boundary. Pope too, moves into his 40s now. The 100-run stand comes up between Ollie and Root.
Full delivery, angled on middle and leg, Ollie Pope flicks this along the turf to deep square leg for a single.
Good length, outside off, Root rises with the bounce and cuts it to deep backward point for a single.
Length, on middle, worked to mid on.
Full, on the stumps, Joe taps the front foot out and pushes it to the left of mid on.

FOUR! A loosener from Nitish, and Root just helps it away! FIFTY FOR JOE ROOT! Yet another against India. His 67th overall in Test cricket. A classic inning from him so far. Nitish bangs it halfway on the pitch and strays it on the leg stump line. Joe Root gets inside the line and just tickles it towards the deep fine leg fence for a boundary. This is his second half century in this series.

Extra bounce! A bit more width offered, outside off on a good length. Joe Root covers the off stump and looks to cut it square, but the ball just lifts off the deck and passes above Root's angled bat.
Straight and full, outside off, Joe Root gets on the front foot to drive into the off side, but gets a thick inside edge, and the ball rolls towards the square leg region. They cross.
Seams into the batter, full in length, Pope flicks it wide of mid-wicket for a single.
FOUR! Pulled away neatly! Short of a good length, around the batter's chest level. Ollie Pope stands tall and comfortably pulls it through deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Getting a bit itchy here, is Pope! Full and around off, driven straight to cover.
Beaten all ends up! Hard length, shaping away from off, Ollie Pope misses to pull and the ball passes below the inside edge on the way to the keeper.

An appeal for caught behind, but Akash Deep himself signals that it came off the pad. The umpire too, is unmoved! A great take behind by Jurel, nonetheless. Angling down leg, on a length. Ollie Pope just gets a bit too across and tries to flick it. Misses to connect the ball and it brushes off the front pad on the way to the keeper. Dhruv Jurel puts a full stretched dive to the left and gathers the ball one-handed.
Pitched full and curling away a shy bit on off, Joe Root closes the bat's face early to flick and gets a leading edge to short cover, all along the turf.
Quite wide on off, on a length, left alone by Root.
Straight, full, and in front of the stumps, Root eases it to mid off.

FOUR! Root completes 3000 Test runs against India itself! A staggering stat for the premier English batter! A deft touch as he leans back on this length-delivery, around off. Plays the late cut and penetrates the gap between gully and backward point to craft a boundary.
Full and on the stumps, pushed gently down to mid on.

Lands it full and on off, Joe Root pushes it off the inner half of the bat to the right of Mohammed Siraj. He dives towards the ball and stops it. Holds his right leg and indicates some cramps. But he smiles it off and is fine to continue for now.
Fuller and fired on middle and leg, flicked across to short mid-wicket.

A loud appeal for LBW, but not entertained by the umpire. Akash asks the keeper, but gets no response from there as well. Gill, too, looks not quite convinced with it at the slips. Probably doing a bit too much on the height and hence, India do not opt for a review. Back of a length, around off and cutting back into the batter sharply. Pope is trapped in the crease as he is beaten on the inside edge. The ball hits him high on the back thigh pad.

Outside off, on a fullish length. Ollie Pope smashes it to the left of deep backward point. Abhimanyu Easwaran, the substitute fielder, intercepts it with a slide, keeping the batters to just two runs.
Full and on off, Root plays with a straight bat to defend, but the ball nips in slightly. It rolls off the inner half of the bat to the mid-wicket region. A single taken.
Short of a good length, on off, nipping in off the deck. Joe Root is caught in the crease, and gets an inside edge onto the front pad.

A bit too full and outside off, shaping away. Ollie Pope takes a huge stride across and gets on top of it. Drives it crisply through covers. It slows down on its way to the ropes and is cut off by the deep point fielder to his right. Three taken.
Good-length delivery, on middle and leg, Root tucks it across to short mid-wicket.
Straight and full, on off, Joe pushes it back to Nitish.

FOUR! Played with deft touch! Fuller delivery and just outside off, Root gets forward and opens the face of his blade pretty late. Guides the ball with soft hands, through gully and third slip for a boundary. Root moves into the 40s with this!
Just short of full, on top of off, Joe Root gets on the front foot and defends it with soft hands.
Overpitched and shaping away from middle, flicked by Root, straight to short mid-wicket.
Pitched fuller and on middle, Root blocks it to the leg side, just beside the pitch.
Tight line and length. Just on top of off, on a good length. Pope meets the ball right under his eyes and stabs it onto the pitch.
Angling on middle on a fuller length. Joe Root walks across the line and flicks it to deep mid-wicket for an easy single.
Fuller and just outside off, Joe Root leans on the front foot and drives it gently to mid off.
Back of a length, skidding off the deck, on off. Joe Root gets behind it and blocks it off the back foot.
Sprayed down leg, Root misses to glance it away.

Oh, nearly dragged on! A tempter from Akash, full and shaping away through the air, around off. Joe Root tries to drive it through the off side, but gets a thick inside edge and the ball dribbles over the stumps and rolls to the keeper behind.
Tails in and on the pads, on a length. Root misses to tuck it across and the ball rolls behind to the short fine leg region, off the front pad for a leg bye.
Good length, outside off, dabbed to the gully region.

Some lateral movement, outside off, on a yard behind fuller length. Ollie Pope gets forward to work it through the off side, but gets a thick outside edge and the ball goes on the bounce to Gill at gully. He dives to the left and makes a half stop. The ball is parried behind with the third slip fielder chasing it. A single taken.
Lands it full and outside off, Joe Root gets a big stride out and steers the ball through backward point for an easy single.
Back of a length, curving away from the batter. Root stays back, plays it late and cuts it to the gully region.
A gentle outswinger, full and on off, driven out by Root to short cover.
Closer to the off pole, on a good length. Joe Root lets the ball arrive, plays it late by opening the bat face on the back foot. Gets a single as the ball rolls through the point region.
Nice and full, swinging away late from outside off. Root shows no interest to have a go at it.
Just a bit of shape away from the batter, on a fuller length. Ollie Pope leans on and drives it to the left of Shubman Gill stationed at mid off. A single taken.
On a very tight line on a length, around middle and off. Ollie Pope watchfully taps it out to the right of the bowler.
Fuller and outside off, inviting the batter to play at it. Pope drives it to short cover.
Cuts back into the batter, on a length, on off. Ollie Pope is cramped for space as he looks to work to the leg side. Pope misses and is hit on the back thigh pad.
Similar line and length, Root does the same. Offers no shot at it.
Moves away from off, on a length. Root leaves.

Too full, outside off, Joe Root carves it off the toe end of the bat. Nitish Kumar Reddy collects it on the bounce by leaping in the air. Throws the ball to the stumps at the batting end, but Root never left the crease.
Full again, around off, Root gets a good stride out, and drives it straight to the short cover fielder.
Outswinger, outside off and full. Root drives it to the short cover fielder who makes a half stop diving to his right. The ball is parried to the mid off region.
Back of a length, shapes away from outside off. Pope knocks it on the rise, and through cover for a single.
Moving back into the batter, on off and the length stays full, Root blocks it out with his bat close to the front pad.
Brings the ball into the right-hander, on the fuller length, on the off stump, Root brings his bat out in front and taps it to mid on.
Around off, moving away late, on a good length, Root glides it towards gully.
FOUR LEG BYES! Slanting back into the right-hander, on the pads, Root fails to get any bat on the tickle. The ball clips the pads and beats Dhruv Jurel to his left.
On a short of a length, around off, Joe waits back and pats it down on the off side.

FOUR! Class written all over it! Full and swinging away, Joe Root cashes in on the width. Presses forward and lets his hands flow into the shot. Gets it through cover-point and the ball wins the race against Ravindra Jadeja.

Did that carry? On a back of a length, around off, Ollie Pope flashes at the delivery but due to the slow nature of the surface, the outside edge does not carry. It drops short of Yashasvi Jaiswal at gully.
On a short of a length, outside off, Ollie Pope does not commit to the cut and gets a bottom edge that dribbles towards the slip cordon.

Full and around leg, Root brings his wrists into play and picks it up off his pads. Clips it to the right of mind on. Akash Deep gives it a chase and hauls it in. Three runs taken. 100 comes up for England!
Drags the length back, outside off, Joe Root gets on his toes and knocks it wide of cover. Ollie Pope wants to sneak in a single but Joe sends him back.
Goes slightly fuller and moving away in the air, outside off, Root is tentative on the drive. Gets it off the toe end towards cover.
Reddy is back into the attack. On a good length, shaping away, on the off stump, Root covers the line and dabs it down the deck.
Fuller in length, outside off, Ollie Pope extends his hands into the drive and eases it through covers for a couple.
Beaten! Not that short or wide for the cut, seaming back in, just outside the off stump, Pope is beaten on the cut as the ball sneaks under the blade.
On top of off, on a nagging length, Pope defends it right under his eyes.
On off, blocked out off the front foot.

Risky single! On middle, on a nagging length, Root turns it towards mid-wicket. Yashasvi Jaiswal slides to his right there. Stays on his knees and fires in a throw at the batting end. The throw is poor and lacks the accuracy. Pope makes his ground with a dive.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Joe Root shoulders arms.
Tailing back in from wide of the crease, on a good length, on off, Ollie Pope plays it towards mid off.
There comes the yorker from Bumrah, seemed to be the slower one, on middle, Ollie Pope jams it out to mid-wicket.
Digs it in on a hard length, over off, Ollie gets on top of the bounce and steers it towards gully where Nitish Kumar Reddy makes a sharp stop to his left.
Moving away off the deck, on a good length, outside off, Root is deep in the crease and taps it wide of cover for a run.
Lands it on a length, outside off, Ollie Pope pushes a bit away from his body to deep point for a single. The 50-run stand comes up between these two batters.

Two byes! Jasprit Bumrah gets the line wrong and sprays a full ball, down leg, Ollie Pope misses the tickle. Rishabh Pant dives to his left and gets a hand to it. The ball deflects off the gloves towards deep fine leg. Karun Nair from first slip goes after it and pulls it back before the ropes. Pope was keen for the third but Root was wise to say no.
Keeps it outside the off stump, a hint of away movement, Root plants his front foot across and tilts forward to dab it down on the off side.
On a nagging length, just outside the off stump, Root lets the ball come to him and defends it right under his eyes.
Fuller in length, outside off, Root does not move his feet at all and just drives it with his hands. Picks out the man at cover.
Slanting back into the right-hander, on a back of a length, on the off stump, Root stands tall and stabs it down the deck.
On a short of a length, on middle, Ollie turns it through square leg for a single.

Sharp stop! In the corridor of off, on a length, a hint of away shape, Ollie Pope plays it with a slightly open bat face. Guides it towards gully where Nitish Kumar Reddy dives to his right and keeps Pope on strike.

Finally, a run after 28 dot balls in a row! Bumrah nails the yorker, tailing back in, at the toes, Pope hurriedly gets his bat down and squeezes it out to the left of mid-wicket. The fielder there dives to his left and parries it towards mid on. Single taken.
On off, on a length, Ollie Pope jabs at the ball and gets it off the outer half towards backward point.

There is the loose shot! Sign of the pressure building. Fuller in length, going away from the batter, Ollie Pope goes fishing at the delivery and is lucky not to nick it behind. Rishabh Pant mops it up low with a dive to his right.
Went wide on the crease, on a good length, Ollie Pope gets a good stride in and knocks it to cover. 26 dot balls in a row. Wow!
Nipping back in, on a back of a length, around leg, Ollie Pope waits on the back foot to work it behind square with the angle. Gets beaten on the inside edge and gets hit on the thigh pad.
Pitched up, outside off, Ollie drives well but can' get it past the man at cover.
Beaten again! Tighter line, closer to the batter, outside the off stump, on a nagging length, Root looks to run it down with an open bat face but misses.

A false shot but Root gets away with it! Siraj bashes the hard length and Joe is lured into the shot due to the width. Root fiddles at the delivery well away from his body and gets beaten all ends up. Siraj has a smile on his face and directs a few words at the batter.
Outside off, on a good length, Root makes the leave.
On a hard length, on off, stabbed down on the off side.

On a back of a length, on middle, Root sets up for the pull but the ball does not rise as much as Joe expected it to. Sneaks under the blade and catches the former English skipper high on the back thigh. Siraj with an exchange of words with Root.
Siraj goes full and the ball moves away a bit, outside off, Root presses forward for the drive. Miscues it off the inner half to square leg.
Half a shout for caught behind! Banged in short but down leg, Ollie Pope swivels but fails to get any bat on the pull. An acrobatic dive by Rishabh Pant to his left to gather it.
On a back of a length, outside off, Ollie Pope shoulders arms. 'No more entertaining cricket' is the chirp from Shubman Gill from the slip cordon.
Slanting into the right-hander, on a length, on middle and leg, Ollie Pope is a bit late on the flick. Ekes out an inside edge onto the right-hander.

Beaten! From wide of the crease, Bumrah creates the angle down the hill, on a good length, Ollie Pope is drawn forward and defends in front of his body. The ball straightens off the deck to go past the outside edge.
Bends his back and bangs it short and on top of off, Ollie Pope pulls it to short mid-wicket.
Pitched on a length, outside off, Pope gets on the front foot to make the leave.

Lands it on a short of a length, on the line of the off stump, Root walks across and pushes it down the deck. Siraj collects it with his right hand on his follow-through and looking at Root batting out of his crease, he has a shy at the batting end. Root gets back and the throw goes over the stumps.
On the fuller side, shaping away, on the off stump, Root is drawn forward in defence.
Seaming away, on a good length, around off, Root presents a straight bat to play it down the ground. Gets it off the outer half towards gully.
Hits the deck hard, on middle, on a short of a good length, Root hops back and works it to square leg.
In the corridor on off, on a back of a length, Root stays on the back foot and steers it with an open bat face to backward point.
Delivers it on a short of a length, around off, Joe gets on top of the bounce and pushes it to cover.
On off, on a length, Ollie pats it back to Bumrah with a straight bat.
Nibbling away off the deck, on a good length, a bit too wide to make the batter play. An easy leave for Pope.
Banged in short by Bumrah but the line is well down leg, Ollie Pope lets it go. Rishabh Pant leaps to his left and gathers it with his left glove.
Hurls it in the channel on off, on a good length, left alone by Pope.
Just outside off, on a length, Ollie Pope tentatively defends a bit away from his body.

Angling in and then it straightens off the deck, on a length, on off and middle, Root looks to turn it away with a closed bat face towards the leg side. Gets a soft leading edge wide of cover for a single.
On off, on a length, Ollie gets behind the line and blocks it out.

Jagging back in, on a good length, on off, Ollie Pope presents a straight bat for the block. Ekes out an inside edge for the block and the ball gets stuck in the flap of the front pad. Pope quickly takes the ball in his gloves and drops it down on the deck, aware of the fact that Siraj was charging towards him.

Bye! Sliding down leg, on a short of a length, Joe misses out on the tickle. Rishabh Pant moves to his left but does not quite get low enough to gather it. The ball clips his fingertips and rolls behind for a bye.
